title: After Long Road, Nothing Left to Do but Win
description: LONDON  Oscar Pistorius rocked back and forth near the start line Saturday as the public-address announcer introduced him as the Blade Runner. An Olympic Stadium camera cooperated by panning to the pair of carbon-fiber prosthetics that he wore with his track suit.

title: More Preseason Hype: Baldinger Calls Sparano Offense a Joke
description: Dont count the NFL Networks Brian Baldinger as a fan of the Jets changes on offense.

title: The Weekend Word: Back to School
description: Todays Times

title: In an Ailing Continent, Its Staycation Time for Europes Politicians
description: LONDON  Europe has reached the height of the summer vacation season and its political leaders, out of deference to their cash-strapped constituents, are taking their annual breaks close to home  at least in theory.

title: A Valued Adjunct to the U.S. Sailing Team
description: Doug Charko is the meteorologist for the United States sailing team, which is no easy job here on the rainy and sunny, cloudy and clear, windy and still southwest coast of England.

title: M.L.S. and NBCSN Give Birth to Ratings
description: The games  not the Games, but Major League Soccer games  made a quiet debut on the newly launched NBC Sports Network in March. New season, new channel. And like many new cable TV endeavors, it often takes some time to build what the biztypes call synergy.

title: Newswallah: Bharat Edition
description: Jammu and Kashmir: The Border Security Forces, or BSF, in the Samba district of Jammu discovered a tunnel below a border fence between India and Pakistan, NDTV reported. The tunnel, 25 feet below ground, was discovered after an area caved in near a BSF outpost, due to rains, according to the report.

title: Competitive Armchair Olympics: Flipper
description: Make clockwise circles with your mouse to keep the diver in the air.

title: Merritt Out of 400 With Injury
description: LONDON  LaShawn Merritt, the reigning Olympic champion in the 400 meters who had made a comeback from an unusual doping suspension, pulled up with a hamstring injury Saturday in a preliminary heat.

title: Live: Williams Dominates to Win Gold
description: Two of the greatest players of the past decade, No. 3 Maria Sharapova and No. 4 Serena Williams, played for the gold medal in womens singles at the Olympics in London on Saturday, but it was not ever close. Williams routed Sharapova 6-0, 6-1.

title: Why D.C. Is Doing So Well
description: Washington

title: Craving Energy and Glory, Pakistan Revels in Boast of Water-Run Car
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  In a nation thirsting for energy, he loomed like a messiah: a small-town engineer who claimed he could run a car on water.

title: Plan to Speed Travel With Toll Road in Maine Hits a Nerve
description: CHARLESTON, Me.  Central Maine is so vast and so empty, with so few roads, that it has given rise to a classic bit of New England humor. An old Yankee is asked for directions, whereupon he replies, You cant get there from here.

title: U.S. Officials Brace for Huge Task of Operating Health Exchanges
description: WASHINGTON  Obama administration officials are getting ready to set up and operate new health insurance markets in about half the states, where local officials appear unwilling or unable to do so.

title: With the Pieces Now in Place, the Eagles Try Again
description: BETHLEHEM, PA.

title: He May Be Leader of Peru, but to Outspoken Kin, Hes Just a Disappointment
description: LIMA, Peru  Presidents everywhere are criticized by those they lead, but President Ollanta Humala of Peru may be unique in that some of his fiercest detractors are his own flesh and blood, including his brothers, sisters, cousins and, chief among them, his voluble father, Isaac.

title: Lucrative Gambling Pits Tribe Against Tribe
description: OROVILLE, Calif.  A pitted gravel road snakes through the forest to the Enterprise Rancheria of the Maidu Indians sole piece of tribal land about 15 miles east of here in the Sierra Nevada foothills. Broken trailers and a hot tub rejiggered to irrigate a garden sit in a clearing, the few acres of flat land where a handful of people live in houses in disrepair.

title: In a Close Game, the United States Beats Lithuania
description: LONDON  Midway through the fourth quarter Saturday, the players who lined the bench for USA Basketballs mens national team wore looks of genuine concern. They fiddled with towels and yelled encouragement to teammates, which, for the first time in a really long time, was actually necessary.

title: Not Quite Incredible (Yet), Hulk Hopes to Spark Brazil
description: NEWCASTLE UPON TYNE, England  The most talented player on the Brazil mens soccer team may well be the waifish wizard named after his father, but the most intriguing is surely the square-jawed giant named for a comic book character.

title: Variety: Twice Removed
description: SECOND SUNDAY PUZZLE  This was brutal. For me, at least. You might have done better than I did. Im not even going to tell you how many I got on my own. It wasnt pretty, Ill tell you that much.

title: Orlando City Moves Quietly Toward M.L.S.
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  It has been five months since Major League Soccer Commissioner Don Garber visited Orlando to discuss the citys prospects as a future M.L.S. market with the Orlando City club and local political leaders.

title: State Department and Pentagon Plan for Post-Assad Syria
description: WASHINGTON  Even with fighting raging in Syria and President Bashar al-Assad digging in, the State Department and Pentagon are quietly sharpening plans to cope with a flood of refugees, help maintain basic health and municipal services, restart a shattered economy and avoid a security vacuum in the wake of Mr. Assads fall, administration officials say.

title: Williams Coasts to Gold, and a Career Golden Slam
description: LONDON  It was Saturday afternoon at Wimbledon, and Serena Williams, Olympic gold medal already around her neck, spotted Bob and Mike Bryan heading off to try to get their own.

title: An Automaker Migrates to Tennessee
description: Beginning with a single, midsize factory making compact pickup trucks, Nissan grew into an industrial power in the United States.

title: Obama Turns 51 With a Birthday Round of Golf
description: President Obama celebrated his birthday on Saturday with a quiet round of golf at Andrews Air Force Base, to be followed by a family getaway to Camp David.

title: Intensified Syrian Fighting Reported in Battles for Damascus and Aleppo
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Explosions and heavy fighting rocked Syrias two largest cities on Saturday, witnesses and activists said, as the Syrian government and rebel fighters struggled to gain an advantage in the countrys bloody, 17-month-old conflict.

title: Two Top Afghan Security Ministers Face Dismissal
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Afghan Parliament voted Saturday to dismiss the two most powerful members of President Hamid Karzais security team, a surprise move that could create new turmoil as the United States-led coalition prepares to leave the country.

title: U.S. Shooter Wins Gold, Setting Olympic Records
description: LONDON  It was going to take a lot of bling to deflect attention from the brilliance of Michael Phelps, who won his sixth medal and fourth gold of the London Games on Saturday in his fourth and final Olympics. His United States teammates on the womens 4x100-meter medley relay had the credentials to pull it off. Missy Franklin, Rebecca Soni, Dana Vollmer and Allison Schmitt took a combined five individual golds and two silvers into the final, and they left London Aquatics Centre for the last time with a world record and a relay gold.

title: Evolution of a Manufacturing Supply Chain
description: Executives in the electronics industry often say that popular devices cant be made in the United States largely because it would be too costly and inefficient. But in another industry, foreign auto companies have grown over the last 30 years to account for over 40 percent of vehicles built here.

title: The British Gift to American Letters
description: BATH, England

title: Where Indoors Can Become Too Much Like Outdoors
description: PHOENIX  The Sandra Day OConnor Federal Courthouse here is a visual triumph of modern architecture. Designed by the acclaimed architect Richard Meier, it is a sleek steel and glass structure of impressive dimensions and design whose undulating roof resembles, from a distance, an approaching jagged wave  a sort of apparition in a city in the desert.

title: In Pursuit of Nissan, a Jobs Lesson for the Tech Industry?
description: SMYRNA, Tenn.  The dairy farms that once draped the countryside here were paved over so the Japanese carmaker Nissan could build its first American assembly plant. Eighty miles to the south, another green pasture was replaced by a Nissan engine factory, and across Tennessee about 100 Nissan suppliers dot the landscape, making steel in Murfreesboro, air conditioning units in Lewisburg, transmission parts in Portland.

title: Copying Obamas 08 Strategy, Romney Takes to the Ground in Colorado
description: LAKEWOOD, Colo.  In an office park with clipped lawns and burbling fountains, volunteers at Mitt Romneys new Colorado headquarters were busy working the phones. Do you approve of President Obama, they asked voters. Are you voting Democratic or Republican? Every time they tallied a new Romney supporter, they dinged a bell.

title: The Greatest Olympian in History Isnt Michael Phelps
description: Our colleague William C. Rhoden on who, for his money, is the greatest Olympian  and still champion of all time.

title: The Pivot: The Move of the Moment
description: ITS an election year, and you cant watch a political news show or wade through a piece of punditry without running into the clich of the moment. The pivot is that clich, the Macarena of 2012.

title: Gotye
description: Wouter De Backer, known as Gotye, is a Flemish-Australian singer and songwriter whose quirky breakup anthem, Somebody That I Used to Know, has been inescapable this summer.

title: Turkey Retires Charged Commanders
description: The Turkish military has retired all 40 generals and admirals currently on trial on charges of plotting to overthrow the Muslim-led government, Turkish officials said Saturday, in the latest move by the government to tame the once indomitable army.

title: Two Sudans Reach Deal on Fees for Oil Pipelines
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Sudan and South Sudan have reached a deal on oil pipeline fees, a highly divisive issue that nearly drove the two countries to war this year, African Union officials announced Saturday.

title: High Winds and Drought Fuel Oklahoma Wildfires
description: Firefighters in Oklahoma struggled on Saturday to contain at least a dozen wildfires that have burned more than 80,000 acres near Oklahoma City.

title: Heptathlete Is Face of the Olympics in Britain
description: LONDON  The fans packed into Olympic Stadium, often sitting in the cold and rain, eagerly watching the women run, leap and throw over two days. Some wore paper Jessica Ennis masks, hurled their arms into the air and gritted their teeth as she threw the shot-put or the javelin. Others clapped furiously, and more than once, I love you, Jessica! could be heard in the stands.

title: Auto Crrect Ths!
description: I MENTION a certain writer in an e-mail, and the reply comes back: Comcast McCarthy??? Phoner novelist??? Did I really type Comcast? No. The great god Autocorrect has struck again.

title: The Love Goddess Who Keeps Right on Seducing
description: MIKE NICHOLS claims he called Marilyn Monroe to work on a scene.

title: New Zealand Field Hockey Eliminates U.S.
description: Disappointment hit the United States womens field hockey team on Saturday, as it lost to New Zealand, 3-2. The Americans had had high hopes of at least contending for a medal here, based on an improving offense, a notably rugged defense and one of the worlds best goalkeepers in Amy Tran-Swensen.

title: Serena Williams, Close to Perfect
description: On a bright, blustery day on Centre Court in London, Serena Williams dominated Maria Sharapova 6-0, 6-1 to win the Olympic gold medal in womens singles. The breezy conditions scarcely bothered Williams, as she served and returned with power, disguise, and fearlessness. Williams pounded a thunderous ace up the T on match point, then let out a celebratory yell as the ball thumped into the backstop. It was her 60th ace of the tournament.

title: Living, Thinking Houses
description: In the sizzling summer heat Ive been thinking about igloos. To chill out in, of course, but also because I admire their elemental simplicity. Inuits traditionally used bone knives to carve bricks from quarries of hardened snow. A short, low tunnel led to the front door, trapping heat in and keeping out fierce cold and critters. Mortar wasnt needed, because the snow bricks were shaved to fit, and at night the dome ossified into a glistening ice fort. The human warmth inside melted the ice just enough to seal the seams.

title: Sunday Dialogue: Harm, No Foul
description: How some crimes of the elite are not prosecuted, and why.

title: Truculence Before Truth
description: FOR the dwindling few out there who still believe that big accusations require a little foundation and that truth  as opposed to conjecture  matters, heres an update:

title: Marcus Samuelsson, a Chef, a Brand and Then Some
description: MARCUS SAMUELSSON, dapper in a Ralph Lauren tuxedo and patterned scarf, is working the celebrity-couture crowd at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Claim of Responsibility in Russia Attack
description: MOSCOW  A self-described guerrilla fighter urging strict adherence to Islamic law has claimed responsibility for the killing last month of one Muslim leader and the attempted murder of another, in Tatarstan, a region in central Russia that prides itself on a tradition of religious tolerance.

title: Is It Hot Enough for Ya?
description: CLIMATE change is hardly a seasonal issue, but summer is the only time of year when Americans and the news media regularly fix their attention on the everyday heat emergency thats already altering life on our planet. Indeed, this summers record-shattering weather across the United States has created a heightened level of interest in and concern about the consequences of climate change.

title: Israels Fading Democracy
description: Jerusalem

title: With One Last Gold, Phelps Caps Career That Inspired a Generation
description: LONDON  One by one, his rivals formed a handshake line behind the blocks at London Aquatics Centre and paid homage to Michael Phelps, the lord of the Olympic rings. In his racing finale on Saturday night, as a member of the United States mens 4x100-meter medley relay, Phelps collected his 22nd medal, and 18th gold.

title: Muslim Hotel Owner in California Defends Herself Against Anti-Semitism Charge
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif.  The Hotel Shangri-La, an Art Deco palace on a bluff next to the Pacific Ocean, looks the way Los Angeles is supposed to look but mostly doesnt: its exterior is bright white, with rounded corners, glass tiles and upper-story railings. Its look is matched by its lore, a Hollywood haunt where Bill Clinton and Tom Cruise have been spotted among the guests and where a favorite story has it that Sean Penn courted Madonna.

title: Americas Megawatt Sweetheart
description: LONDON  Gabby Douglas, the newly minted American sweetheart and Olympic champion in the all-around, returned to the athletes village on Thursday to end her night by doing what every teenager would do: She Googled herself.

title: Police Protection, Please, for Municipal Bonds
description: YOUVE got the power. Why not use it?

title: Internet Pirates Will Always Win
description: STOPPING online piracy is like playing the worlds largest game of Whac-A-Mole.

title: Tell Me Your Idea (and Dont Mind the Silly Putty)
description: This interview with  Laurel J. Richie, president of the W.N.B.A., was conducted and edited by  Adam Bryant.

title: Competitive Armchair Olympics: Road Kill
description: Score: 0

title: Dont Fear the Cybermind
description: THE line that separates my mind from the Internet is getting blurry. This has been happening ever since I realized how often it feels as though I know something just because I can find it with Google. Technically, of course, I dont know it. But when theres a smartphone or iPad in reach, I know everything the Internet knows. Or at least, thats how it feels.

title: If the Name Gets in the Way, Change It
description: IN December 2008, Georgette Kaplan and her two daughters, Stephanie and Jamie, felt as if they were receiving a wonderful holiday gift.

title: If Kant Were a New York Cyclist
description: THE rule-breaking cyclist that people decry: thats me. I routinely run red lights, and so do you. I flout the law when Im on my bike; you do it when you are on foot, at least if you are like most New Yorkers. My behavior vexes pedestrians, drivers and even some of my fellow cyclists. Similar conduct has stuck cyclists with tickets and court-ordered biking education classes.

title: As Syria War Roils, Unrest Among Sects Hits Turkey
description: ANTAKYA, Turkey  At 1 a.m. last Sunday, in the farming town of Surgu, about six hours away from here, a mob formed at the Evli familys door.

title: After Three Routs, a Late Escape
description: LONDON  Lithuania did not get the memo.

title: Raising Successful Children
description: PHRASES like tiger mom and helicopter parent have made their way into everyday language. But does overparenting hurt, or help?

title: For Lolo Jones, Everything Is Image
description: LONDON  Judging from this years performances, Lolo Jones seems to have only a slim chance of winning an Olympic medal in the 100-meter hurdles and almost no possibility of winning gold.

title: Letting the Cloud Watch Over the Farm
description: THE world doesnt necessarily need the gazillion-and-one games that seem available on smartphones. But it could use more apps and services that address the needs of business people with specialized needs. Like farmers.

title: Marcus Samuelssons Expanding Empire
description: Marcus Samuelsson has a solid gold hit in his restaurant, Red Rooster Harlem. The venue, however, is just one of a smorgasbord of developing ventures that the chef hopes will help to grow his brand.

title: The Power of Negative Thinking
description: Editors note: Were resurfacing this story from the archives because who wouldnt want to master their emotions?

title: With Relay Victory in His Final Race, Phelps Claims 18th Gold
description: LONDON  Michael Phelps stepped out of an Olympic pool for the final time on Saturday night, but not before earning one last gold medal.

title: Luck vs. Skill: Seeking the Secret of Your Success
description: THERE may be no topic that more reliably divides liberals and conservatives than the relationship between success and luck. Many conservatives celebrate market success as an almost inevitable consequence of talent and effort. Liberals, by contrast, like to remind us that even talented people who work hard sometimes fall on hard times through no fault of their own.

title: Wanting to Kill
description: I REMEMBER the phone call from my mother distinctly. It came in February of 1980. I was 19, a high school dropout working as a tool-and-die apprentice, living in my hometown of Bridgeport, Conn.

title: Mr. Negative vs. Mr. Complacent
description: DURING the dog days of last summers debt ceiling negotiations, with Washington gridlocked and the presidents approval ratings slumping, a narrative coalesced among disappointed liberals. President Obama was failing, they decided, because he was too moderate, too reasonable and too conciliatory. He didnt have the ideological confidence required to actually fight for liberalism, or the brazenness required to really tear the Republicans apart.

title: Two Central Banks and the Sound of Silence
description: WHEN is no news big news? When central bankers, confronted by a crisis in this post-Lehman world, convene and take no action.

title: Get It Right on Gas
description: WE are in the midst of a natural gas revolution in America that is a potential game changer for the economy, environment and our national security  if we do it right.

title: Finding the Price of Fairness
description: KENNETH R. FEINBERG, who styles himself as a lawyer and mediator in one, has made a career of handling hot potatoes and moving them from politicians plates to his own. At moments of national disaster, he has embraced the trying task of applying mere money to sustain and comfort the survivors and to bind the wounds of the afflicted.

title: At Last, a Medal for Guatemala
description: LONDON  History was made in the 20-kilometer racewalk Saturday: Guatemala finally won a medal.

title: At the Right Intersection
description: IM a fifth-generation Texan, named after my grandfather, Bert. But I didnt know my real name until kindergarten. My family used to call me Bertito, which means Little Bert in Spanish. Then they shortened it to Tito, so when the teacher called the roll and said Bert, I didnt know she meant me.

title: The Remains of a Home for the Mentally Ill
description: The Kings Park Psychiatric Center on Long Island was shut down in 1996, after treating patients for over a century.

title: Erasing the Past at the Ghost Hospital
description: KINGS PARK, N.Y.

title: The Trek From Performer to Producer
description: FROM a very young age I remember dancing around our family living room in Montebello, Calif., to the music of Harry Belafonte and Miriam Makeba, inspired by my parents love of world arts and culture.

title: Massachusetts Takes On Health Costs
description: Give Massachusetts credit for setting audacious health care goals. It took the lead in guaranteeing near-universal health insurance coverage for its residents, providing a template for the federal reforms to follow.

title: Too Many Prisoners
description: The Justice Department in its recent annual report on federal sentencing issues wisely acknowledged that public safety can be maximized without maximizing prison spending. As it noted, the growing federal prison population, now more than 218,000 inmates, and a prison budget of almost $6.2 billion are incompatible with a balanced crime policy and are unsustainable.

title: Letters: When Tax Rates Touched the Sky
description: To the Editor:

title: Working While Sick
description: More than 40 million American workers get no paid sick leave. They have to work when ill or take unpaid sick days, which can lead to financial hardship, or, worse, dismissal. The best way to address this workplace and public health problem is with a national law requiring businesses to provide paid sick leave  a normal benefit for workers in at least 145 countries.

title: Feeling Right, Finally
description: BOSTON  Justin Morneau batted cleanup here Thursday for the Minnesota Twins. He had two hits off a left-hander, including an opposite-field double, and the Twins pitchers shut out the Boston Red Sox. It was something like a perfect day, once routine, now precious.

title: Competitive Armchair Olympics: One on One
description: You: 0 Kobe:0

title: At London Games, This Is Ftbol
description: It looked like any other ftbol game  thousands of chanting fans packed into a picturesque stadium. The constant roar of the crowd provided the soundtrack for a show, taking place below on the perfect green grass. When the camera panned the field, however, ponytails were in abundance (and, no, it was not Zlatan Ibrahimovic, Philippe Mexes, Martin Caceres and Ronaldinho kicking around).

title: Pictures of the Day From London | August 4, 2012
description: The ninth day of the London Olympics.

title: Success in Japan, New Test in China
description: The Japanese womens national team is the reigning World Cup champion. It beat Brazil on Friday to advance to the semifinals at the London Games.

title: Competitive Armchair Olympics: Sundowner
description: Click to goodnight.

title: Traveling in a Car-Free Zone
Mariners Hernandez Stifles Yankees in Shutout
description: Felix Hernandez raised his arms and kissed the italicized names tattooed on each of his wrists  the left one for his son, Jeremy; the right one for his daughter, Mia. He first pitched in the Bronx as a 21-year-old in 2007, before the tattoos, but the posture and pose of a dominating performance have since become familiar.

title: Raising a Future Olympian? What Are the Odds?
description: LEEDS, England  Like any parent watching the Olympics, I have often wondered if I might someday see my child wearing the national colors while standing on a medal podium. When my wife informed me the other day that our 2-year-old daughter had climbed out of her crib for the first time  sticking the landing as well, it seems  my curiosity was piqued even further.

title: Challenging Batters and Physics Experts Alike
description: On April 29, 2011, in the first inning against the Toronto Blue Jays, the Yankees right-hander Freddy Garcia threw a low split-finger fastball to Juan Rivera that struck him out swinging.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, Aug. 5
description: The latest unemployment report offered a mixed bag on the economy with stronger than expected job growth combined with a small uptick in the jobless rate.Lawmakers from both parties will stop by the Sunday shows at the beginning of a five-week Congressional vacation to discuss the long list of unresolved issues and what the economic numbers mean for the presidential campaign.

title: For Umenyiora, Contentment at Last
description: ALBANY  They laughed at Jerry Reese when he drafted Osi Umenyiora in 2003. Who was Umenyiora, the news media wondered, and why was he selected in the second round  56th over all out of tiny Troy State?

title: Round One in Sprints to Jamaica; Briton Takes 10,000
description: LONDON  Heading into the Olympics, Americas top sprinters were determined to break the Jamaican stranglehold on the 100 meters. Jamaicas women swept the event four years ago, and the United States had won only one medal in the womens 100 in the last three Olympics. Usain Bolt personifies his countrys dominance as the worlds fastest man.

title: Before Sprints at Olympic Track, Sitting Down at the Table
description: LONDON  If food is the fuel of the human body, what do the worlds fastest men consume right before they race?

title: Battling for Aleppo and Damascus
description: Fighting continues to rage in two of the countrys major cities.

title: 30 Seconds With David Robinson: The Stuff Dreams Are Made Of
description: David Robinson played his entire 14-year N.B.A. career with San Antonio and helped the Spurs win two championships. A 10-time All-Star who was inducted into the Basketball Hall of Fame in 2009, he was also a three-time Olympian, winning two gold medals and one bronze with the United States team.

title: Single-Minded
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  Sometimes, when youre just starting out in life, or when things arent quite working out the way you wished, you have to be grateful for what you have. Even if its just one thing.

title: Letter to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Emerging Prodigy Amasses Trophies to Go With Her Toys
description: VALRICO, Fla.  Latanna Stone was looking at her Facebook page again, her cherub face hidden behind her iPhone and its Hello Kitty protective cover.

title: From Darkness of Munich Olympics, Moments of Clarity
description: Our family trip to Cleveland for Monday nights Indians game would ordinarily prompt a historical detour, perhaps to the site of League Park, where the Bill Wambsganss-era Indians played. Instead, I can stomach only a David Berger tour now.

title: From the 902nd Pick to the Major Leagues
description: SAN DIEGO  The quick ascension of Josh Edgin will continue with yet another unlikely upswing.

title: Primer: Rousseff and Brazils Dark Past
description: Simon Romero, the New York Times bureau chief in Brazil, previews his article on Dilma Rousseff, Brazils president and a former guerrilla, and how the country is dealing with its past.

title: Less Practice Equals More Medals for U.S. Diving Team
description: LONDON  Who knew the best way to end a medal drought was to focus on winning them two at a time?

title: Rangers Resist Pressure to Trade Top Prospects
description: His division rival had just traded for the best pitcher on the trade market, but Jon Daniels, the general manager of the Texas Rangers, went ahead with a question-and-answer session with fans last weekend. Instead of criticism, though, he found support. One fan, who said he spoke for all the rest, thanked Daniels for not selling the farm.

title: Aug. 4: Likely No New Blue States in November
description: Saturday was a light day for polling, with only the national tracking polls and a South Dakota poll out; our forecast was essentially unchanged.

title: Speedsters Late Arrival to the Tigers
description: When Quintin Berry showed up at Detroit Tigers spring training this year, playing for his fifth organization in three years, Alex Avila knew who he was. Berry had never played in the majors, and had only four career games above Class AA. But he had made an impression at that level.

title: Michael Phelps Wins 22nd Olympic Medal
description: On Saturday, Michael Phelps collected his 22nd medal, and 18th gold, in his racing finale, the United States mens 4 x 100 medley relay.

title: Man Suspected of Faking His Death Has Returned to New York, Officials Say
description: Officials investigating the disappearance of a Long Island man who seemed to try to fake his own death last week said on Saturday that he had returned to New York, but that they had not decided whether to charge him with a crime.

title: Financing a Race
description: Where the roughly $400 million spent by the Obama campaign and the Democratic National Committee since the beginning of last year has gone:

title: Record Spending by Obamas Camp Shrinks Coffers
description: President Obama has spent more campaign cash more quickly than any incumbent in recent history, betting that heavy early investments in personnel, field offices and a high-tech campaign infrastructure will propel him to victory in November.

title: U.S. Women Set Mark in Medley Relay
description: LONDON  It was going to take a lot of bling to deflect attention from the brilliance of Michael Phelps, who won his sixth medal and fourth gold of the London Games on Saturday in his fourth and final Olympics. His United States teammates on the womens 4x100-meter medley relay had the credentials to pull it off. Missy Franklin, Rebecca Soni, Dana Vollmer and Allison Schmitt took a combined five individual golds and two silvers into the final, and they left London Aquatics Centre for the last time with a world record and a relay gold.

title: Making a Pitch to the Tea Party in Indiana
description: EVANSVILLE, Ind.  When Mitt Romney campaigned last week at one stop in Colorado, a key swing state whose governor and senators are Democrats, he sought to sell himself with a simple message: He is a deal maker, someone who can work with Democrats and reach across the aisle, as he did when he was the governor of Massachusetts.

title: Furyk Clings to One-Shot Lead at Firestone
description: AKRON, Ohio  Jim Furyk had the worst of his three rounds at the W.G.C.-Bridgestone Invitational on Saturday, yet he enters the final round with the lead  barely.

title: Florence Waren, Jewish Dancer Who Resisted Nazis, Dies at 95
description: Even in the depths of war in occupied France, Florence Waren and Frederic Apcar  or Florence et Frederic, as they were billed  dazzled Paris, he in tails, she in jeweled gowns with flowers in her hair, the two of them gliding and swirling across the stage as one of the most famous ballroom-dance teams in Europe.

title: Mars Missions Fate Rests on Landing
description: PASADENA, Calif.  The future of NASAs exploration of Mars now comes down to a struggle between gravity and a half-million lines of computer code.

title: A Record Day for Swimming
description: Michael Phelps wins his 22nd medal and the American womens team sets a world record in the medley relay.

title: Mary Louise Rasmuson, Who Led Womens Army Corps, Dies at 101
description: Mary Louise Rasmuson, who joined the Womens Army Corps when it was formed during World War II, rose to be its director under two presidents and later found a new life as a civic leader and philanthropist in the young state of Alaska, died on Monday at her home in Anchorage. She was 101.

title: History on the Track
description: Oscar Pistorius becomes the first double-amputee runner to compete in the Games, highlighting a busy day on the track.

title: Replacing Water Meters to Cut Costs Across Texas
description: ROUND ROCK, Tex.  Early one recent morning, Buddy Franklin and a team of utility workers descended on the Rock Hollow neighborhood in this Austin suburb. They went from house to house with one mission: to install new electronic water meters that change how the city records, and bills for, water use.

title: Struggling for Students Readiness
description: The majority of Texas students do not leave public schools prepared for college.

title: San Antonio Republicans Get Their New Face
description: Ross Ramsey, the managing editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a regular column for the Tribune.

title: Recreating the Past as an Anniversary Gift to Fans
description: In January 1997, the Old 97s, from Dallas, were holed up in a studio just outside Woodstock, N.Y., putting the finishing touches on their major-label debut, Too Far to Care.

title: Uzbek Group Says Drone Killed Leader
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  A major Uzbek militant group closely allied with Al Qaeda announced Saturday that its leader had been killed in an American drone strike in Pakistans tribal belt, along the Afghan border.

title: Leaders Torture in the 70s Stirs Ghosts in Brazil
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Her nom de guerre was Estela. Part of a shadowy urban guerrilla group at the time of her capture in 1970, she spent three years behind bars, where interrogators repeatedly tortured her with electric shocks to her feet and ears, and forced her into the pau de arara, or parrots perch, in which victims are suspended upside down naked, from a stick, with bound wrists and ankles.

title: Fairs, Like Crops, Are Drooping With the Heat
description: CEDARBURG, Wis.  The cheese curds were sizzling in vats of oil, the cartoon-colored carnival rides were spinning, and the tractors, ready to pull something heavy, were revving. Yet all was not right last week at the Ozaukee County Fair, age 153.

title: Their Medal Moments
description: Athletes let emotions show on the podium.

title: Corrections: August 5, 2012
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Parsing Numbers to Choose Best Ever
description: There are numbers in chess that have special significance. One of them is 2,851: the highest rating of all time, which Garry Kasparov, the former world champion, earned twice, in July 1999 and January 2000.

title: Calhoun Breaks His Hip
description: Coach Jim Calhoun, who has led the Connecticut mens team to three N.C.A.A. titles, broke his hip in a bicycle accident and had surgery at the UConn Health Center in Farmington. Calhoun, 70, slipped on sand while riding near his beach home in Madison, Conn., falling off the bike. This is the latest health complication for Calhoun, who has outlasted three bouts with cancer, missed games because of back problems last year and broke five ribs while riding his bike in 2009. The fall forced Calhoun to miss a charity game on Saturday night that featured many of his former players.

title: Sigh of Relief for the Jets
description: Santonio Holmes had an injury scare, but X-rays on his chest came back negative, alleviating the Jets fears that he fractured a rib during a scrimmage in Cortland, N.Y. It was a rare dose of good news for a receiving corps that has lost several members over the last week  Jeremy Kerley and Chaz Schilens among them  to groin or hamstring pulls.

title: A Call to Investigate Russian Governors Comments
description: MOSCOW  A member of a Kremlin-sponsored civic chamber will ask state prosecutors to investigate racially tinged statements made by the governor of the Krasnodar region, a close ally of President Vladimir V. Putin, to see if the remarks violate Russian law on incitement of ethnic hatred.

title: An Olympian Effort: A Chinese Dictionary
description: HONG KONG  With their special vocabularies, slang and jargon, Olympic sports seem to bring out the inner linguist in all of us.

title: Day 10: What to Watch For
description: Here are some of the events, teams and athletes to watch on Sunday at the London Games. (All times Eastern.)

title: Maggie Ham and Hamed Nayeb-Hashemi
description: Dr. Maggie Youngha Ham and Dr. Hamed Nayeb-Hashemi were married Saturday at the Omni Parker House hotel in Boston. The ceremony was performed by Dr. Hooshang D. Poor, a friend of the groom, who received permission from Massachusetts to officiate.

title: Claire Zipf and Edmund Giambastiani III
description: Claire Laura Zipf, a daughter of Donna Tome Zipf and Stephen Alfred Zipf Jr. of Gladwyne, Pa., was married Saturday to Edmund Peter Giambastiani III, the son of Cynthia Johnson Giambastiani and Admiral Giambastiani Jr. of Jupiter, Fla. Lt. Cmdr. Carey H. Cash, a Baptist Navy chaplain, performed the ceremony at the United States Naval Academy Chapel in Annapolis, Md.

title: Naeha Chaudhry and Paul Dean
description: Naeha Chaudhry, the daughter of Gita and Rakesh Chaudhry of Jericho, N.Y., was married Saturday evening to Paul Maitland Dean, the son of Dr. Judith and Howard Dean of Burlington, Vt. Pandit Krishna P. Dixit performed a Hindu ceremony at the Cold Spring Country Club in Huntington, N.Y.

title: Dale Smith and Michael Gallo
description: Eddie Dale Smith and Michael Andrew Gallo were married Saturday at 632 on Hudson, an event space in Manhattan. The Rev. Hugh M. Grant, an Episcopal priest, officiated.

title: Merisa Berger and Frank-Robert Kline III
description: Merisa Alizabeth Berger, the daughter of Susan Passik Berger and Richard C. Berger of Centerport, N.Y., was married Saturday in Port Washington, N.Y., to Frank-Robert Kline III, the son of Shelly L. Kline and Frank R. Kline Jr. of Los Angeles. Cye E. Ross, a village justice of Plandome Heights, N.Y., officiated at the Port Washington Yacht Club.

title: Kerala Cowart and Andrew Eberle
description: Kerala Thie Cowart and Andrew Carl Eberle were married Saturday at the Center for Urban Horticulture in Seattle. Lawrence P. Heeren, a friend of the brides family who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Mets Walk, Over and Over, to a Victory
description: SAN DIEGO  The Mets were productively passive Saturday night, drawing 10 walks as they strolled to a 6-2 win over the San Diego Padres. Mike Baxter epitomized the approach and set a franchise record for a nine-inning game with five walks. Vince Coleman had five for the Mets during a 16-inning game in 1992. The last major league player to have five in a nine-inning game was Ryan Howard of the Philadelphia Phillies in 2006.

title: Jennifer Samela, Daniel Bremmer
description: Jennifer Marie Samela and Daniel Justin Bremmer were married Saturday evening at the Palace at Somerset Park, an event space in Somerset, N.J. Mick Gyure, a Universal Brotherhood minister, officiated.

title: Rachelle Dennis, Jon Borer
description: Rachelle Elisabeth Dennis, a daughter of Marjorie Ellen Dennis and Robert A. Dennis of Andover, Mass., was married in Boston Saturday evening to Jon Andrew Borer, a son of Brondi Borer and Dr. Jeffrey S. Borer of Manhattan. Rabbi Allison Leigh Berry officiated at the Ritz-Carlton Boston Common.

title: Lauren Spiegel, Gregory Karam
description: Lauren Amanda Spiegel, a daughter of Sandra H. Spiegel and David A. Spiegel of Rockville, Md., was married Saturday evening to Gregory John Karam, a son of Eileen Karam and Ronald T. Karam of Fair Lawn, N.J. Millie R. Faulkner, a justice of the Town of Gilboa, N.Y., officiated at the weekend house of the grooms parents in South Gilboa.

title: Phyllis Hwang, Mark Simonoff
description: Phyllis Hwang and Mark Andrew Simonoff are to be married Sunday evening at the Housing Works Bookstore Cafe in Manhattan. Rabbi Jill Hausman is to officiate.

title: Jeana Curro, Marcin Jasinski
description: Jeana Marie Curro and Marcin Andrzej Jasinski were married Friday at the Church of the Guardian Angel in New York. Msgr. Michael F. Hull, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Jennifer Leone, Andrew Charles
description: Jennifer Marie Leone and Andrew Michael Charles were married Saturday evening at the Rockleigh, an events center in Rockleigh, N.J. Rabbi David Fass officiated.

title: Grace Ames, Jonathan Stieber
description: Grace Elizabeth Ames and Dr. Jonathan Ross Stieber were married Saturday evening at the Stein Eriksen Lodge in Park City, Utah. Rabbi Jeremy Alan Schneider officiated.

title: Polina Khentov, Jonathan Stein
description: Polina Khentov and Jonathan Babcock Stein were married Saturday in Hyannis Port, Mass. The ceremony, at the summer home of the grooms maternal grandmother, Ann Harden Babcock, was performed by the grooms uncle, Christopher Harden Babcock, who received permission from Massachusetts to officiate.

title: Rachel Steinman, David Mener
description: Dr. Rachel Anne Steinman and Dr. David Jonathan Mener are to be married Sunday at the Beth El Synagogue Center in New Rochelle, N.Y. Rabbi Gordon Tucker is to perform the ceremony, with Rabbi Melvin Sirner taking part.

title: Annemarie Marcus, Sean Stewart
description: Annemarie Rose Marcus and Sean Joseph Stewart were married Saturday by Kezia E. Bacon, a Universal Brotherhood Movement minister, at the Peabody Essex Museum in Salem, Mass.

title: Bryn Siegel, Samuel Weber
description: Bryn Patrice Siegel and Samuel Spurgeon Weber were married Friday evening at the Carondelet House, an event space in Los Angeles. The Rev. Robert D. Weber, the father of the groom and a Baptist minister, officiated.

title: Meira Bayar, Aaron Ellias
description: Meira Yael Bayar, the daughter of Ilene G. Strauss of West Orange, N.J., and Rabbi Steven Bayar of Millburn, N.J., is to be married Sunday to Aaron Edward Ellias, the son of Lisa J. Ellias and Frank J. Ellias of Farmington Hills, Mich. The brides father, the rabbi of Congregation Bnai Israel in Millburn, is to officiate at the Doubletree Hotel in Newark.

title: Vivian Ho, Andrew Wang
description: Vivian Chia-Ying Ho, a daughter of Lily L. Ho and David C. Ho of Great Neck, N.Y., was married Saturday evening to Andrew Fuh-Hwa Wang, the son of Tsai-Hui Chang and Dr. Wego Wang of Wellesley, Mass. The Rev. Michael LeBlanc, a United Church of Christ minister, officiated at Calistoga Ranch, a resort in Calistoga, Calif.

title: Sarah Sikowitz, Aaron Hite
description: Sarah Mueller Sikowitz and Aaron Patrick Hite were married Friday evening at the Green Building, an event space in Brooklyn. Charles E. Hite, the grooms father, who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Tiffany Kovarsy, Ron Wasserman
description: Tiffany Arlette Kovarsy and Ron Abraham Wasserman are to be married Sunday evening by Rabbi David Wise at the Royalton at Roslyn Country Club in Roslyn Heights, N.Y.

title: Jess Rothenberg, Stephen Barbara Jr.
description: Jess Rothenberg and Stephen Ronald Barbara Jr. were married Friday evening at the Palm House in the Brooklyn Botanic Garden. Cantor Neil A. Berris officiated, and the Rev. Anthony Gambuzza, a minister with the Federation of Christian Ministries, took part in the ceremony, which included Jewish and Christian elements.

title: Helen Rubeiz, Joshua Gross
description: Helen Marie Rubeiz and Joshua Robert Gross were married Saturday at the Plum Tree, an events center in South Kortright, N.Y. The Rev. Judith A. Thistle, a United Methodist minister, officiated in a nondenominational ceremony.

title: John Pariseau, Dario Sacramone Jr.
description: John E. Pariseau and Dario D. Sacramone Jr. are to be married Sunday at the Allen-Stevenson School, a private elementary school for boys in Manhattan. The Rev. Osvaldo J. Perdomo, a minister of the American Marriage Ministry, is to officiate.

title: Margo Brooke Pellmar, Rotem Cohen
description: Margo Brooke Pellmar and Rotem Cohen were married Saturday evening at the Pleasantdale Chateau, an event space in West Orange, N.J. Rabbi Ellie Miller officiated.

title: Hannah Brooks, Samuel Adams
description: Hannah Rose Brooks and Samuel James Adams were married Saturday evening at the Doral Arrowwood Resort in Rye Brook, N.Y. Cantor Shira Ginsburg officiated.

title: Dianna Cohen, Daniel Irom
description: Dianna Sue Cohen and Daniel Jacob Irom are to be married Sunday at the Foundry, an events center in Long Island City, Queens. Rabbi Robert Muhlbauer is to officiate.

title: Meredith Atkinson, Andrew Marbach
description: Meredith Brooke Atkinson and Andrew John Marbach were married Saturday at Brick Presbyterian Church in New York. The Rev. Dr. Bernard R. Wilson, a minister of the United Church of Christ, performed the ceremony with the Rev. Adam D. Gorman, an associate pastor at Brick.

title: Laura Wood, Alan Laser
description: Laura Jane Wood and Alan Joseph Laser are to be married Sunday at the Chequessett Yacht and Country Club in Wellfleet, Mass., at a ceremony to be led by Nicholas P. Marinacci, a friend of the couple who received permission from Massachusetts to officiate.

title: Laura Wolkoff, Nicolas Clote
description: Laura Ellen Wolkoff, the daughter of Susan M. Wolkoff and Harvey J. Wolkoff of Boston, was married Saturday evening at her parents summer house in Dartmouth, Mass., to Nicolas Paul Clote, the son of Marie F. Clote and Peter G. Clote of Newton, Mass. Eduard Reznik, a friend of the couple who received permission from the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, officiated.

title: Jessica Harold, Andrew Yeskoo
description: Jessica Rose Harold, the daughter of Marilyn E. Harold of Freeport, Me., and Mark S. Harold of Biddeford, Me., was married Saturday to Richard Andrew Yeskoo, a son of Dena Wolf Yeskoo and Richard C. Yeskoo of Summit, N.J. The Rev. Laurin C. McArthur, a Presbyterian minister, performed the nondenominational ceremony, which incorporated Jewish traditions, at the Grace United Methodist Church in Speculator, N.Y.

title: Rebecca Grad, Aaron Droller
description: Rebecca Louise Grad and Aaron Ross Droller are to be married Sunday at the Carnegie Institution for Science in Washington. Cantor Hollis Schachner is to officiate.

title: What We're Watching on Day 10
description: Track and field takes center stage with Usain Bolt in action , Kara Goucher contends with the top Kenyan runners in the womens marathon and Andy Murray meets Roger Federer with gold on the line.

title: What Were Watching: Focus Shifts to the Track
description: (function($){var data = chameleonData;var ticker = new NYTD.NYTMM.NewsTicker($('#nytmm_embed_949'), data);})(jQuery||NYTD.jQuery);

title: 15-Year-Old Ledecky Spoiled Britains Party
description: LONDON  Watching the Olympic womens 800-meter freestyle final, Bob Bowman had a feeling of dj vu. In the water, a 15-year-old from Maryland was turning an Olympic debut into a coming-out party.

title: 48 Captives Are Iran Thugs, Say Rebels in Syria
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A group of Syrian rebels took responsibility on Sunday for the kidnapping of 48 Iranians in Damascus a day earlier, but the rebels insisted that their captives were members of Irans elite Revolutionary Guards, not religious pilgrims as Irans official news agency had reported.

title: With Live Streaming and New Technology, BBC Tries to Be Everywhere at the Olympics
description: While some American television viewers are grumbling about the retro feel to NBCs London Olympics coverage, with tape-delayed broadcasts of the opening ceremony and other events, audiences in Britain are getting a more contemporary  even futuristic  TV Games.

title: Media Firm's Olympic Moment to Come After Medals Are Awarded
description: ROME  As the worlds best athletes compete for a spot on the podium at the Olympic Games in London, one Italian is focused on a 10-minute event that will take place once all the medal-giving is over and done with.

title: Curtis Martin: Im Going to Bare My Soul
description: Curtis Martin stood out for his toughness during his career as a running back with the Patriots and the Jets. On Saturday at his Pro Football Hall of Fame induction, he stood out for the power of his words.

title: 2,000 Arrested in China in Counterfeit Drug Crackdown
description: SHANGHAI  Chinese government authorities have detained nearly 2,000 people as part of a nationwide crackdown on the sale of fake or counterfeit drugs and health care products, according to a report on Sunday from Xinhua, the official news agency.

title: Mini Minis Help Keep Field Events on Track
description: LONDON  Tottling to and fro along the right-hand side of the javelin green at Olympic Stadium here are three newcomers to the track: adorable miniature Mini Coopers.

title: Murray Beats Federer for the Gold in Straight Sets
description: A breakthrough Olympics for the British has perhaps its greatest breakthrough of all. After four losses in Grand Slam finals, Andy Murray broke through for the biggest title of his career, winning Olympic gold with a stunning 6-2, 6-1, 6-4 rout of his rival Roger Federer.

title: A First for India in Womens Discus
description: LONDON  With the throw of a discus, Krishna Poonia of India made history on Saturday night.

title: Student Contest Winner | Aurora and the Gun Control Debate
description: There were two clear topics on everyones mind this week: the Aurora shooting and the Olympics. As always, we found what you had to say about both  and about topics ranging from North Korea to Chick-fil-A, whales, online college and couch potatoes  intelligent and thoughtful. We love watching you interact with The New York Times.

title: Ethiopian Sets Olympic Record in Womens Marathon
description: LONDON  On the narrow streets of Sundays womens Olympic marathon, Tiki Gelana of Ethiopia reached for her water bottle and collided with another runner just beyond the halfway point. She fell to the ground and scraped her right elbow. She got up and was bumped again.

title: Competitive Armchair Olympics: Lost
description: Where is the media bus?Where can I watchmodern pentathlon?What exactly ismodern pentathlon?Where is the Facebook stock price going?Where have all the flowers gone?Will Bolt break the world record tonight?Based on your experience withthe N.H.S. here in Britain,do you think having agovernment-run health-caresystem is a good thing?What time is it?Can you hear me now?

title: Eagles Coachs Son, 29, Dies at Training Camp
description: Garrett Reid, the oldest son of Philadelphia Eagles Coach Andy Reid, was found dead Sunday morning in his dormitory room at the teams training site in Bethlehem, Pa., after a troubled life that included a struggle with drug use and prison stints.

title: Dueling Campaign Ads for a Weekend Off the Trail
description: Both Mitt Romney and President Obama are off the campaign trail today, but their campaigns are not resting. Both sides released new ads this weekend that took up some fresh themes, with the Romney campaign seizing on the unemployment figures released Friday and the Obama team making an appeal to female voters.

title: Disruptions: At Its Trial, Apple Spills Some Secrets
description: SAN JOSE, Calif.  Back in the early 1930s, a magician by the name of Horace Goldin went to court to defend his signature illusion: sawing a woman in half.

title: From Film to Broadway, but Changes in Schedule
description: Two new musicals bound for Broadway next spring are taking unexpected detours. Diner, based on the hit film of the same title, is postponing a San Francisco run that had been scheduled for October and November, while Honeymoon in Vegas, also based on a popular movie, has canceled performances planned for late this year in Toronto.

title: At Site of Heartbreak, Murray Overwhelms Federer for Gold
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Andy Murray has yet to win Wimbledon, but he has now won a big one at Wimbledon.

title: A New Comedy Podcast Network From Splitsider
description: The heavy-hitters in the rapidly growing comedy podcast universe are mostly located on the West Coast. Marc Marons WTF and Scott Aukermans Comedy Bang! Bang! are both based in Los Angeles, as are the major podcast networks like Earwolf, Nerdist and Maximum Fun. But this geographic imbalance might start to change with the announcement, scheduled for Monday, that Splitsider, the popular New York comedy site under the umbrella of The Awl Web family, is starting its own podcast network.

title: Total Recall Remake Struggles at Box Office
description: Add Total Recall to the list of remakes that go thud. Sony, betting in part on advancements in visual effects and fond memories of the 1990 original, spent at least $200 million to make and market a new version starring Colin Farrell in the role Arnold Schwarzenegger made famous. But moviegoers werent feeling it: Total Recall took in about $26 million at North American theaters over the weekend, a distant second behind The Dark Knight Rises, which was No. 1 for the third weekend in a row, with about $36.4 million in ticket sales ($354.6 million total over three weeks).

title: Competitive Armchair Olympics: Super Hit
description: Score: 0

title: Drama Strategies to Use With Any Days Times (Part 1)
description: Were declaring this week Drama Week  on the Learning Network, and each day well show you some easy ways that teachers across subject areas can use simple theater exercises to spur discussion and thinking about current events.

title: Israel Bars Foreign Envoys From West Bank Meeting
description: JERUSALEM  Israel on Sunday barred the delegations of five countries from attending a diplomatic conference in Ramallah, in the West Bank, upending plans by the Palestinian president to announce his intention to renew the Palestinians bid this September for enhanced status in the United Nations.

title: Republicans Step Up Attacks Against Reid
description: Top Republicans condemned Senator Harry Reid Sunday, accusing the Senate majority leader of fabricating an assertion that an unnamed Bain Capital investor had told him that Mitt Romney has not paid taxes over a 10-year period.

title: Bront: A Portrait of Charlotte
description: Maxine Linehan in a scene from William Luces one-woman play about Charlotte Bront.

title: Competence Was Linchpin for Both Sides in Tucson Case
description: PHOENIX  From the outset, the case against Jared L. Loughner carried risks for both the prosecution and the defense.

title: Move Over, Max Decugis: Williamses Win Doubles
description: LONDON  Its not easy being a professional athlete with an auto-immune disease, but the American tennis star Venus Williams is getting by with a little help from her sister Serena. On Sunday the Williams sisters returned to the All England Club, where last month they won their fifth Wimbledon doubles title, and secured their third Olympic womens doubles title with a 6-4, 6-4 victory against Andrea Hlavackova and Lucie Hradecka of the Czech Republic.

title: Murrays Golden Moment
description: Andy Murray beat Roger Federer in straight sets to win gold in mens singles. Murray has yet to win a Grand Slam singles title, but winning gold in his own country surely qualifies as a major victory.

title: Gunman Kills 6 at a Sikh Temple Near Milwaukee
description: OAK CREEK, Wis.  The priests had gathered in the lobby of the sprawling Sikh temple here in suburban Milwaukee, and lunch was being prepared as congregants were arriving for Sunday services.

title: Silver Consolation Prize for Queens Badminton Club
description: There were bagels. There was badminton. And, in the end, there was bitter disappointment.

title: American Slips at the Finish, Losing Her Grip on the Gold
description: LONDON  McKayla Maroney, the overwhelming favorite to win a gold medal on vault, did not crack on the medals stand as she listened to a national anthem she did not know and watched a flag being raised that was not hers.

title: Pictures of the Day From London | August 5, 2012
description: The tenth day of the London Olympics.

title: August 5, 2012
description: The tenth day of the London Olympics.

title: Competitive Armchair Olympics: Go Britain
description: Move your mouse in circles to show your enthusiasm.

title: The Tea Party Senators
description: The U.S. House of Representatives last year became the spiritual home of the Tea Party, which helped elect dozens in the 2010 Republican landslide. Success in the Senate was limited.

title: Recovery Process Frustrates Pettitte
description: 8:33 p.m. | Updated

title: Advent to Buy Control of Maker of Serta and Simmons Bedding
description: Advent International said Sunday that it had agreed to buy a majority stake in the parent company of Serta and Simmons bedding, taking control of one of the countrys biggest makers of mattresses.

title: Shooting at Sikh Temple
description: A shooting at the Sikh Temple of Wisconsin in Oak Creek left at least six dead and several wounded.

title: As Harlem Lanes Closes, a Common Neighborhood Refrain
description: As groups of cheering children sought to knock down pins at Harlem Lanes on Friday morning, Joey Hill and Marsha Kindell had a different objective: get rid of mounds of documents.

title: Pistorius Misses Chance at Final, but Remains Upbeat
description: LONDON  Just moments after finishing first in a semifinal of the Olympic 400 meters Sunday night, Kirani James of Grenada turned and looked for the man who finished last.

title: Hacked Reuters Twitter Feed Used to Spread Disinformation About Syrian Rebels
description: Reuters reports that a hacker briefly seized control of the news agencys technology news Twitter feed, @ReutersTech, on Sunday and used the account to post a stream of fabricated reports about Syria and the Middle East under the new handle @ReutersME.

title: Ruling on Artistic Authenticity: The Market vs. the Law
description: Federal District Court Judge Paul G. Gardephes rsum includes many impressive accomplishments but not an art history degree. Nonetheless he has been asked to answer a question on which even pre-eminent art experts cannot agree: Are three reputed masterworks of Modernism genuine or fake.

title: Weymouth Journal: Charming Retreat Plays Host to Sailing, but Crowds Do Not Follow
description: WEYMOUTH, England  The bubonic plague is said to have come ashore in this coastal town, carried by fleas infected by rats. The so-called Black Death quickly spread throughout the British Isles.

title: Knight Capital Reaches Rescue Deal With Investor Group
description: 10:09 p.m. | Updated

title: From Chaplin to Groucho to T. S. Eliot
description: According to the captivating new book Hello Goodbye Hello Alexander Woollcott, the writer and Algonquin Circle wit, loved to play a game called Strange Bedfellows. One of his biggest coups took place at a Cap dAntibes villa in the summer of 1928 when he succeeded in bringing together Harpo Marx and George Bernard Shaw (corned beef and roses, as he called them) at lunch. The two hit it off, and later that week Harpo drove Shaw to Cannes, where a friend of Shaws cast them as extras in a movie; a scene featuring them playing billiards, alas, would be left on the cutting-room floor.

title: Candidates React to Shooting at Sikh Temple
description: President Obama and Mitt Romney released statements Sunday afternoon on the shooting at the Sikh temple in Wisconsin. In his statement, the president said:

title: Pollsters Struggle to Pin Down the Right (Cell) Number
description: As they gauge voter sentiment in this tight presidential race, pollsters face a big challenge: more and more voters hang up on them.

title: Loneliness and Love on the Moor
description: The ghost of theater styles past hovers over Bront: A Portrait of Charlotte, a one-woman show starring Maxine Linehan. Written by William Luce for Julie Harris, Bront is one of those spend an evening with a great writer plays whose mini-vogue seems to have come and gone. (The Luce-Harris Belle of Amherst might have been the peak of the trend.)

title: Garcia Skirts Trouble Just Enough to Beat the Mariners
description: On a tepid, cloudy night in Seattle in August 1999, Freddy Garcia struck out 12 Detroit Tigers as part of a shutout, setting the Seattle Mariners rookie record. That night, Ken Griffey Jr. hit two home runs.

title: If This Dancers Amigas Could See Her Now
description: The 1966 musical (and 1969 movie) Sweet Charity gets a Latin makeover in the director Julio Agustins production at the New Haarlem Arts Theater, and its called for. The original could use some salsa. With its picaresque and coincidence-filled narrative; somewhat flighty title character (a lovelorn floozy, if not a prostitute, with a heart of gold); and principal setting (a dime-dance joint, already an anachronism in mid-60s New York), the musical, originally staged by Bob Fosse, is itself a watered-down version of Fellinis Nights of Cabiria, which actually did concern a prostitute and gritty issues like physical and emotional abuse and an existential take on religion. Sweet Charity was never one of Fosses more provocative shows, and Neil Simons quip-packed book seems sitcom-ready in retrospect.

title: Many Tales Witnessed Many Ways
description: Never underestimate the power of serendipity; any chance encounter can have profound repercussions. Take, for example, the composer Phil Kline, who discovered Indeterminacy, a seminal two-LP set by John Cage, while working as a college-radio D.J. during his time at Columbia University.

title: In Fastest Field Ever, the Worlds Fastest Man Proves It Again
description: LONDON  Four years later, still no one can catch Usain Bolt.

title: Esther Kartiganer, a Force as a 60 Minutes Producer, Dies at 74
description: Esther Kartiganer, who as senior producer in charge of vetting content on CBSs 60 Minutes became entangled in a controversy over a program that raised questions about President George W. Bushs military service during the Vietnam War, died on Wednesday in Aspen, Colo. She was 74.

title: Sailing Into a Summer Night on the Wings of Beauty
description: Ive been watching you, David Harrell yelled at the people assembled in Hearst Plaza on Saturday night for Lincoln Center Out of Doors. I think youre beautiful, he said, and then, I thought this was going to be strange, and: This has really moved me. Its really changed me.

title: Vivid Harmonies in the Dappled Shade
description: Charles Ives represents the newer end of the compositional spectrum on many programs. But as the cellist Kevin McFarland said before the JACK Quartets performance of the second movement of Ivess String Quartet No. 2 on Saturday afternoon, Its still kind of an early piece for us.

title: Richards-Ross Breaks American Drought In the Womens 400
description: LONDON  Sanya Richards-Ross earned a long-coveted gold medal in the womens 400 meters Sunday, becoming the first woman from the United States to win the event since 1984.

title: Scenes From Shooting at Sikh Temple in Wisconsin
description: Last Updated, 9:30 p.m. A gunman walked into a Sikh temple in suburban Milwaukee on Sunday and killed six worshipers preparing for a morning service, in what is being described as an act of domestic terrorism, law enforcement officials said. The gunman was also killed.

title: NBCs Coverage in London Is Becoming a Rating Success With a Shot at a Profit
description: Critics of NBCs coverage of the London Olympics have voiced sometimes brutal commentary on Twitter using the hashtag #NBCFail, but with one week left in its comprehensive, multiple-platform coverage, NBCs own take is that its programming is a success.

title: A Commando Mission for Millionaires
description: Soldiers of Fortune, an execrable action thriller plopped into a few local theaters without screenings for critics, is one abortive military mission. For the cast, shooting the movie (in Ukraine) may have been a working vacation, but for viewers, watching it is an excruciating sentence of hard labor.

title: Study Questions Risk of S.E.C. Revolving Door
description: WASHINGTON  The revolving door has long been the focus of government watchdogs here, a symbolic portal that business executives and lawyers pass through on their way to government posts and back again to the private sector. There, the thinking goes, they use their influence with former colleagues to reap benefits for themselves and their companies.

title: A Quick Visit From a Busy Conductor
description: In her revitalization of the Mostly Mozart Festival over the last decade, Jane Moss, the artistic director of Lincoln Center, has shown an uncanny knack for catching conductors on the rise: not least, the festivals current music director, Louis Langre.

title: In Battle Between Longtime Rivals, More Than One Gold Is in Offing
description: LONDON  Just 2 points stood between Lee Chong Wei and gold in the mens badminton finals  and not just the modest amount of precious metal in the Olympics most coveted prize. He was also on the verge of winning a bar of gold worth more than $600,000.

title: A Hall Full of Memory Rocks Out Once More
description: PORT CHESTER, N.Y.  Forty years ago, in its heyday, the Capitol Theater here was known as a rock stage with great acoustics, a crumbling space where the Grateful Dead, Janis Joplin, Santana and Pink Floyd played memorable concerts. So when Peter Shapiro, a founder of the Brooklyn Bowl, took over the theater last year and announced plans to reopen it as a concert hall next month, he had a heavy reputation to live up to.

title: MTV Sets Date for Jersey Shore
description: To those who thought Jersey Shore would not or could not survive for three full years, MTV is proving otherwise. The network has set a premiere date for the sixth season of this much-mocked but also much-watched reality show and has ordered a second season of the spinoff Snooki and JWoww, which features these two Jersey Shore cast members living elsewhere in New Jersey.

title: A Stormy Lollapalooza Sends Fans Scurrying
description: A severe thunderstorm in Chicago forced organizers of the Lollapalooza music festival to suspend all activities and evacuate an estimated 100,000 people from Grant Park for more than two hours on Saturday afternoon, The Associated Press reported. A handful of acts had their sets cut short when concert officials announced that the park would be evacuated because the National Weather Service had issued a severe thunderstorm warning. Concertgoers took shelter in neighboring bars and restaurants and in three underground parking garages that were designated evacuation centers for the sold-out event. The gates reopened a few hours later, and a curfew was extended to accommodate the nights scheduled headliners, which included the Red Hot Chili Peppers,  Frank Ocean and Franz Ferdinand.

title: General Way Things Are Going
description: MONDAYS PUZZLE  Have you been following the 2012 LONDON Olympics? Lynn Lempel has, and she offers us a nice beginning to our solving week by salting her grid with six of the sports you will find in the competition.

title: Anything But Human
description: Wherever I turn, the popular media, scientists and even fellow philosophers are telling me that Im a machine or a beast. My ethics can be illuminated by the behavior of termites. My brain is a sloppy computer with a flicker of consciousness and the illusion of free will. Im anything but human.

title: World Youth Teams Championships Finals
description: TAICANG, China  At the 14th World Youth Teams Championships here the three 80-board finals ended on Saturday.

title: A Decadent Reminder of Russia Before Putin
description: MOSCOW  If there was one place in Moscow that embodied the gold rush mentality of expatriates in the troubled Yeltsin era, it was the Hungry Duck, a dive bar that until it was shut down by the city in 1999 brought together profiteers, thugs with crew cuts, drifting students, migr castaways and Russian women hoping to meet foreign men.

title: One Man Multitasking, Guvnor
description: The actor James Corden arrived in New York this spring not exactly a household name and cast in the lead of a comedy some people feared might be too British to succeed on Broadway. He promptly won the Tony for best actor and a passel of other awards, putting that doubt to rest. Now, as his run in One Man, Two Guvnors enters its last weeks, he has become a case study in multitasking, juggling the opportunities that have come out of his sudden success here.

title: Latino Show for a New Generation
description: East WillyB, a Brooklyn-based Web series, is taking on issues facing a growing Latino population.

title: Networks Struggle to Appeal to Hispanics
description: Sofia Vergara is probably the most recognizable Hispanic actress working in English-language television. She is one of the stars of Modern Family, among the highest-rated scripted shows on network television, and she has parlayed her celebrity into commercials for brands like Pepsi and Cover Girl.

title: Guided by Lucky Magazine, Shopping Will Soon Require Less Clicking
description: Before women go to the mall, they go to the shopping bible Lucky. Now the magazine wants to save them the price of gas.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for This Week
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

description: To the Editor:
