Its glamorous, acrobatic and precise, requiring the women to hold their breath for large stretches of time as they perform. To the casual viewer, its a visual feast. Here are photos from the event, including the top eight teams.

title: Rivera Preaches Patience as He Works Toward a Return
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y.  Although Yankees Manager Joe Girardi has left open the remote possibility that closer Mariano Rivera might return this season from a torn anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee, the pitcher emphasized the need for patience during an appearance at Saratoga Race Course.

title: Republicans Pick Ballot Replacement for Ohio Congressman
description: David Joyce will replace Representative Steven C. LaTourette as the Republican nominee in Ohios 14th Congressional District, local party leaders said on Friday.

title: Real Mexican Cuisine, Right Down to Dessert
description: THE first place I had a sopaipilla  that puffy pillow of fried dough popular in New Mexico  was in a restaurant in a nondescript strip mall outside Santa Fe. Served warm and drizzled with honey, it was delicious  and incredibly popular with the Spanish-speaking diners, nearly all of whom had a few for dessert. But it is not an item seen on New York menus very often.

title: Heart Procedures and the Health System
description: To the Editor:

title: A Voice Against Abortion
description: To the Editor:

title: Reviewing the BMW 528i
description: In Sundays Automobiles section, Csaba Csere reviews the 2012 BMW 528i, a vehicle born of the German automakers conviction that American consumers will pay $60,000 for a premium midsize sedan powered by a 4-cylinder engine.

title: Bye, Bye, Honey, Dont Forget to Vacuum
description: Rare is the overworked mother or exasperated wife who hasnt wished to turn on her heel and close the door behind her. Perhaps even more unusual is the woman who has left, even for a few days, without reeling from guilt. But for one week last summer, more than 100 women 18 to 82 from Yemassee, S.C. (population 1,000, give or take), were granted a hall pass from their everyday routines and hustled out of town while the men stayed behind.

title: Investing in Jails
description: To the Editor:

title: Signs of Climate Change
description: To the Editor:

title: The Week in Pictures for Aug. 10
Life in a Mental Hospital
description: To the Editor:

title: Romances of Various Sweetness
description: The stage fog rolled in during intermission at Ballet NYs program at the Ailey Citigroup Theater on Thursday night. What followed was The Garden of Souls, a work-in-progress duet by the companys artistic director Medhi Bahiri. To the taped Middle Eastern singing of Azam Ali, Jennifer Goodman and Jason Jordan emerged to undulate, together and apart, in red-and-black leggings under half-skirts.

title: Ethiopian Reclaims 5,000-Meter Title From a Rival Countrywoman
description: LONDON  For almost a decade, the Ethiopians Tirunesh Dibaba and Meseret Defar have been locked in a heated custody battle over the 5,000 meters. They have traded world championships, world records and Olympic crowns, with Dibaba exhibiting a protective ferocity for the event for much of the last four years.

title: Making the Trip From the Vine to the Shelf
description: ROCKY HILL, N.J.  First Field ketchup is found at barbecues where the burgers are Kobe beef, according to Theresa Viggiano, a founder of the company with her husband, Patrick Leger. When the couple were testing recipes as the company was getting started in 2008, however, the ketchup was more likely to be in their relatives refrigerators.

title: A Vibrant Performance, Though Neither Mozart Nor Even Baroque
description: The Freiburg Baroque Orchestra, a leading period-instrument ensemble entering its 25th season, came to the Mostly Mozart Festival on Thursday night but played no Mozart, nor any of the Baroque repertory it specializes in.

title: Our Emissary on Mars, Budget Woes on Earth
description: To the Editor:

title: A Bridge Deal at the World Youth Teams Games
description: LILLE, France  While the Second World Mind Sports Games get under way here, with the first three rounds played on Friday, lets look at one more board from the 14th World Youth Teams Championships in Taicang, China.

title: Favorite Fitness Apps: Beijing Edition
description: BEIJING  Whether you spent the last two weeks watching records get crushed at the Olympics, or lounging half naked at the beach, chances are youve also been thinking about your own fitness and how to improve it. It may come as no surprise: Theres an app for that.

title: Good for Barbecues
description: When a crowd gathers for a backyard barbecue and the menu features steak, lamb, burgers, grilled vegetables and the like, red wines are called for. If the guest list is large, youll want each bottle to cost less than $20. (And clear plastic glasses are fine.)

title: A Summery Menu, With a Hamptons Feel
description: LIKE it or not, the gradual gentrification of the North Fork continues. Its newer restaurants are a departure from the rough-and-ready fish houses of yesteryear. A case in point is First and South in Greenport, which opened in May and has the summery East End look down pat.

title: The British Lawmaker Nipping at Tabloids Heels
description: LONDON

title: Racing Where They Could, Running What They Had
description: THE golf course fairway where judging for the Pebble Beach Concours dlgance will be held next Sunday is a short sprint from winding private roads that once hosted sports car races. The proximity is not a coincidence: the concours and the race were held in tandem in 1950-56.

title: Raced, Rescued, Restored
description: After holding its own against the sophisticated European models of the early 1950s, the Glasspar G2 racecar disappeared. Recently restored, it will be on display at the Pebble Beach Concours dlgance.

title: After a Brilliant Debut, a Case of Lost and Found
description: VISITORS to the Pebble Beach Concours dlgance on the Monterey Peninsula of California next Sunday will see vehicles of unfathomable value, many bearing revered nameplates. But few parked on the neatly manicured fairway will have a more captivating back story than a blue-and-white 1953 Glasspar G2, a shapely and powerful sports car that raced as the Mameco-Ardun entry before dropping out of sight almost 60 years ago.

title: Even the Look Is an Adventure
description: LIKE futuristic dream cars at auto shows, concept designs for travel trailers are created to be provocative. Among the many ideas that have been recently floated  in one case, literally  three stand out.

title: Heeding Call of the Wild, Travel Trailers Shape Up
description: FOR a long time, travel trailers came in two basic varieties: the big white shoebox or the Chiclet-shape pop-up; Airstreams iconic aluminum bubble was a notable exception.

title: Beyond the Box
description: With sales of travel trailers growing, some manufacturers have found success with more adventurous designs.

title: Richard Cragun, Stuttgart Ballet Dancer, Dies at 67
description: Richard Cragun, a former star dancer with the Stuttgart Ballet and the partner of the prima ballerina Marcia Hayde in a series of classical dance dramas acclaimed internationally in the 1960s and 70s, including Romeo and Juliet, Eugene Onegin and The Taming of the Shrew, died on Monday in Rio de Janeiro, where he had lived since 1999. He was 67. The Stuttgart Ballet, which announced his death, did not give the cause.

title: Thousands Gather to Mourn Six Dead in Shooting at Temple
description: OAK CREEK, Wis.  One by one, six coffins were rolled into a high school gymnasium here Friday and were surrounded by Sikh men and women singing traditional Punjabi hymns. As they sang, thousands of people from around the world streamed into the gym to mourn the six worshipers who were shot and killed on Sunday at the Sikh Temple of Wisconsin here.

title: Bulldozers Join Tourists as Fixtures in Capital
description: WASHINGTON  The nations capital is under construction.

title: Alone in the Zone
description: I have been trying to imagine how I would have felt if, after having performed at a level that made me the best in the world, I only then learned from my parents that my grandparents were dead and my mother had cancer. The news last week that the multiple gold medals of the Chinese diver Wu Minxia had, in a way, come at a price made me think about the tug of war between the hyper-focus required to excel and the yearning for connection. That tension often makes athletes feel as if these forces are mutually exclusive or, at the very least, that they linger in the realm of the imbalanced and unhealthy. Death, it would appear, is inconvenient.

title: Cold, Creamy and Locally Made
description: MORE than 60 cars were parked in the unpaved lot at Rich Farm on a recent Sunday afternoon, as an orange-vested attendant directed drivers toward vacant spots. With scores of people lined up in front of its wood-sided shop, the farm seemed poised to host a revival meeting.

title: After Sinai Killings, Cairo Tightens Grip on a Neglected Region
description: EL-ARISH, Egypt  The new police chief peered through the black grill of a holding cell and asked a baby-faced prisoner inside when he had gotten there. The young man  he might have been a teenager  had been detained in the previous day or two as Egypts military swept through the Sinai in pursuit this week of the killers of 16 of its soldiers.

title: Carlo Rambaldi Dies at 86; Maestro of Special Effects in Movies
description: Carlo Rambaldi, a special-effects virtuoso who won two Academy Awards for his work on Steven Spielbergs E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial and Ridley Scotts Alien and a special achievement award from the Motion Picture Academy for John Guillermins 1976 remake of King Kong, died Friday in southern Italy. He was 86.

title: After a Struggle, Mosque Opens in Tennessee
description: MURFREESBORO, Tenn.  The worshipers bowed low, their heads touching the freshly laid carpet, as the new mosque filled with echoes of exultation.

title: When Sorianos Emotions Overflow, Mark the Date
description: TORONTO  Rafael Soriano pounded his glove with extra vigor after Thursdays 4-3 victory over the Detroit Tigers. Soriano had just delivered only his second four-out save of the season, and the game was already emotionally charged after Manager Joe Girardi had been ejected for arguing a call in the fifth inning.

title: Grass-Roots Mobilization, by Corporate America
description: Los Angeles

title: Tithing, Dues, Pledges and Your House of Worship
description: No matter which God you worship, your religious community is probably always just a little bit hurting for funds  and constantly in search of a better way to collect a little bit more a bit more often.

title: U.S. Goldman Disclosure a Rare Break in Secrecy
description: WASHINGTON  After deciding not to prosecute Goldman Sachs for its conduct during the financial crisis, the Justice Department did something rare: it publicly announced that the investigation was closed.

title: Card Swipes in Church Make Giving Easier
description: For anyone who spends time pondering the cost of keeping the lights on and the staff paid at their houses of worship, the Mormon tithing slip has a sort of utilitarian beauty.

title: An Improvised Trap for a Burglar Who Made Himself at Home
description: In a city of millions of keys, this is a story of two of them. Two keys carried by two strangers that opened the same apartment door. Twice, the police said, one man let himself inside while the other was away. The first time, the victim was just that  a victim. The second time, he was ready.

title: Vibrant Postcards From an Inner World
description: If we had nothing of Chagall but his Bible, he would be for us a great modern artist, the art historian Meyer Schapiro once wrote. Those words, taken from an essay published in 1956, along with Chagalls Bible etchings, are quoted in the press materials accompanying the exhibition Marc Chagall at the Nassau County Museum of Art in Roslyn Harbor, N.Y. The second part of Mr. Schapiros statement isnt included, however. He added that Chagall was also a surprising anomaly in the art of an age which otherwise seems so remote from the content and attitude of his work.

title: Standard Chartered Case Casts a Chill Over Banks
description: Money laundering accusations leveled against a British bank by New Yorks top banking regulator are causing global banks to worry that their New York operations could make them public targets for processing transactions already deemed legal by federal regulators, according to federal authorities with knowledge of the concerns.

title: Mark Brinker, Automotive Surgeon
description: The Glasspar G2 Mameco-Ardun sports car featured in Sundays Automobile section has a story to tell. That tale, however, might not have ended particularly well were it not for Mark Brinker, who purchased the long-lost car and financed an exacting restoration.

title: Letting Companies Settle While Denying Guilt Reconsidered by F.T.C.
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Trade Commission finished a settlement with Facebook on Friday over allegations that the company had violated its privacy policy, and in the process said it would re-examine its own practice of allowing companies to settle charges of wrongdoing while denying that they had done anything wrong.

title: Painting Bryant Park, While Adding to Its Charm
description: Bryant Parks pristine lawn, lush hydrangeas and movable bistro tables have been well documented in photographs and videos, but not so much in paint. This summer, to correct that situation, the Bryant Park Management Corporation, which operates the park, chose four artists to be painters in residence: each is being paid $2,000, in addition to the cost of materials, to spend two weeks depicting life in the park.

title: A Galloping City Captured in Slow Motion
description: THERE are moments in history when everything interesting seems to take place indoors: clandestine meetings, documents being signed, objects and discoveries being made in private studios and ateliers. The past year, however, saw a different moment, in which plazas were occupied and protests and revolutions unfolded in the streets. Public space was activated  which might partially explain why James Naress STREET, at the Wadsworth Atheneum Museum of Art in Hartford, feels particularly relevant at this moment.

title: Sami Rohr, Jewish Philanthropist Remembered by a Writing Prize, Dies at 86
description: Sami Rohr, a Jewish philanthropist whose children presented him with an unusual gift six years ago when they created the Sami Rohr Prize for Jewish Literature, a $100,000 annual award intended to foster the careers of young, unknown writers, died on Sunday in Miami. He was 86 and lived in Bal Harbour, Fla.

title: Water Damage
description: CULLEN JONES and Lia Neal were among the many swimmers to win medals for the United States in this years Olympic Games. But their inspiring performances obscure a disturbing truth. Not only are they, as African-Americans, anomalies in the elite levels of their sport, but enormous numbers of African-Americans do not have even rudimentary swimming skills, a lack that costs lives.

title: Lakers Again Land a Large Piece of the Puzzle
description: The N.B.A.s premier center  a towering, talented mass of muscle, shot-blocking and bravado  was fitted for a Los Angeles Lakers jersey Friday, leaving fans of 29 other teams a small range of emotional options.

title: Report Looks at Hospital in Outbreak of Hepatitis
description: STRATHAM, N.H.  Edgar Barnes was relieved, almost buoyant, on Friday for the first time in many weeks. He had just emerged from a state-sponsored health clinic here where he was tested for hepatitis C. His test came back negative.

title: U.S. Superstar Relay Riddles Argentina With Scoring Barrage
description: LONDON  They took turns on Friday night, four American superstars who passed the scoring torch as if competing in an Olympic basketball relay, as if auditioning for the title of best local foursome since the Beatles last played here.

title: Ex-CNN Anchor Joins Debate vs. Unions Over Teacher Misconduct
description: In late July, a Twitter user began to post a flurry of messages on what happens to be one of the Bloomberg administrations newest education campaigns.

title: Down With Shareholder Value
description: Ive been known to say that I was present at the creation of shareholder value.

title: Officer Charged With Aiding Drug Ring
description: A New York City police officer accused of providing protected law enforcement information to the head of a drug-dealing organization in Jamaica, Queens, was indicted on Friday by a grand jury in Federal District Court in Brooklyn.

title: Aug. 10: Iowa, the Forgotten Swing State
description: Some swing states get more polling love than others. In Florida, the matchup between President Obama and Mitt Romney has been tested 29 times by pollsters since last November. In Ohio, there have been 25 polls, and in Virginia, 27.

title: New Focus for Romney on Connecting and Closing the Empathy Gap
description: BOSTON  Mitt Romneys biggest challenge at the moment is not President Obama. Its himself.

title: U.S. Accuses Hezbollah of Aiding Syrias Crackdown
description: The United States accused the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah on Friday of deep involvement in the Syrian governments violent campaign to crush the uprising there, asserting that Hezbollah has trained and advised government forces inside Syria and has helped to expel opposition fighters from areas within the country.

title: Strategy for Syrian Refugees in Turkey Is on Clinton Agenda
description: ISTANBUL  As refugees flow across the border from war-torn Syria into Turkey by the thousands, Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton arrives here Saturday for a strategy session with Turkish officials on the conflict aimed at assessing what were doing now and what more can be done, an American official said Friday.

title: The Weeks Business News in Pictures
description: Investors came to the rescue of Knight Capital, regulators accused Standard Chartered of dealings with Iran and grocery stores are testing customized coupons for shoppers.

title: In Wisconsin, Remembering Those Lost in Shooting
description: Thousands of people streamed into a high school gymnasium in Oak Creek, Wis., to mourn the six worshipers who had been shot and killed on Sunday at the Sikh Temple of Wisconsin in suburban Milwaukee.

title: Margaritas, Complete With Salt Air
description: WHEN Ulli Rimkus, the owner of Max Fish, a combination bar and informal art gallery on the Lower East Side of Manhattan, opened what she calls a pop-up outpost on the Asbury Park Boardwalk in June, she drew a really mixed clientele, she said.

title: Down Payment on a Dream
description: The most promising effort in years to restore fairness and hope to the immigration system begins Wednesday, when the Obama administration will start accepting applications from young, undocumented immigrants who want to be shielded from deportation so they can be free to work and go to school.

title: Centuries Apart, Cultures Speak to Each Other
description: Encounters: Conflict, Dialogue, Discovery, at the Princeton University Art Museum, has the hallmarks of a recession-era show. It is an exhibition culled largely from the museums collection and cleverly installed alongside  or sometimes right within  the permanent collection.

title: Colonel in Cover-up Case to Be Tried in Mexico Civilian Court
description: MEXICO CITY  In May 2011, Jethro Snchez, a 27-year-old engineer, was detained by the Mexican Army, and found tortured and killed. An army colonel was accused of ordering soldiers to hide the body to cover up the crime, and the case vanished in the countrys maze of military justice.

title: A Lively Comedy of Self-Reference
description: As anyone who has ever ventured behind the curtain can attest, transformation lies at the heart of theater. And in Tom Dudzicks backstage comedy Dont Talk to the Actors, now at Penguin Rep Theater in Rockland County, the transformations just keep on coming.

title: Politics, Intolerance and Fair Courts
description: Two years ago, right-wing interests in Iowa ran a successful campaign to remove three sitting State Supreme Court justices for participating in a unanimous ruling in 2009 that permitted same-sex marriage. The damage included, of course, the individual judges, but, beyond that, it sent exactly the wrong message about the need to keep judicial decision-making  and the judiciarys role in protecting fundamental rights  above the political fray.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,063 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans recently:

title: A Workers Trail
description: David Kwiatkowski, a lab technician suspected of spreading hepatitis C, has worked in 13 hospitals across eight states since 2007.

title: Einstein Groupies
description: Q. Supposedly, Albert Einstein once caused a riot in New York. What happened?

title: Lottery Numbers
Girardi Avoids Suspension
description: Manager Joe Girardi was not given a suspension for his vehement argument with umpires that got him ejected from the Yankees 4-3 win on Thursday in Detroit. Joe Torre, Girardis predecessor and former manager when he played for the Yankees, spoke to Girardi and umpire Tim Welke on the phone to get their positions on the incident. Torre said that even though there may have been contact between Girardi and Bob Davidson, who intervened, it did not warrant a suspension. Girardi claimed that any contact was initiated by Davidson as he tried to separate him and Welke.

title: U.S. Womens Track Shatters 4x100 Record
description: Other victorious countries in track and field on Friday included Ethiopia, Turkey and the Bahamas.

title: Wisconsin: A Political Snapshot
description: NICKNAME The Badger State

title: Stiff Challenge for Thompson in Senate Race
description: FOND DU LAC, Wis.  Visiting a scrap-metal company here, Tommy G. Thompson did not wait for introductions from company guides. He climbed uninvited onto heavy machinery to clutch drivers hands. He stepped past an employees only sign into an office where he called out, Hows it going? to a worker on the phone. He squeezed himself into a closet-size break room, startling three employees between bites of hamburgers.

title: Japan Sales Tax Increase Passed, on Pledge of Early Election
description: TOKYO  Prime Minister Yoshihiko Nodas plan to double Japans sales tax was approved by Parliament on Friday after months of haggling, but only after Mr. Noda promised opposition lawmakers that he would call early elections  a move that is likely to end his term in office and his partys hold on power.

title: President Morsis First Crisis
description: Mohamed Morsi was forced to respond quickly to his first security crisis as Egypts first freely elected president. After 16 Egyptian soldiers were killed by gunmen in the Sinai Peninsula last Sunday, he dispatched troops to secure the border, moved to assert control of his security leadership team and avoided conflict with Israel. It was a challenging beginning for an inexperienced leader who had been in office less than two months.

title: Wrong-Track Romney
description: Putting too much stock in presidential polls before the party conventions can be tricky. They are meaningful because they offer a snapshot of the state of play at the moment, but they are hardly predictive because many voters dont truly engage until the election draws nearer.

title: It Might Be Cheating
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  Comedian Jeff Foxworthy is famous for his You might be a redneck if  routine, and Id like to borrow his idea today in order to get to the bottom of an issue that people talk about quite a bit: What, exactly, constitutes cheating in crossword puzzle solving? Is any outside help really cheating?

title: Woods Tames Conditions and Ties for Lead
description: KIAWAH ISLAND, S.C.  On a day with wind so blustery a well-struck 4-iron still traveled only 145 yards and even short putts ended up completely blown off the green, Tiger Woods, his shirt sleeves and pant legs flapping in the gusts, faced down the elements and charged into a three-way tie for the lead of the P.G.A. Championship on Friday.

title: Court Asked to Nullify Convictions in 95 Killing
description: Lawyers for two of five people now believed to have been wrongfully convicted in the 1995 murder of a livery-cab driver in the Bronx asked a state court on Friday to vacate their convictions and dismiss the charges against them.

title: All Hail the Dibble Queen
description: LAST Sunday, dozens of children in bathing suits crowded onto a pier jutting into Little Neck Bay in northeast Queens and arranged themselves into a receiving line.

title: New York Acts Quickly Amid Sharp Rise in Homelessness
description: The homeless population in New York City has jumped sharply over the last year, causing a record number of people to enter the shelter system. The increase has forced the Bloomberg administration to open nine more shelters in just the last two months  sometimes with only a few weeks notice to surrounding neighborhoods.

title: U.S. Mens Basketball Tops Argentina
description: The Americans celebrated the win and looked toward Spain in the finals.

title: Become a Star Tracker
description: If you are an unemployed young American, right now you are probably asking yourself: what are the job opportunities of the future? Opportunities more remunerative than unpaid internships and more accessible than, say, synchronized swimming?

title: Campaign Steps Up Its Attacks on Negative Ads by a Pro-Obama Super PAC
description: Mitt Romneys campaign on Friday sought to take advantage of a backlash against negative campaigning by President Obamas allies, even as it tried to deny what new polls suggest  that the full-throated assault on Mr. Romneys character may be working.

title: Exploring a Lyricist and a Brooklyn Bohemia
description: BEFORE there was Hammerstein, there was Hart. The lyricist Lorenz Hart collaborated with Richard Rodgers on more than 800 songs and more than two dozen Broadway musicals until just before his death, in 1943.

title: To Harvey and His Father, Promise Has Always Been There
description: His family had traveled to the city, but so had the rain. So Matt Harveys first start in Citi Field was in some doubt before he took the mound at 7:10 Friday night and threw his first pitch for a called strike. By then, the skies had cleared, a nice omen, maybe, for a team that could use one.

title: Eager to Run, Giants Still Go to the Air
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla.  Tom Coughlin is an old-school coach with an old-school mind-set. So it makes sense that his off-season talking point has revolved around the Giants getting back to the basics of running the football better.

title: A Trip to the Past
description: With its revolutionary history, Tottenville, Staten Island, has a certain charm.

title: National Nuns Group Dodges Showdown With Vatican
description: ST. LOUIS  The leaders of the nations largest group of nuns sidestepped a confrontation with the hierarchy of the Roman Catholic Church, announcing Friday that they would dialogue with the archbishop appointed by the Vatican to take over their group, but not compromise the integrity of their mission.

title: Brazil-Mexico in London Another Showcase for Marco Fabian
description: Mexico and Brazil will play Saturday in Londons Wembley Stadium for a title that neither country has won, despite different and impressive soccer pedigrees.

title: Mel Stuart, Documentarian and Willy Wonka Director, Dies at 83
description: Mel Stuart, who won three Emmy Awards as a producer or director of documentaries  two of them penetrating histories of presidential campaigns  but who also took a fantastical turn by directing the beloved childrens movie Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory, died on Thursday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 83.

title: Obama Defends Clinton Aide at Dinner for Muslim Americans
description: President Obama came to the defense of an aide to Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton on Friday night, countering conservatives who have called her a security risk because of supposed ties to Islamic extremists.

title: After Dismal Showing, U.S. Still Has High Hopes for Rio
description: LONDON  The Connor Fields who limped into the BMX mixed zone Friday looked as if he had just survived a car wreck. His pants were torn at the left kneecap. A flap of torn skin hung from his bloody right hand.

title: Yankees Use Blue Jays to Continue Turnaround
description: TORONTO  After a hard-fought, tense and at times emotional series against the Tigers in Detroit, the Yankees crossed the northern frontier and played the way they should against a last-place club. The battered and injured Toronto Blue Jays had lost 9 of their previous 11 games and had dropped three in a row. The Yankees happily added to their woes with a 10-4 victory Friday.

title: Bill Cunningham | Last Dance
description: On the Street: The Newport Vintage Dance Week took place July 29 to Aug. 3 in Rhode Island, drawing 200 participants.

title: Roses, Pasta and Police Shows
description: New York Citys commissioner of correction, Dora B. Schriro, developed a template to reform the nations immigrant detention system while working at the United States Department of Homeland Security; she has also headed the Corrections Departments of Missouri and Arizona. Ms. Schriro, 62, began her career in New York in 1984 and was appointed to her current job by Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg in 2009. Born on Staten Island, she focuses on Rikers Island these days, with a goal of making jails safer for those who work in them and for those who are incarcerated. A widow, she lives in a 99-year-old Dutch colonial on City Island in the Bronx with her calico cat, Annie Annie. Sundays at this time of year find Ms. Schriro in her garden, where she recently planted eight new rosebushes.

title: A Boat and a Train to the Colonial Past
description: If, like Edna St. Vincent Millay in her poem Recuerdo, you get off the ferry with only subway fare in your pocket, thats as much as youll need to get to Tottenville, the southernmost town on Staten Island  and in the State of New York. Its surely one of the longer journeys you can take for a single MetroCard swipe: a little over 20 miles from Manhattan, 5 of them over water and 16 on the Staten Island Railway. Named for a family of landowners and shipyard founders, Tottenville is a colonial-era relic amid energetic recent development. Several of the oldest buildings sit within Conference House Park, whose wild, beautiful woods are crisscrossed with paths leading to the shore.

title: In Opener, Jets Unveil Instead of Unleash
description: CINCINNATI  This was early in their preseason opener Friday night, after the Jets failed to record a first down on their opening offensive series. For a brief moment, their punt team had 10 people on the field. It was missing a very important player. It was missing its personal punt protector. It was missing Tim Tebow.

title: Romney to Announce Running Mate Saturday
description: 1:17 a.m. | Updated Mitt Romney is scheduled to announce his vice-presidential candidate on Saturday in Norfolk, Va., with several signs pointing toward Representative Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin emerging as the leading candidate for the position.

title: For Bike Advocates, Delayed Gratification
description: IT was supposed to be the summer of bike share.

title: Day 16: What to Watch For
description: Here are some of the events, teams and athletes to watch Saturday at the London Games. (All times Eastern.)

title: Kicks and Punches Aside, Whats Going On?
description: LONDON  Confusion reigned at the Olympic taekwondo competition this week.

title: Surprise Bounty for Cleanup Artist
description: DARRYL KELLY lives in the Bronx and has never spent a night outside New York City. Harry Shunk had photographs in the Metropolitan Museum of Art and the Centre Pompidou in Paris, and he worked with some of the great artists of the late 20th century. Mr. Kelly is a cleanup man. Mr. Shunk was a recluse and a compulsive hoarder.

title: For Pentathletes, All Business on the First Date
description: LONDON  Today we consider the unfamiliar horse.

title: Romney Responds to Questions in Iowa
description: Mitt Romney answered questions from the crowd at a campaign event in Ames, Iowa.

title: Paul Ryan Heckled at Luncheon
description: Paul Ryan was heckled by protesters at a luncheon in West Allis, Wisc., on September 6, 2011.

title: For Jennifer Sultan, a Dot-Com Bust
description: OF the five members of a purported crime ring who appeared in court last month, Jennifer Sultan could not help but stand out. She seemed to have little in common with those said to be her accomplices: among them, a police officer charged with stealing his colleagues guns to support a painkiller habit and two unemployed young men from Brooklyn and Queens charged with selling guns and drugs.

title: New Yorks First Ironman Attracts 3 Who Nearly Died
description: No one wakes up one morning and decides to do an Ironman triathlon. It takes time for the mind and body to agree on pursuing one of the most daunting events in sports.

title: Events in New Jersey
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: Events in Connecticut
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: Events in Westchester
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Events on Long Island
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: A New Celebrity for Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES  No strangers to stars and their issues, the Los Angeles Lakers landed Dwight Howard on Friday, ending his long search for a home, at least for another season.

title: Drought and Deluge in the Lower 48
description: Last summers drought, one of the worst in a century, has continued through the winter. This chart shows the proportion of what is now the contiguous U.S. in various stages of drought over 118 years of record-keeping. Roll mouse over individual months to see what percentage of the lower 48 was in drought.

title: Corrections: August 11, 2012
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Extremely Close Up at the Olympics
description: Jed Jacobsohn is on assignment for The New York Times, covering the Olympics in London. They are his seventh Olympics, beginning in 1996 in Atlanta. On Tuesday, he spoke from London with James Estrin. The interview has been edited.

title: Fareed Zakaria Is Suspended After Admitting Plagiarism
description: The Indian-born American journalist Fareed Zakaria apologized on Friday for plagiarizing parts of a column on gun control in the Aug. 20 issue of Time magazine, Christine Haughney reported on the New York Times blog Media Decoder.

title: The Weekend Word: Drought
description: In Todays Times:

title: What We're Watching on Day 16
description: Today we consider the unfamiliar horse. Victor Mather fills us in on this and some Olympic sports you may not know much about, including the modern pentathlon and race walking.

title: Once Again Great, Britain Braces for an Olympics Hangover
description: LONDON  We Brits have been living an uncharacteristic two weeks of national euphoria over our glorious Olympic Games and now were shedding a collective tear that the party is almost over.

title: What Were Watching: An Unfamiliar Horse, of Course
description: (function($){var data = chameleonData;var ticker = new NYTD.NYTMM.NewsTicker($('#nytmm_embed_447'), data);})(jQuery||NYTD.jQuery);

title: Newswallah: Bharat Edition
description: Jammu and Kashmir: A woman delivered a child in a taxi after being turned away by a gynecologist at a government hospital in the Ganderbal district of Kashmir, Kashmir Live reported. State officials will investigate this apparent case of medical negligence, the newspaper wrote.

title: Mitt Romney Names Representative Paul Ryan of Wisconsin as His Running Mate
description: Mr. Romney, the Republican candidate for president, announced his selection of Mr. Ryan via his vice presidential app on Saturday morning.

title: Romney Chooses Ryan, Pushing Fiscal Issues to the Forefront
description: WASHINGTON  Mitt Romney introduced Representative Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin as his running mate on Saturday at a spirited rally in Norfolk, Va., bringing to his side one of the partys young conservative leaders in a move that altered the contours of the campaign and sharpened the choice facing the voters in November.

title: Milestones: Paul Ryan
description: Paul Ryan, a rising star in the Republican Party and a favorite among conservatives who view him as deeply committed to their fiscal principles, has spent nearly his entire career in Washington.

title: Live Updates: Romney Chooses Paul Ryan as Running Mate
description: Mitt Romney introduced Representative Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin as his running mate Saturday morning in Norfolk, Va., the beginning of their bus tour through battleground states. The Times is providing live updates and analysis.

title: Risky Ryan
description: Until this morning, Mitt Romney was running a campaign of extreme caution, in which he seemed intent on making it as hard as possible for votersand Democratsto pin down how he would really govern, which tough choices hed be prepared to make.

title: Mitt Romney on Hunting in 2007
description: Mitt Romney responded to a question about hunting while campaigning in April of 2007.

title: Paul Ryan on His Family and Wisconsin
description: Paul Ryan discusses his upbringing and his family ties to Wisconsin.

title: A Closer Look at the Ryan Budget
description: Mitt Romneys new running mate, Representative Paul D. Ryan, has proposed huge changes in entitlement programs like Medicare and Medicaid, which insure more than 100 million people and account for more than one-fifth of the federal budget.

title: Mexico Wins Soccer Gold Medal
description: Two goals from striker Oribe Peralta fired Mexico to a 2-1 win over tournament favorite Brazil in the mens soccer gold medal game at Wembley on Saturday. The game was barely 30 seconds old when Peralta seized a hasty pass from Rafael da Silva, ran into the penalty area and shot past Gabriel.

title: TimesCast Politics | Romney Picks Ryan
description: A look at the new vice-presidential candidate. | Romney and Ryan as close friends. | A few things you might not know about Mr. Ryan.

title: Rolling Out Ryan
description: A vice presidential nominees rollout can be as important as the nominee himself, and I was struck in particular by something I heard on CNN just minutes before Paul Ryan stepped to the microphone on the U.S.S. Wisconsin to give his speech this morning.

title: Romney Announces Running Mate
description: Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney tapped Rep. Paul Ryan of Wisconsin as his vice presidential running mate on Saturday.

title: For Womens Leagues, Strike 1. Strike 2. Strike 3?
description: One league started after the United States won the 1999 Womens World Cup. Another began play months after the American team won the Olympic gold medal at the 2008 Beijing Games. Neither league  Womens United Soccer Association or Womens Professional Soccer  survived past three seasons. Now, in the afterglow of another United States triumph, in London on Thursday, the focus is back on the prospects for the long-term survival of top-level womens league.

title: For U.S. Volleyball, No Shortage of Stars
description: The United States womens volleyball team have spiked themselves into the gold medal match against Brazil after defeating South Korea in Thursday nights match.

title: Wed and Tortured at 13, Afghan Girl Finds Rare Justice
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  When she refused to prostitute herself or have sex with the man she was forced to marry when she was about 13, officials said, Sahar Guls in-laws tortured her and threw her into a dirty, windowless cellar for months until the police discovered her lying in hay and animal dung.

title: Medals That Were Won Not in Pentathlon or 100 Meters, but in Iambic Pentameter
description: The torrent of sports poetry inspired by the London Olympics continues unabated: NPR even hosted Poetry Games, in which listeners voted on a selection of verse with an athletic theme by celebrated poets from various countries. But few people today recall that poetry, just like the 100 meters, was an official Olympic competition from 1912 to 1948. Sadly, the names of the medal winners are not listed on the International Olympic Committees rosters. And many of the winning poems in the so-called Pentathlon of the Muses  which had to be inspired by the idea of sport  have mysteriously vanished as well, perhaps, as critics have suggested, because of their dubious literary quality.

title: Offensive Coach Gives Defense a Lift
description: CORTLAND, N.Y.  The Jets needed a safety, and not merely any safety. They were, of course, looking for a safety who could blanket opposing receivers and wallop them when they caught the ball, but they really were seeking a maestro, someone who could run the secondary.

title: Redirecting Fresh Water Raises Fears for Farmers
description: COURTLAND, Calif.  On the last Sunday of July, this small town in the Sacramento Rivers delta takes a pause from the peak of the pear harvest season by holding its annual pear fair. A pear run, a pear parade, a pear pie eating contest and a pear fair queen are as much a part of lifes rhythm here as the pruning, picking and packing of pears.

title: Reds Prospect Speeds Up the Stolen Bases Ladder
description: In May, when the Cincinnati Reds prospect Billy Hamilton was starting his mission to steal as many bases as possible, Hamilton said the single-season major league record of 130, set by Rickey Henderson in 1982, was always breakable.

title: Elevating Ryan, and His Budget Details
description: WASHINGTON  To date, Mitt Romney has been criticized for a lack of detail behind his promise to reduce the nations rising debt through sweeping spending cuts and tax changes, but he has also been politically insulated by it.

title: A Sudden Star Works to Keep Things Grounded
description: ALBANY  As Victor Cruz walked off the practice field last week, ahead of him, a chorus rose up the path toward the locker room like a swelling wave. Fans cried their adoration not with catcalls or screeches but through a monophonic purr.

title: At Root of Italy Librarys Plunder, a Tale of Entrenched Practices
description: NAPLES, Italy  For months now, the alarm has been resounding throughout the insular and competitive world of antiquarian books: beware of volumes bearing the stamp of the storied Girolamini Library in Naples. They could be hot.

title: Why Paul Ryan?
description: I did not think that Mitt Romney would choose the Wisconsin congressman Paul Ryan as his running mate. Nor did I think that Romney should pick Ryan as his number two. But now that hes done so, lets consider what might have made the presumptive Republican nominee choose the way he did.

title: A Designers Dream, a Golfers Nightmare
description: KIAWAH ISLAND, S.C.  For more than four decades, the golf course architect Pete Dye has been giving professionals nightmares, heartburn and high anxiety. To some he is a mad scientist. To play a Dye course, they say, is to break into a cold sweat, feel their knees wobble and heart skip a beat. But the 86-year-old Dye has also earned their respect.

title: China Asserts Sea Claim With Politics and Ships
description: HAIKOU, China  China does not want to control all of the South China Sea, says Wu Shicun, the president of a government-sponsored research institute here devoted to that strategic waterway, whose seabed is believed to be rich in oil and natural gas. It wants only 80 percent.

title: At the Games, a Whole Lot of Hugs
description: Emotions at the Olympics run from the highest highs to lowest lows, as seen in these photos of athletes celebrating, consoling and supporting each other in the most human of ways  the hug. Throughout the Olympics there have been thousands of them. Here are 26 of our favorites.

title: Rallying Dodgers, One Cap at a Time
description: LOS ANGELES  From the floor-to-ceiling windows of his wood-paneled owners suite, behind the left-field foul pole at Dodger Stadium, Magic Johnson sees his past and his future. When he arrived in this city in 1979, the Dodgers ruled the sports scene. He wants it to be so again.

title: Variety: A Rowdy Acrostic
description: SECOND SUNDAY PUZZLE  What a visual this quote invokes! I love the phrase the Woodstock of antiquity.

title: U.S. and Turkey to Tighten Coordination on Syria
description: ISTANBUL  Turkey and the United States agreed Saturday to accelerate preparations for the possible fall of Syrias president, Bashar al-Assad, creating a formal bilateral team to manage helping the opposition, providing aid to fleeing refugees and planning for worst-case outcomes that include a chemical weapons attack.

title: Setting Record, and Setting Record Straight
description: LONDON  Far from the London Games, in the eastern German town of Jena, Marlies Gohr watched television Friday as the United States broke one of track and fields oldest and most suspect records in the womens 4x100-meter relay.

title: Ambiguity in Health Law Could Make Family Coverage Too Costly for Many
description: WASHINGTON  The new health care law is known as the Affordable Care Act. But Democrats in Congress and advocates for low-income people say coverage may be unaffordable for millions of Americans because of a cramped reading of the law by the administration and by the Internal Revenue Service in particular.

title: The Triumph That Inspired Kenyan Runners to Be Great
description: In the fall of 1968, I was a college freshman on a football scholarship at Morgan State in Baltimore; Kevin Thompson was a sixth grader living in Harlem. Despite our age difference, we each remember the Mexico City Olympics and the polarizing, often bloody events leading to them.

title: Mexico Has Its Moment in Upset Over Brazil
description: LONDON  On one side of the field the Brazilian soccer prodigy Neymar fell in despair. On the other, the Mexican defender Diego Reyes dropped to the ground with glee. One was despondent that he could not be part of making history; the other was floored that he had.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: A Risky Rationale Behind Romneys Choice of Ryan
description: When is it rational to take a big risk?

title: Prosecution Rests in Kidnapping Trial of Pastor
description: BURLINGTON, Vt.  Prosecutors rested their case on Friday against an Amish-Mennonite pastor accused of abetting an international parental kidnapping, after three days of testimony suggesting that others had also conspired to help a born-again Christian mother spirit her daughter abroad.

title: Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan
description: The speeches from Norfolk, Virginia.

title: Mr. Ryans Cramped Vision
description: Mitt Romneys safe and squishy campaign just took on a much harder edge. A candidate of no details  Ill cut the budget but no need to explain just how  has named a vice-presidential running mate, Paul Ryan, whose vision is filled with endless columns of minus signs. Voters will now be able to see with painful clarity just what the Republican Party has in store for them.

title: Sunday Dialogue: Daring to Tell the Truth
description: Would voters reward or punish honesty in politics?

title: Coalition Soldiers Killed Were Shot in Company of Afghans
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Six of the eight American, British and coalition service members killed since Thursday in southern Afghanistan were shot in the company of their Afghan allies, officials of the NATO-led coalition here said Saturday.

title: Al and Joe Lead the Spam Squad
description: 8:25 a.m. Received an urgent e-mail from Al Gore with an unsettling subject line: Disaster. Turns out the former vice president wanted to tell me that the Republican Party had been hijacked by an extremist fringe, and I should send $3 or more a.s.a.p. Now, Im a fan of the former vice president and, considering some of the blather Ive heard recently from the Tea Party, it didnt surprise me to learn that the G.O.P. had been hijacked. But Im beginning to worry that its the Democrats who are now controlled by an extremist fringe  of e-mail writers. These are some of the genuine campaign e-mails I received over just two days recently:

title: Trade Relations With Russia
description: Congress was supposed to pass a bill to improve trade relations with Russia before it left town for summer recess. That did not happen, and American companies that do business in Russia, or want to, may find themselves at a disadvantage with foreign competitors once Russia joins the World Trade Organization on Aug. 22.

title: In Romneys Image
description: Ann Romney said that Mitt Romney would pick a candidate who shared her husbands values. Take a look at how Mr. Romney and his running mate, Paul D. Ryan, match up.

title: De Facto Life Without Parole
description: Last week, an appeals court in Florida overturned a 60-year sentence for a young defendant who shot someone when he was almost 17 years old and was convicted of attempted murder, armed robbery and armed burglary. He would not have been released from prison until he was 76, exceeding his life expectancy according to National Vital Statistics Reports. The court found his sentence was unconstitutional. On the same day, a Florida state trial judge, without any hesitation, sentenced another defendant to 100 years for crimes he committed as a juvenile.

title: One-of-a-Kind Stats for Angels Rookie
description: Mike Trout turned 21 on Tuesday, and naturally, he celebrated by hitting a home run. It gave Trout, the Los Angeles Angels incomparable rookie, 20 homers for the season. He hit his 21st on Friday, and he entered Saturday with a .345 average and 36 stolen bases, leading the American League in both categories.

title: A Tax Plan That Defies the Rules of Math
description: IN May of 2000, when George W. Bush was running for president on a platform of extravagant tax cuts for all, his campaign did something that would be considered remarkable today: it submitted his tax plan to the Congressional Joint Committee on Taxation, to see how much all those tax cuts would cost the Treasury.

title: For U.S. Women, Medals and a Moment to Celebrate Title IX
description: LONDON  At a news conference Saturday, Ashton Eaton, the Olympic decathlon champion, sat next to fellow United States gold medalists Brenda Villa, Kayla Harrison and Missy Franklin. A question was posed to all the athletes, and a chivalrous Eaton said, Ladies first.

title: The Long, Dry History of the West
description: Long before the current drought or the continuing conversation about global warming, before the Dust Bowl, the climate in large portions of the American West was far drier than modern humans have become accustomed to.

title: 30 Seconds With Ryan Howard
description: First baseman Ryan Howard returned to the Philadelphia Phillies last month after recovering from a torn Achilles tendon. He sustained the injury in making the final out of last years National League division series loss to the St. Louis Cardinals.

title: In Olympic Park, a Deluge From Our Sponsors
description: LONDON

title: Hundred-Year Forecast: Drought
description: BY many measurements, this summers drought is one for the record books. But so was last years drought in the South Central states. And it has been only a decade since an extreme five-year drought hit the American West. Widespread annual droughts, once a rare calamity, have become more frequent and are set to become the new normal.

title: How to Get Doping Out of Sports
description: Denver

title: German Austeritys Lutheran Core
description: IF theres one nationality the rest of the world thinks it readily and totally understands, it is the Germans. Combine their deep involvement with Nazism and anti-Semitism and, voil!  2,000 years of gripping, complex history vanishes.

title: Trust: Ill-Advised in a Digital Age
description: Las Vegas

title: A Social Conservative, Too
description: Paul Ryans conservatism is almost always described in terms of his approach to budgetary matters and his desire to cut federal spending significantly. And that has been the focus of the discussion about him today.

title: They Know They Are Being Watched?
description: Gail Albert Halaban began looking into other peoples windows six years ago, soon after moving to New York. She was living across the street from a 24-hour flower shop, waking up at all hours with a newborn baby, and the shop was the most reliable show in town. Then, when the store changed owners and hours, she said, she needed something else to watch.

title: Victoria Nuland
description: Ambassador Victoria Nuland is a career diplomat and foreign policy adviser who has served under such political opposites as Dick Cheney and Hillary Rodham Clinton. Currently, she is the spokeswoman for the State Department.

title: Meet the Beatles, Again
description: DO the Beatles have any other playlists besides Sgt. Peppers?

title: In Defense of Single Motherhood
description: IN a season of ardent partisan clashing, Americans seem united in at least one shared idea: Single mothers are bad. A Pew Research Center poll on family structures reports that nearly 7 in 10 Americans think single mothers are a bad thing for society.

title: Exploding the Myths About Vietnam
description: AS the war in Afghanistan drags on with no definitive victory in sight for the United States and American troops begin to withdraw, comparisons to the Vietnam War are once again in the air, 50 years after both Washington and Hanoi decided to beef up their forces in South Vietnam. Just take a run through the essential Vietnam War checklist, wrote Tom Engelhardt in Mother Jones magazine, noting theres quagmire and the idea of winning hearts and minds as well as bomb-able, or in our era drone-able, sanctuaries across the border and even a one-man version of My Lai. Although these analogies are particularly attractive to critics  who see Americas battle in Afghanistan as even more futile than Vietnam and advocate a quick exit  they are deeply flawed.

title: Rules Delayed, Governing Denied
description: It has been 19 months since President Obama signed into law the Food Safety Modernization Act, the first overhaul of the Food and Drug Administrations food safety laws since the 1930s. But if you think the food supply has become markedly safer since then, think again.

title: Digging Below the Bottom Line
description: Q: How do New York Times reporters and editors translate corporations quarterly earnings into easy-to-understand articles?

title: Weather Vain
description: Belgrade Lakes, Me.

title: For Men, Sports Stigma Dampens Appeal
description: LONDON  Around and around they went, gracefully shimmying and passing balls, hoops and batons to and fro. The crowd roared as the rhythmic gymnasts, five to a team or competing as individuals, made their way through elaborately choreographed routines. They seemed to have it all: gallons of product in their hair, makeup caked on their smiling faces, and uniforms adorned with enough reflective matter to make a Vegas showgirl blush.

title: The Soul of the Olympics
description: ITS easy to be cynical about the Olympics: about the runaway commercialism; about the jingoism that so many countries bring to the games; about NBC. Definitely about NBC. Its breathless degree of fake suspense during prime time broadcasts has been a silly mockery of our wired ways, and too many on-the-spot interviews with athletes redefined dippy. How do you feel? Jubilant if youve medaled, crushed if you havent and really, really tired. Fill in the blanks.

title: Old Love
description: YEARS ago, when I was a callow 39, I had lunch with a college friend whose intellectual authority over me was considerable; we lunched together often, at least once a month. On that particular occasion I put to him a question that embarrassed me: what if one is deeply in love with a young woman  which was my case  and with age her beauty fades. Will her attraction fatally diminish? Might it be displaced by a sort of repulsion? For instance, when her skin withers and wrinkles, will I still want to kiss the crook of her arms, those arms that I so admire, and, if gallantry pushes me to do so, will I have to avert my eyes?

title: Indians Fade Away in A.L. Central
description: When Travis Hafner signed a $57 million contract extension in 2007, he had just turned 30 and was on his way to his fourth season in a row with at least 100 runs batted in. The Cleveland Indians, who were on their way to a division title, had Hafner locked up through 2012.

title: Likability Index
description: WASHINGTON

title: Romneys Mormon Story
description: THERES an interesting dilemma facing the filmmakers who are presumably hard at work, in some well-hidden editing room, on the biographical movie that will play just before Mitt Romney accepts his partys nomination: What should the movie say about Romneys Mormonism?

title: The Anxious Idiot
Chronicling the Business of the Games
description: LONDON  As spectators crowded into Lords, the famous cricket ground, for an Olympic archery competition one recent morning, two people received a special greeting.

title: In a Land of Pears, a Debate Over Pipelines
description: A $14 billion project would run giant pipelines under the Sacramento River delta, delivering water to corporate farms and areas of Central and Southern California.

title: For Canadian Trainer, Hall of Fame Honors and Big Worries About Future
description: Roger Attfield loves horses. He fell for them as a boy growing up in England, where he became an accomplished show jumping rider and steeplechase jockey.

title: In Contention, Scott Prefers to Look Forward
description: KIAWAH ISLAND, S.C.  Adam Scott isnt dwelling on his failure at the British Open last month. Through two rounds, he was tied for seventh place at the P.G.A. Championship and was well positioned to make a weekend charge for the Wanamaker trophy.

title: Paul Ryan: A Reading List
description: With the news Saturday, there will be tons of coverage of Representative Paul D. Ryan, but I thought it was also worth collecting some of the detailed articles that have been written about Mr. Ryan over the past few years. We welcome other suggestions in the comments section.

title: Before the Meeting Adjourns, Tell Me What Youll Do Next
description: This interview with  Bill Flemming, president of Skanska USA Building Inc., was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: Breaking a Buck, Maybe, but Not Taxpayers Backs
description: MARK Aug. 29 on your calendar. Its the day all of us could end up on the hook for a big future bailout.

title: Farah Wins 5,000 to Give Home Team Another Title
description: LONDON  Mo Farah of Britain ran toward the line in the 5,000 meters, a slow start becoming a burning finish at 3.1 miles. His eyes were wide, and his mouth was open, and 80,000 people howled him on toward his second gold medal.

title: A Mutual Fund Master, Too Worried to Rest
description: VANGUARD, the penny-pinching mutual fund company founded by John C. Bogle, has become a colossus. Its index funds  once derided for not even trying to beat the market  are now the industry standard.

title: For a Fortnight, a Stiff Upper Lip Curls Into a Smile
description: SHEFFIELD, England  All day, people line up here at an unexceptional corner of a town plaza called Barkers Pool, sometimes a dozen or more at a time, waiting to have a photograph taken with a mailbox. This is not just any mailbox, of course. It is a mailbox that has been given a coat of gold paint.

title: Deadly Quakes Strike in Iran
description: TEHRAN  At least 250 people were killed Saturday when two powerful earthquakes struck several towns near the Iranian city of Tabriz, state-run Press TV reported, quoting government officials. Khalil Saei, the director of the crisis management headquarters in East Azarbaijan Province, confirmed the death toll and estimated that over 2,000 were injured.

title: How Big Data Became So Big
description: THIS has been the crossover year for Big Data  as a concept, as a term and, yes, as a marketing tool. Big Data has sprung from the confines of technology circles into the mainstream.

title: Sometimes, Theres a Happy Ending for All
description: IF all you learned about the service economy in the United States is what you read in this column, youd think this country was managed and staffed exclusively by nincompoops and dummies. This is not the case. Certainly, the Hagglers e-mail skews heavily to tales of transactions gone wrong, but remember, this column is basically one large complaint box.

title: Two Prisms for Looking at Chinas Problems
description: CHINA is confronting some serious economic problems, and how Beijing does  or doesnt  respond to them could bend the course of the global economy.

title: Wembley F.C., So Near and Yet So Far
description: LONDON  The bus driver will know, we thought, so my companion tapped on his window in the parking lot.

title: After Sinai Attack, U.S. and Egypt Step Up Talks on Security
description: WASHINGTON  In the wake of the attack that killed 16 Egyptian soldiers near the border with Israel last Sunday, the United States and Egypt are negotiating a package of assistance to address what administration officials described as a worsening security vacuum in the Sinai Peninsula.

title: A Market Rebound Thats Defying Old Rules
description: AT first blush, it may look as if stocks are following a similar pattern to that of the last two years: the market sinks in the spring, then bounces back in the summer amid signs that the economy is getting past a rough patch.

title: Between Outbursts, Rockies Manager Stays Positive
description: When Colorado Rockies Manager Jim Tracy burst onto the field in Los Angeles last Monday to argue a reversed call, a seasoned observer knew what would come next. Vin Scully, the Hall of Fame Dodgers broadcaster, was about to narrate a tirade as only he could.

title: Galt / Gekko 2012
description: Paul Ryan for VP  or, as Romney said in the press conference, the next president of the United States. I did say Galt/Gekko, not Gekko/Galt.

title: The Caucus Click: A New Stage for the New Ticket
Bolts Last Run Results in World Record and Third Gold
description: LONDON  After an unforgettable performance in the 4x100-meter relay, Usain Bolt of Jamaica wanted a souvenir with which to remember his second Olympics. His grip tightened around his object of choice: not a trinket featuring the London Games omnipresent one-eyed mascots, but the baton he had received from his training mate, Yohan Blake, and carried across the finish line in world-record time moments earlier.

title: Top Two Winning Nations Cant Help Being Rivals
description: It is, for now, a muted Olympic rivalry. China and the United States have been jostling for the top spot on the medal ladder for three Summer Games now, and yet the tussle remains more statistical than emotional.

title: Paul Ryans G.O.P. Budget Proposal
description: Details of the 2013 House Budget Committee proposal under Paul Ryan.

title: Paul Ryan and Previous Paths to the Vice Presidency
description: How Paul Ryans career compares with the countrys most recent vice presidents.

title: Brazil Keeps Celebrating as Gold Eludes U.S. Again
description: LONDON  At the end of the Olympic volleyball final, for the second Summer Games in a row, the United States women found themselves in second place on the medals stand watching the Brazilian team wildly celebrate its victory.

title: What Europe Thinks of Paul Ryan
description: LONDON  Bold but risky, cautious but clever. The European press was mulling what it thought on Saturday of Mitt Romneys choice of Paul D. Ryan as his Republican vice-presidential running mate.

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, Aug. 12
description: The decision is in: Representative Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin is Mitt Romneys running mate.

title: With Nova in Form, Yanks Beat Toronto, Lose Sabathia and Add Lowe
description: TORONTO  Just as one Yankees starter, who was seemingly lost, was rediscovered on Saturday, a more important one disappeared.

title: The Trail to the Top
description: I WAS the fourth of five children, raised in San Jose, Calif., with a stay-at-home mother and a father who was an operations manager for Lockheeds missile systems division. My dad earned his masters degree while working full time when we were little. He was my first role model when it came to working hard.

title: After Medal Haul, Phelps Plans to Work on His Golf Game
description: After 22 Olympic medals, 18 of them gold, Michael Phelps has a new goal: improve his golf game. And after providing NBCs Olympic broadcasts with high ratings for his races, Phelps will get help from the Golf Channel, a part of the NBC Sports Group, as the latest celebrity to appear on the swing coach Hank Haneys Haney Project.

title: Yankees Put Sabathia on Disabled List With Elbow Soreness
description: TORONTO  The Yankees placed C.C. Sabathia on the disabled list Saturday because of recurring soreness in his left elbow, Manager Joe Girardi said.

title: U.S. Women Run Away With 5th Straight Gold
description: LONDON  The most dominant team in basketball, mens or womens, college or professional, domestic or international, won another gold medal Saturday. It felt like 2008 all over again. Or 2004. Or 2000. Or 1996.

title: Obama Signs Law Exempting Many Appointees From Senate Approval
description: A backlog that has left many government agencies without presidential appointees for months at a time may ease a bit because President Obama signed legislation on Friday exempting scores of government positions from Senate confirmation.

title: On Pittsburgh and the Peace Sign
description: WHEN it comes to cities that fuel the creative fire, Pittsburgh isnt usually the first to spring to mind. But dont tell Kyle Abraham. This dancer and choreographer has been mining that town for material his entire career. Born there into the hip-hop culture of the late 1970s, Mr. Abraham, 34, mixes that influence with classical music and movement training. In 2010 he caught the eye of the dance world with The Radio Show, which was inspired by a Pittsburgh station and earned him a Bessie Award. It dealt with race and identity, issues hes explored throughout his work. Then came Live! The Realest MC, loosely based on the story of Pinocchio and an autobiographical look at coming out in a hip-hop world.

title: The Meaning of It
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  IT took me a while, but I think Ive finally gotten over my What have you done for me since the October, 2011, puzzle contest, Patrick Berry? thing. Todays Sunday puzzle is the kind of jokey, strong, wordplay-filled grid I like to see from him. And clean. This is no stunt grid, but even when he makes a showy puzzle, Mr. Berry can be counted on to fill his puzzle well.

title: Martin Fleischmann, Seeker of Cold Fusion, Dies at 85
description: Martin Fleischmann made the greatest discovery since fire: replicating the furnace of the sun at room temperature in a jar of water, essentially solving the worlds energy needs forever.

title: Jean Merrill, a Writer of Childrens Underdog Tales, Dies at 89
description: Jean Merrill, a childrens author best known for her 1964 book, The Pushcart War, about street peddlers in New York who use (nonlethal) guerrilla tactics and savvy publicity maneuvers to fight back when unbridled Big Business threatens to banish their pushcarts from the streets  a book, in other words, that Mother Jones or Saul Alinsky might have produced had they been writers of whimsical allegories  died on Aug. 2 at her home in Randolph, Vt. She was 89.

title: The Power of Music, Tapped in a Cubicle
description: Editors note: Heres one of our favorite stories from the archives, now being featured in our Smarter Living collection.

title: Mexico Tops Brazil for Gold Medal
description: Mexico scored less than 30 seconds in during a 2-1 victory for the countrys first Olympic title in mens soccer.

title: Three Players Suspended for Conspiring to Cheat
description: Nearly two years after an investigation began into cheating accusations involving three top French players, the World Chess Federation has ruled that they are guilty and has temporarily barred them from chess.

title: In Romney and Ryan, a Pair Who Dont Mind Their Differences
description: NORFOLK, Va.  For their debut as the Republican ticket, Mitt Romney and Paul D. Ryan descended single file from the rear of the battleship Wisconsin to the soaring soundtrack of the film Air Force One, waving to a crowd of about 2,500 that had been handed small American flags.

title: Massacre on the Nueces
description: Just after midnight on Aug. 10, 1862, nearly 100 dismounted Confederate cavalry and state militia crept across the dry Texas Hill Country toward a campsite on the banks of the clear Nueces River, where 65 men slept, with just two on watch. Suddenly the dark silence was shattered by Confederate gunfire. Before sunset, those who had not escaped were dead or captured  and the captured were quickly executed.

title: Gold for Bolt, Farah and the U.S. Women
description: The Jamaicans won the 4x100-meter relay, and host Britain added another gold of its own on the track.

title: Two Months to Assess Santanas Future
description: Johan Santanas start Saturday, his first since missing three weeks with a sprained right ankle, was a welcomed return for the struggling Mets, who have seen their season fizzle after a promising first half.

title: Racial Profiling Rife at Airport, U.S. Officers Say
description: BOSTON  More than 30 federal officers in an airport program intended to spot telltale mannerisms of potential terrorists say the operation has become a magnet for racial profiling, targeting not only Middle Easterners but also blacks, Hispanics and other minorities.

title: Aug. 11: Will Ryan Pick Move the Polls?
description: Well be hitting few different topics in this polling update, most of them related to Mitt Romneys selection of Representative Paul D. Ryan as his running mate.

title: Three Players Move Up at the P.G.A.
description: KIAWAH ISLAND, S.C.  Before the rain came on Saturday, three players stormed into contention on moving day.

title: Nurturing Champions, With Family at His Side
description: LONDON  The family Krzyzewski gathered at an Italian restaurant late last week, all 16 of them, as the end to another Olympic basketball tournament drew near. Children crawled under the table. Food spilled. Babies cried.

title: American Upsets Chinese and Tops Local Favorite in Diving
description: LONDON  Chinese divers had won six of the seven gold medals awarded at the London Games going into the conclusion of the diving program Saturday night. They were expected to win their seventh in that final event, the mens 10-meter platform. Two Chinese divers, Qiu Bo and Lin Yue, were ranked first and second after the preliminaries and again after the semifinals.

title: Athlete Dies Competing in Swim Leg of Triathlon
description: An athlete competing in New York Citys first Ironman triathlon died Saturday morning during the 2.4-mile swim in the Hudson River, the first stage in the grueling 140-mile race, according to the police.

title: Police Fatally Shoot Knife-Wielding Man in Times Square
description: When the tourists and shoppers thronging Times Square on Saturday afternoon first saw the police officers, guns drawn, confronting a knife-wielding man, many thought they had stumbled onto a movie set.

title: Scenes From the Modern Pentathlon
description: Fence, swim, ride, shoot, run. Simple.

title: South Korean Denied Medal Over Politics
description: LONDON  A South Korean soccer player was barred from receiving his bronze medal at the London Olympics on Saturday for displaying a sign with a political message after a victory over Japan in the third-place game.

title: Shadows Over Ironman, but a Spirit of Carrying On
description: The death of a swimmer and a water contamination scare cast a shadow over the Ironman U.S. Championship on Saturday, but organizers and participants professed that they were upbeat about the races debut.

title: Ryan Pick Gives Obama Chance to Change Subject
description: The selection of Representative Paul D. Ryan as the Republican vice-presidential candidate provides President Obama with something he has been eagerly looking for  a bigger target.

title: Running Mate Is an Upbeat Budget Cutter, Eager to Joust With Democrats
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Paul D. Ryan, the 42-year-old Republican named on Saturday as Mitt Romneys vice-presidential running mate, is idolized by young conservatives in the House, who see him as a role model and a polished spokesman for their vision of America.

title: In Modern Pentathlon, a Day of Madness
description: LONDON  While the rest of London was still sleeping on Saturday morning, 36 men got up, put on their white fencing uniforms and headed to the Copper Box, their first step in an important daylong quest to win one of the more bizarre and grueling Olympic events.

title: Meditations from the Dad in the Minivan
description: Dan Zevin, author of Dan Gets a Minivan: Life at the Intersection of Dude and Dad and The Day I Turned Uncool, may be a humorist, but like the dads profiled in the Sunday Styles piece Just Wait Until Your Mother Gets Home, he has also been a full-time father, squeezing in a sentence or two during nap time. Now, when the babysitter doesnt show, or the school calls to turn in the child with a fever he dropped off moments before, hes the guy who takes the fall. His musings on fatherhood, in appropriately short, new-parent appropriate bursts, follow.

title: McIlroy and Singh Share Lead as Heavy Rain Stops Play
description: KIAWAH ISLAND, S.C.  If you build a golf course on the ocean, there is always the chance a storm will roll in from the sea. And throughout the week at the 2012 P.G.A. Championship, thunderstorms have been in the forecast every day for the Ocean Course on Kiawah Island. But the rain has been infrequent, with little impact on play  until Saturday.

title: Looking to Mexico for an Alternative to Abortion Clinics
description: MCALLEN  In this Roman Catholic stronghold, where abortion is deeply stigmatized, reproductive health providers tell stories of women going to pharmacies across the border in Mexico, in search of a drug they hope will terminate unwanted pregnancies.

title: Knee Injury Sidelines Jets Safety
description: Safety Eric Smith, an integral member of the Jets secondary and a valuable contributor on special teams, could miss the rest of the preseason after spraining the medial collateral ligament in his left knee while covering a punt during the teams 17-6 loss to Cincinnati on Friday night. The extent of Smiths injury has not been announced by the team, but a football official with knowledge of his magnetic resonance imaging results confirmed it. Smith could return for the Sept. 9 season opener against Buffalo.  The police in Davie, Fla., said that Dolphins receiver Chad Johnson had been arrested on a domestic violence charge, accused of head-butting his newlywed wife during an argument in front of their home. Johnsons wife, Evelyn Lozada, is on the reality show Basketball Wives. Johnson changed his last name back from Ochocinco after his wedding to Lozada. (AP)

title: Police Shoot Man in Midtown, and Tourists Reach for Cameras
description: The typical afternoon furor in Times Square became something more menacing on Saturday as throngs of police officers drew their weapons and pursued a man with a large knife down Seventh Avenue and then shot him to death.

title: A Dire Dance for a Harlem Cultural Center
description: Stomping and twisting, homeless mothers and children and young professionals were all part of the mix at the Dwyer Cultural Center in Harlem one recent Saturday, as they tried to master the intricacies of swing dancing. But scenes like this have been few and far between lately. The Dwyer, which since opening three years ago has attracted 75,000 visitors to visual art exhibitions, readings, writers workshops, childrens educational programs and music and theater performances  all free or low-cost  has run into major financial problems.

title: In Ill Doctor, a Surprise Reflection of Who Picks Assisted Suicide
description: SEATTLE  Dr. Richard Wesley has amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, the incurable disease that lays waste to muscles while leaving the mind intact. He lives with the knowledge that an untimely death is chasing him down, but takes solace in knowing that he can decide exactly when, where and how he will die.

title: In Hard Times, Schools Zero In on Employees
description: When Texas lawmakers took up the issue of how to make fewer dollars stretch further in public schools during the 2011 legislative session, efficiency was a commonly uttered word.

title: In a G.O.P.-Dominated State, Democrats Wait for Their Opening
description: Being a Democrat in a Texas election is like being the fastest sprinter outside of Jamaica or the best beach volleyball team outside of the United States. Unless something odd happens, your medal will be silver or bronze.

title: What the Star Chefs Love in Houstons Chinatown
description: Mention Chinatown to Texans, and many will think first of New York or San Francisco, where traditional Chinese street signs, bumpy durian fruits and bamboo baskets filled with dumplings have inspired countless Instagrams. While the Chinatowns in those cities have long been tourist destinations, a similar corridor in Houston receives less recognition, even from local residents, a surprising fact considering that Houstons New Chinatown is large (almost six square miles) and centered on a busy stretch of Bellaire Boulevard. Many people have lived in Houston all of their lives and have never been here, said Christy Chang, who gives weekly tours of the area with her company, Asian Heritage Discovery.

title: About as Bad as It Gets for Santana in His Return
description: The much-anticipated return of Johan Santana began with the expectation that three weeks on the disabled list with a sprained ankle had helped rest his fatigued left arm.

title: How Campaign Outwitted the 24-Hour News Cycle
description: DULLES, Va.  The escape plan was carefully choreographed. On Friday, after a day of work, Representative Paul D. Ryan pretended to turn in for the night, walking through the front door of his home in Janesville, Wis.
