description: CAIRO  In his purge of Egypts top generals, President Mohamed Morsi leaned on the support of a junior officer corps that blamed the old guard for a litany of problems within the military and for involving the armed forces too deeply in the countrys politics after the uprising that ousted Mr. Morsis predecessor, Hosni Mubarak.

title: Obama Rejoins Campaign Trail in Iowa and Finds a Brand-New Rival There
description: DES MOINES  President Obama and Representative Paul D. Ryan went head-to-head Monday for the first time since Mr. Ryan ascended to the Republican presidential ticket.

title: Vote Tuesday in Connecticut
description: Getting voters to go to the polls in mid-August is always a daunting proposition. But Tuesdays primary election in Connecticut is important, not just for the state but for the fight over the control of Congress.

title: Is Our Children Learning Enough Grammar to Get Hired?
Grading the Teacher
description: To the Editor:

title: Nicholson Baker, on Killing
description: To the Editor:

title: Music and Web Piracy
description: To the Editor:

title: The Bold to Mitts Bland
description: By picking Paul Ryan, Mitt Romney got someone who could shore up his conservative credentials. He got someone Catholic. And he made himself look like a political daredevil, which no one had previously mistaken him for.

title: Palestinian Seeks Diplomatic Allies
description: Hanan Ashrawi, a member of the Palestine Liberation Organizations executive committee, asked diplomats from two dozen countries on Monday to support the Palestinian Authoritys renewed bid for observer-state status at the United Nations, calling it a test of the whole rule of law. Speaking in East Jerusalem to envoys from countries in Europe, Latin America, Asia and the Middle East, Ms. Ashrawi asked them not only to vote for the future United Nations resolution on observer-state status, possibly this fall, but to provide the Palestinian Authority with a financial safety net when, she predicted, Americans decide to cut off aid because of the bid. The Palestinians plan is to petition the United Nations General Assembly, where passage is all but assured. That would give the Palestinians access to organizations like the International Criminal Court, where they hope to pursue claims against Israel on matters like settlements.

title: Let the Real Debate Begin
description: Mitt Romneys choice of Paul Ryan to be his running mate is  do I dare say this?  good news for lots of people. Conservative Republicans will mobilize around a deeply conservative Tea Party hero, who will help ease their essential discomfort with their presumptive presidential nominee. Democrats will try to make political hay over the shrink-the-government budget proposals that Ryan, a congressman from Wisconsin, has rolled out in the House, starting with his plan to save Medicare by essentially creating a voucher program that would inevitably cause seniors to pay for more of their own health care.

title: Quinn Seeks to Expand City Program Benefiting Companies Owned by Minorities and Women
description: Responding to longstanding appeals from civil rights groups, the City Council speaker, Christine C. Quinn, plans to introduce a bill that would significantly expand New York Citys efforts to direct contracts to companies owned by women and minorities.

title: In Rules of Golf, Leaf Can Loom Larger Than an Entire Tree
description: KIAWAH ISLAND, S.C.  The Rules of Golf got a workout at the P.G.A. Championship.

title: In Shanghai, Focus Media Weighs Takeover Proposal
description: Focus Media Holding, a Chinese advertising company, said Monday it had received a takeover proposal from a group of private equity firms, including the Carlyle Group, in what would be Chinas largest leveraged buyout.

title: Free Speech, Even if Hateful
description: To the Editor:

title: Where Do Sentences Come From?
description: Sift the debris of a young writers education, and you find dreadful things  strictures, prohibitions, dos, donts, an unnatural and nearly neurotic obsession with style, argument and transition. Yet in that debris you find no traces of a fundamental question: where do sentences come from? This is a philosophical question, as valuable in the asking as in the answering. But its a practical question, too. Think about it long enough, and you begin to realize that many, if not most, of the things we believe about writing are false.

title: WikiLeaks Stirs Global Fears on Antiterrorist Software
description: WASHINGTON  A new release of stolen corporate e-mails by WikiLeaks has set off a flurry of concern and speculation around the world about a counterterrorist software program called TrapWire, which analyzes images from surveillance cameras and other data to try to identify terrorists planning attacks.

title: Israel and Iran
description: Israeli leaders are again talking about possible military action against Iran. This is, at best, mischievous and, at worst, irresponsible, especially when diplomacy has time to run.

title: Michael Dokes, Larger-Than-Life Heavyweight Boxer, Dies at 54
description: Michael Dokes, who used his swift, punishing fists to become the world heavyweight boxing champion in 1982 and, 15 years later, to beat his live-in girlfriend so savagely that he was convicted of attempted murder, died on Saturday at a hospice in Akron, Ohio. He was 54.

title: Reform in Romania?
description: To the Editor:

title: Misconduct by Prosecutors, Once Again
description: In March 2000, a tough guy named Petros Bedi was convicted of shooting a man dead in an Astoria nightclub. For this and other crimes, he is now serving 42 1/2 years in prison.

title: The Early Word: A Gamble
description: Todays Times

title: Systematic Office Sabotage, With a Smile
description: The pretty Patricia arrives at an advertising firm with no degrees, references or any discernible past whatsoever. Somehow, though, she manages to talk her way into a plum secretarial gig. It helps that her new boss, Bert, is the type of comb-overed cad who likes to give unsolicited career advice while massaging your feet.

title: Fatal Fall From Palisades Raises Concerns on Safety
description: ENGLEWOOD CLIFFS, N.J.  A fatal fall from the Palisades here over the weekend, the third this summer, has raised concerns about safety along the steep cliffs of the Hudson River.

title: Summer Hideaways
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  The epitaph that Thomas Jefferson wrote for himself lists precisely three accomplishments: that he authored the Declaration of Independence and the Virginia Statute of Religious Freedom and that he founded the University of Virginia. (Not one to pad a rsum, Jefferson refrained from mentioning, you know, his presidency.) If you knew this, you probably had no trouble filling in 46 Across, which referred to the establishment of UVA. Its just one of many clues in todays Ian Livengood-constructed puzzle that seems perfectly suited for mid-August: tossed in alongside vacation destinations in the theme, there are a couple of nagging reminders of school.

title: Corrections: August 14, 2012
description: FRONT PAGE

title: 3 Dead, Including Gunman, in Shooting Near Texas A&M
description: COLLEGE STATION, Tex.  A gunman opened fire on police officers near the Texas A&M University campus shortly after noon on Monday, killing at least two people, including a local constable, and wounding four others, the police said. The gunman, who was shot by officers, died after he was taken into custody.

title: Repair New York Citys Housing Issues
description: More than 650,000 people live in housing that is controlled or subsidized by the New York City Housing Authority. Too many have to wait for months for needed repairs to leaking plumbing and other problems. In an estimated 10,000 apartments, repairs are not scheduled until 2014. This is clearly unacceptable.

title: A Question of Improper Money Flows
description: Update: On Tuesday afternoon, New Yorks Superintendent of Financial Services, Benjamin M. Lawsky, reached a $340 million settlement with Standard Chartered on the banks Iran transactions.

title: Confusion Over How to Aid Iran Quake Victims
description: The deadly double earthquakes in Iran over the weekend, the first natural disaster there since the United States imposed onerous financial sanctions on that country because of its disputed nuclear program, have raised worries among Iranian-Americans about where to send donations  and whether such aid is even legal.

title: Tight End Means Business as He Lightens Mood for Giants
description: ALBANY  The tall, bearded man was smiling, joking, laughing. He is new to the Giants and their all-business coach, which makes his demeanor different from most of his teammates. He could be the Giants starting tight end. And he has become one of their most talkative players.

title: Ryan Has Kept Close Ties to Wealthy Donors on the Right
description: This month, as a handful of Republicans auditioned at town halls and on bus tours to be Mitt Romneys running mate, Representative Paul D. Ryan joined a private conference call. For 20 minutes, he walked through his plan to cut government spending and bashed President Obama for weakening welfare work requirements.

title: Everything Wall St. Should Know About Ryan
description: He could be mistaken for a Wall Street banker. Or perhaps a hedge fund manager. Or even a managing director at a private equity firm, like Bain Capital.

title: Mexico: Suspect Linked to Veracruz Killings, Officials Say
description: The Mexican Navy announced Monday that a man suspected of being a member of a drug gang had been captured while carrying the identification cards of a recently slain newspaper employee in the state of Veracruz. The authorities link the suspect, Juan Carlos Hernndez Pulido, whom they captured Friday, to the killing of the newspaper employee, Irasema Becerra. Her dismembered remains were found in May along with those of three photojournalists. Six journalists have been killed in Mexico so far this year; five of them in Veracruz. None of the crimes have been solved yet.

title: Aug. 13: Polls Have Middling Reviews for Ryan
description: This is a another two-for-one column. Well give you our daily breakdown of the horse-race polls and economic data that came out on Monday. Then, well take a quick look at overnight polls that took the temperature of Mitt Romneys new running mate, Representative Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin.

title: Shooting in College Station, Texas
description: Amateur video shows the scene of a shooting near Texas A&M campus.

title: Lowe Earns Save in Yankees Debut
description: A week ago, Derek Lowe sat on his couch in Cleveland watching baseball highlights on television and wondering when his next chance to pitch would come. And for whom? And what if it doesnt?

title: Questions Linger on Parks Advocate
description: A red light shines at the apex of a weathered pavilion in Flushing Meadows-Corona Park, a relic from the 1964 Worlds Fair, warning aircraft to steer clear of the decrepit monument. The task of repairing the light when it burns out has fallen to a nonprofit group that has, over the years, raised about a million dollars toward improving the park.

title: Attitudes of Older Voters in Key States
description: Elderly voters are significant forces in Iowa, New Hampshire, Ohio, and Virginia and Pennsylvania, all states that could help determine the outcome of the election.

title: Gregory Powell, The Onion Field Killer, Dies at 79
description: Gregory Powell, who was convicted of kidnapping and killing a Los Angeles police officer in 1963, a brutal crime that inspired the popular book and film The Onion Field, died on Sunday in a prison hospital in Vacaville, Calif. He was 79.

title: Young Immigrants, in America Illegally, Line Up for Reprieve
description: LOS ANGELES  With their expectations soaring, young illegal immigrants across the country are preparing to apply for a temporary reprieve from deportation that the Obama administration is offering. For the first time, as many as 1.7 million of them could be allowed to work legally and live openly in this country without fear of being expelled.

title: After Bullets Fly in Texas, a Soldiers Wartime Training Is Needed at Home
description: When a gun battle between police and a man armed with an assault rifle broke out on a street close to the Texas A&M campus on Monday, most nearby residents took cover. Rigo Cisneros reached for his smartphone.

title: Four Teenagers Are Shot in Brooklyn
description: Four teenagers were wounded on Monday in a shooting at a playground in Brooklyn, the police said, the latest in a spate of gun violence involving young people.

title: On the Campaign Trail, in Florida and Iowa
description: Mitt Romney went solo at events in Florida, while his new running mate, Paul D. Ryan, and President Obama talked to voters in the heartland.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,064 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American recently:

title: Postmates Mobile Delivery App Quickly Speeds Up
description: Postmates, a San Francisco-based mobile delivery service, is growing faster than its bicycle messengers can ride.

title: Mens Wear Inspires in Prospect Heights
description: Alli Kobrick wore oversize black pants from Urban Outfitters, a black short-sleeved vest from Beacons Closet over a black T-shirt and brightly printed sneakers she bought out West.

title: Hollywoods Great 3-D Leap Forward Into China
description: HONG KONG  The film director James Cameron, whose Avatar is the highest-grossing film ever in China, is making a new push onto the mainland with plans for a production company that will focus on 3-D movies.

title: Frontal Crash Test Results Dull the Gleam of Some Midsize Luxury Sedans
description: Though major automakers routinely ace crash tests overseen by the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety, the results of a new test are expected to send many manufacturers back to their R.&D. labs.

title: The Other Running Mates
description: The argument over whether American feminism is really dead  or just beaten back into a corner  never fails to get a conversation going.Indeed, its fair to say we cant stop talking, writing or reading the chatter about it, in private or in public. In the late summer stretch from now into September, this topic is bound to heat up as Michelle Obama and Ann Romney make their own campaign stops  though 2012 is no 2008 when it comes to up-ending age-old paradigms for women in politics.

title: Word of the Day | kindred
description: kindred \kin-drd\ adjective

title: Men Join Gods in Kolkatas Statuary
description: For at least two centuries, residents of Kolkata have come to Kumartuli to purchase idols made of clay from a man named Paul.

title: News Quiz | August 14, 2012
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: Paan Stains Dot the Sidewalks of Queens
description: On a stroll through the busy streets of Jackson Heights, Queens, Sahadev Poudel kept gesturing at the ground with disgust, Nicholas Hirshon wrote in The New York Times. He stopped on the sidewalks in front of sari boutiques and Indian grocery stores, pointing out stains that looked like dried blood.

title: Test Yourself | English, Aug. 14, 2012
description: The question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the On the Runway blog post At Pratt, Seeking a Sophisticated Eye.

title: Indian Gods Begging Devotion
description: Near the beginning of her show Being Becoming, the Bharata Natyam dancer Malini Srinivasan sits behind translucent red fabric and adorns herself, Brian Seibert of The New York Times wrote in a review of the dancers show, part of the New York International Fringe Festival.

title: Criminalizing Photography
description: Mickey H. Osterreicher is the general counsel for the National Press Photographers Association and edits the organizations Advocacy Committee blog. He spoke with James Estrin. Their conversation has been edited.

title: Looking for Nocturnal Creatures in a City Park
description: WHO is Mike Feller?

title: No Longer Stagnating, Euro Zone Contracts
description: FRANKFURT  The economy in the euro zone officially shifted to contraction from stagnation in the second quarter of 2012, data showed on Tuesday, portending a recession for the region later in the year that would put even more pressure on political leaders struggling to keep the common currency intact.

title: Baltimore Ravens, 2012 N.F.L. Season Preview
description: There are 27 seconds left in the A.F.C championship game. The visiting Baltimore Ravens trail the New England Patriots by 3. Its second-and-1. Quarterback Joe Flacco is dropping back to pass. He has completed five of his last seven throws on whats turning out to be a brilliant 56-yard drive. Flacco calmly pump-fakes and then slings a laser between two defenders in the front corner of the end zone. The ball lands in the hands of wide receiver Lee Evans. Its an incredible throw  the type of throw that exhibits why the Ravens took Flacco in the first round, the type of throw that makes fans forget about Flaccos middling 57.6 percent accuracy in the regular season or his four-year reputation as the young quarterback who isnt ready to push a great Ravens club over the top.

title: Blaming Obama for George W. Bushs Policies
description: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of The Benefit and the Burden: Tax Reform  Why We Need It and What It Will Take.

title: Fantasy Focus: The Top 10 in Profit
description: Remember when Matt Kemp was tearing up the league in April, and everyone who didnt have a top-three pick was upset about missing out him? And then it was Josh Hamilton, on pace for 100 home runs and 1,000 runs batted in through the end of May.

title: Crashes Underline Ugandas Spotty Record With Helicopters
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  Ugandan soldiers are gearing up for a major offensive in Somalia and have vowed to crush Islamist insurgents.

title: Intersection: Borrowing From the Boys
description: Prospect Heights, Brooklyn, is a small neighborhood with a lot of style. This part of Brooklyn lies between Grand Army Plaza and Atlantic Avenue, and Flatbush and Washington Avenues; and borders Park Slope, Crown Heights, Clinton Hill and Fort Greene. Its mix of tree-lined streets, brick-face houses, sidewalk cafes, bars, boutiques and yoga studios make for a model urban epicenter.

title: The One Task I Cant Seem to Delegate
description: The other day, three yearly license plate renewal stickers arrived in the mail for three of my company vehicles. This meant someone would have to put the stickers on and replace the registration card in each of the cars. Normally, that someone would be me. While I have become quite adept at delegating almost everything else, the combination of vehicles and stickers has long been a surprising source of grief, education and humor for me. I have given speeches about my failures to manage this process.

title: From Nalli Nihari to Malpua, Mumbai Offers Hearty Ramadan Fare
description: There is never a better time to be a meat eater in Mumbai than the month of Ramadan, when streets come alive with delectable aromas in the evening as Muslims prepare to break their fast.

title: What Egypts New Guard Thinks About America
description: LONDON  As analysts grapple with the implications of a purge of the senior echelons of the Egyptian military by Mohamed Morsi, the countrys Muslim Brotherhood president, the inevitable question in Washington is where the new guard stands in relation to the United States.

title: Ex-Premier Says Syrian Government Is Falling Apart
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Syrias former prime minister, who fled the country last week, said on Tuesday in his first public appearance since his defection that the government of President Bashar al-Assad was crumbling internally under the pressure of relentless fighting against rebels, and from betrayals by loyalists who want only to flee.

title: Through Ryan, Obama Seeks to Link Romney to Congress
description: In a speech a year ago, an angry and exasperated President Obama hinted at one of the themes he planned to use to try to win a second term in the White House.

title: Heineken Faces Challenge Over Asian Brewer
description: LONDON  Heinekens efforts to secure a controlling stake in Asia Pacific Breweries is facing a setback after Thai Beverage increased its stake in Fraser & Neave, the Singapore-based conglomerate that had agreed to sell its rights in the Asian brewer to Heineken for around $4.1 billion.

title: Christie to Be G.O.P. Convention Keynote Speaker
description: Chris Christie, the governor of New Jersey, will bring his blunt, everyman style of politics to a much bigger, prime-time stage as the keynote speaker of the Republican National Convention, officials announced on Tuesday.

title: French Leader Promises Order After Youths Riot in a Northern City
description: PARIS  President Franois Hollande of France said Tuesday that his Socialist government would do everything necessary to ensure that law and order prevailed after rioting overnight in the northern city of Amiens.

title: Game of Questions and, With Luck, Answers
description: Padgett Powell, the Southern comic novelist, is a veteran hurler of literary knuckleballs. When hes on, few can touch him. When hes not, look out. Someone in the stands is going to be beaned.

title: Le Fooding Storms Brooklyn
description: For the fourth year running, Le Fooding, a French group that takes an irreverent approach to French food and chefs, will come to New York, for a series of events they have scheduled from Sept. 19 to 23. Theyve finally discovered Brooklyn, and are calling the program Brooklyn Fling.

title: Opinion Report: Standard Chartered
description: From the editorial page

title: Safety-Kleen Files for an I.P.O.
description: Safety-Kleen, which shelved an initial public offering in October 2008 at the height of the financial crisis, filed on Tuesday to go public.

title: Tuesday Reading: States Stiffen Driving Laws for Teenagers
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and on our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: A Bus Driver Whistles While He Works
description: Dear Diary:

title: For $330, an Extension Cord With a Brain
description: How smart does an extension cord need to be? Well, if its in a garage full of exotic cars or in an antiques restoration shop, you might want it to be pretty smart.

title: American Roots of the Indian Independence Movement
description: In June 1916, an Indian living in California wrote a letter to The New York Times emphasizing how profoundly Indians in the United States had been influenced by the political values of their adoptive country.

title: Q&A: Sorting Accounts With Microsoft
description: Q.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: How H.G.B. (Re)vamped Magazines, and Commiting Photography in Public
description: Helen Gurley Brown, who died on Monday at 90, was remembered for her transformation of Cosmopolitan magazine, and ultimately the field of womens magazines. She was hired to run the stodgy magazine in 1965 after her book Sex and the Single Girl sold millions copies and was turned into a movie starring Natalie Wood. As Margolit Fox writes in her obituary: Her influence on Cosmopolitan was swift and certain: she did not so much revamp the magazine as vamp it. As for her influence on society, Ms. Fox concludes:

title: Unable to Crack Computer Virus, Security Firm Seeks Help
description: Five days after a computer security firm disclosed the discovery of Gauss, a computer virus targeting computers in Lebanon, they issued a cry for help.

title: Glow Biz
description: She isnt called the cosmic facialist for nothing. The London-born, New York-based Georgia Louise uses a combination of cutting-edge machines, meditation, massage and holistic nutritional advice to tend to the skin  and spirits  of A-listers like Emma Stone, Cameron Diaz and Linda Evangelista. Go to georgialouise.co.uk; (212) 388-0800.

title: A Polymer to Protect Phones From Impact
description: The super-shock-absorbent material called non-Newtonian polymer inspires a lot of dont-try-this-at-home stunts, like getting whacked in the head with a shovel through a layer of the stuff.

title: Hard Truth for Author: Publisher Pulls The Jefferson Lies
description: Last month the History News Network voted David Bartons book The Jefferson Lies the least credible history book in print. Now the books publisher, Thomas Nelson, has decided to stop publishing and distributing it.

title: Daily Report: Google Buys Frommers, in Continuing Effort to Produce Original Content
description: Google made another foray into producing original content when it announced on Monday its plans to buy the Frommers brand of travel guides from John Wiley & Sons to augment its local and travel search results, reports Claire Cain Miller on Tuesday in The New York Times.

title: A Not Insubstantial Pageant
description: LONDON  In the end, nothing went terribly wrong, and more went right than anyone could have anticipated. If this sounds like faint praise, it isnt. For seven years, the Olympics have been bearing down on London filling it with anxiety and an anticipation that were scarcely articulated  at least until the Olympic torch landed on this island and all along the length and breadth of the country, often in driving rain, people lined the streets to watch it go past.

title: Cleaning a River That Was Given Up for Dead
description: In 1984, when the Environmental Protection Agency put the old Diamond Alkali factory in Newark on its list of the most heavily polluted places in the country, the agency was not thinking about the Passaic River, which runs right in front of the plant.

title: What Were Reading
description: Mediaite: Meet Paul Ryan: running mate, Congressional leader, fiscal watchdog  and former driver of the Oscar Meyer Wienermobile. Specializing in turkey bacon and Lunchables. (Via Grist.)  Patrick Farrell

title: Getting It Right
description: Were quick enough at City Room to pounce on errors made in the public sphere. We should be equally prompt in acknowledging when problems are solved.

title: Tech and Financials Slump, Thwarting a Market Rally
description: Stocks were mixed in light trading on Tuesday, with the Standard & Poors 500-stock index falling for a second day, as a slump in technology and financial shares reversed an earlier rally that followed a report of better-than-expected retail sales.

title: A Wide Receivers New Reality
description: Perhaps we should thank Chad Johnson for officially welcoming us to football season. Because the N.F.L. cannot really begin until some nonsense involving a past-his-prime receiver reminds us there is no I in team, but there is in oh geez, not another reality show. This is possibly now in the N.F.L. rule book. So, Johnson merely stepped up to perform his duty as past-his-prime receiver with the celebrity ego gone off the rails. That he got arrested on domestic violence charges against the woman he just married on reality TV and well, you have the proper absurdity points for a full-fledged fiasco.

title: On Our Radar: A Colossal Burmese Python
description: University of Florida researchers dissect the largest Burmese python ever found in the state, measuring 17 feet, 7 inches and weighing 164 pounds. The snake, an invasive species, was carrying 87 eggs, highlighting the challenge of controlling a population estimated to have grown to tens of thousands of snakes in South Florida. [Ocala.com]

title: Afghan Attacks Kill Dozens in Deadliest Day for Civilians This Year
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Bombings and shootings took the lives of at least 43 Afghans on Tuesday in the deadliest day for civilians this year as insurgents struck while people were preparing for the Muslim holiday that ends the month of Ramadan.

title: Business Day Live | Vending Machine Tech
description: The vending machine business gets a technology makeover.

title: Business Day Live | August 14, 2012
description: Weighing the costs of ever-faster stock trades. | Strong currency accelerates Canadas decline as an automaker. | For a financial rule designed to protect taxpayers, legislative limbo.

title: Timely | Camera Sly
description: Ada Ruilovas compact, psychologically charged videos, which have been shown everywhere from the Venice Biennale to a Jumbotron in Times Square, dont so much draw you in as snare you in a relentless loop with no hope of climax or resolution. Her latest, a collaboration with the director Abel Ferrara, begins with a conversation about Pier Paolo Pasolinis death and veers into a wholly tangential discourse on love, hustlers, desire, drugs, conspiracy, film scripts and the actress Zo Lund. It will be shown at the New Museum in New York this fall and at Kayne Griffin Corcoran in Los Angeles next spring. And then there is Ruilovas continuing collaboration with her husband, the artist Raymond Pettibon. Having a baby is the ultimate ready-made, she says of their infant son. We make videos with him every day.

title: Will Indian Women Ever Have the Freedom Not to Marry?
description: Behind the Bollywood dream of the Great Indian Wedding, complete with white horse and brass bands, the reality for many Indian women is stark: there isnt much alternative to marriage. Does it have to be this way for the next generation? How long can tradition be used to justify marrying off women before theyre old enough to make good choices  or to pressure women into marriage, because being single is not a culturally acceptable choice?

title: Shining a Light on Obama
description: This photograph from The Associated Press is creating a fair amount of chatter this morning, and is naturally prompting some caption-writing contests. No, it is not doctored, and it captured President Obama speaking at Bayliss Park in Council Bluffs, Iowa, on Monday.

title: Guggenheim Announces Works & Process Performance Season
description: The Royal Danish Ballet, the director Robert Lepage and an expert on the neuroscience of taste will be featured in the fall season of the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museums Works & Process series, which begins Sept. 9. The performances, aimed at giving audiences insight into the creative process, will take place in the museums Peter B. Lewis Theater. Most events will also be livestreamed.

title: The Art of Reef Conservation
description: Whats not to like about thework of Jason deCaires Taylor? The 37-year-old sculptor, raised in England, Spain and Malaysia, has found a way to blend a love of diving and coral reefs with his art  which he crafts on dry land and then lowers into the seas, where, he says, it diverts divers who might otherwise spend too much time poking at fragile reefs. The sculptures themselves, with time, end up as homes for corals, sponges and other marine life.

title: Throughout the City, a New Generation of Street Signs
description: This message is addressed to New Yorkers who were more surprised to see a street sign with uppercase and lowercase letters than they were to learn that an intersection in Harlem had been named for Judge Bruce McM. Wright:

title: Estadio Azteca: Into the Lions Den
description: On Wednesday, when the United States plays Mexico in a friendly in Mexico City, the Americans will try to earn their first victory on the home soil of their greatest rival: they are 0-23-1 in Mexico since the first game in 1937, a 7-2 drubbing. To win, they will need to beat Mexico in the Estadio Azteca, one of the most famed stadiums in the world: a 105,000-seat caldron perched at an elevation of 7,200 feet.

title: Wheelies: The Driverless Edition
description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: Frank Ocean Cancels European Performances
description: Frank Ocean has abruptly canceled his European tour, including several festival appearances and a series of high-profile concerts with Coldplay. Mr. Ocean, an R&B singer who drew international attention when he revealed last month that his first true love was with a man, did not give a reason for his decision.

title: Should Candidates Talk About Climate Change?
description: 1:16 p.m. | Updates below | Anthony Leiserowitz, thedirector of theYale Project on Climate Change Communication, just sent the note below about a new analysis of climate attitudes. Im posting it here as part of a continuing effort to point to notable news and analysis out there in the firehose flood  of information:

title: Hand-Turned Rolling Pins Banish Lumps and Bumps
description: Though the job of fashioning the dough for fresh fruit pies, tarts, cobblers and such can be improvised with a wine bottle, it really calls for a well-made rolling pin thats sleek and balanced. Vermont Rolling Pins are hand turned, in eight styles, including a hefty classic Shaker model (top); a simple column; a lighter, sharply tapered French style (center) that is a dream to use for delicate pastry; and several finished with handsome carved finials and handles. They can be ordered in a choice of woods, including cherry, maple and walnut. The Shaker, French and column styles also come in childs versions (bottom).

title: Image of the Day: August 14
Teenagers in The Times | Punk Rockers, Scientists, Cheerleaders and Activists
description: Updated | Aug. 18, 2012

title: Good Enough to Make Farm-Stand Peaches Blush
description: Farm stands are piled high with the perfect argument for not buying most supermarket peaches. So why even consider the organic fruit from Frog Hollow Farm in Brentwood, Calif.? Because the farm ships its big, handsome peaches unblemished and ready to savor, dripping with rich juice. Unlike many farm-stand peaches, these have their skins brushed to be less fuzzy. And they include unusual varieties. Cal Reds, weighing 6 to 7 ounces each, are ready now. The skin deepens to burgundy, and within, the golden, fairly firm, satiny flesh is sweet but trimmed with tartness. They are excellent to halve and grill, to slice atop a tart or to serve plain with a glass of prosecco. The Cal Reds will be finished in about 10 days, but the harvest continues into mid-September with giant Summersets and juicy Autumn Flames.

title: Invitation to a Dialogue: Its About the Boomers
description: To the Editor:

title: Keeping the Lobster but Losing the Gluten
description: Gluten-free with no compromise describes the new version of lobster mac and cheese from Hancock Gourmet Lobster in Cundys Harbor, Me. Gluten-free? Really? The macaroni is a quinoa pasta, its lush mascarpone cream sauce is thickened with a little gluten-free flour, and the breadcrumb topping is made from corn, rice and grated cheese. The serving is liberally studded with chunks of lobster.

title: Israel Names New Home Front Minister
description: JERUSALEM  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel on Tuesday named an old army friend from a rival political party as his new home front minister, amid growing concern here about preparedness for the response to a potential attack on Iran this fall.

title: Rainbow Trout Baked in Foil With Tomatoes, Garlic and Thyme
description: My friend Christine always makes salmon prepared this way when I arrive at her home in Provence after my long trip from California. Its a great dish to make when you dont know exactly when guests are going to arrive, as everything can be prepared in advance and the fish can be baked at the last minute. Ive adapted Christines salmon recipe to rainbow trout, which are farmed in a sustainable way and less expensive than wild salmon.

title: A Giant Hospital Chain Is Blazing a Profit Trail
description: During the Great Recession, when many hospitals across the country were nearly brought to their knees by growing numbers of uninsured patients, one hospital system not only survived  it thrived.

title: The Making of Rear Admiral Farragut
description: Yesterday I hoisted my flag at the main, and the whole fleet cheered, which I returned with a most dignified salute, wrote David Glasgow Farragut, commander of the Unions Western Gulf Blockading Squadron, to his family on Aug. 12, 1862. I called all hands, and read the act of Congress complimentary of their achievements. I got under way, and stood down the river, leaving a general order to be read to the fleet. I stopped at the forts, to let the men see what they had done to deserve the resolutions.

title: Rare Otto Frank Archive to Be Auctioned in New York
description: An archive of documents and artifacts relating to Otto Frank, the father of Anne Frank, will be auctioned off on Nov. 5 at Doyle New York, the auction house has announced.

title: Insufficient Evidence for Routine Hearing Tests, Experts Say
description: Hearing tests are cheap and effective. There are no known health harms. And they can identify older adults with compromised hearing who might benefit from using a hearing aid.

title: Science Minister Vilasrao Deshmukh Dies at 67
description: Vilasrao Deshmukh, the minister for science and technology and a former Maharashtra chief minister, died of multiple organ failure in Chennai on Tuesday afternoon. Mr. Deshmukh, 67, had been suffering from liver cancer over the past six months.

title: Fall Poetry Festival Lineups Announced
description: Poetry may make nothing happen, as W. H. Auden once wrote. But in October it will bring an unusual number of poets and poetry mavens to the greater New York area. The United States poet laureate Natasha Trethewey, the Pulitzer Prize winner C. K. Williams, the former New Jersey poet laureate Amiri Baraka and dozens of others will gather in Newark on Oct. 11-14 for the 14th Geraldine R. Dodge Poetry Festival, a biennial event that bills itself as North Americas largest poetry event. And Oct. 18-20, the American Academy of Poets will present its sixth annual Poets Forum, which will feature readings and discussions on issues like poetry and social media (the subject of a lecture by Jorie Graham), and poetry-themed walking tours of Harlem, the West Village, the Museum of Modern Art and SoHo.

title: Cincinnati Is Federers Kind of Town
description: MASON, Ohio  You know why we like Stan Wawrinka here? a fan said as he watched Wawrinka, the Swiss professional player, play a first-round match at the Western & Southern Open in Cincinnati last year.

title: New Woodward Book Due in September
description: The fall books season just got a little more crowded. Bob Woodwards 17th book, The Price of Politics, will be published on Sept. 11, his publisher said on Tuesday, in the splashy, embargoed style that has been a trademark of a Woodward release.

title: Undisguised Blackmail
description: If there is any chance of a diplomatic solution on Irans nuclear program  admittedly a long shot  the major powers have to stand united on sanctions, incentives and negotiating strategy. The United States and its partners (Britain, France, Germany, Russia and China) have managed that pretty well since President Obama took office, despite what Mitt Romney might say on the campaign trail. But the Russians are getting anxious.

title: Before Dropping Algebra, Fix Math Education
Trying to Deposit Checks With My New iPhone
description: Bank of America has (finally) begun offering a check deposit feature on its mobile banking app for smartphones and tablets. The addition gave me the push I needed to try mobile banking on my new iPhone. So I tested it, with varying results.

title: A Historical Benchmark for Religion and Race
description: With the choice of Paul D. Ryan to be the Republican vice- presidential nominee, not one person in a group of top political jobs  the presidential and vice-presidential nominees of both parties, the Supreme Court justices, the speaker of the House or the Senate majority leader  is a white Protestant. That group instead comprises nine Catholics (six justices, Mr. Ryan, Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Speaker John A. Boehner), three Jews (on the court), two Mormons (Mitt Romney and Senator Harry Reid) and one African-American Protestant (President Obama). For much of American history, white Protestants dominated the top rungs of American government.

title: Increasing Limits, and Safety, for Teenage Drivers
description: How much does it matter that Youth Driving Laws Limit Even the Double Date?

title: At NBC, the Thrill Is Gone Along With the Audience
description: NBC got its first taste of the difference between the Olympics and anything else it can offer in prime time: its audience Monday night dropped about 25 million from the networks Olympic highs.

title: Unimpressed by Microns Offer, Elpida Bondholders Offer Alternative
description: Bondholders of Elpida Memory, the Japanese chip maker, are not giving up without a fight.

title: Taylor Swift Announces New Album
description: Taylor Swift, one of the biggest-selling pop stars in recent years, said on Monday that she would release her fourth studio album on Oct. 22.The album, Red, will have 16 songs, including the title track, she told fans during a nighttime Web chat event filmed in her living room in Nashville.

title: HCAs Growing Profit
description: Since 2006, when HCA was taken private in a leveraged buyout, profits at its acute-care hospitals have soared. Total margin, a measure of financial performance, has remained far higher at HCA hospitals than at other similar institutions.

title: In Monterey, Dressing Up a Bugatti for a Dress-Down Affair
description: Jean Bugatti incorporated a good deal of advanced engineering into the Type 64 Coupe, the last Bugatti produced by a member of the Franco-Italian clan. But only three Type 64s were built before Bugattis death in a testing accident in 1939. The grieving family never completed chassis No. 64002, and it remained without a body for 73 years.

title: Amid Insider Trading Inquiry, Tiger Asia Calls It Quits
description: Tiger Asia, a spinoff of Tiger Management, the hedge fund founded by Julian Robertson, told investors in a letter that the fund would be returning their money in the coming weeks as a result of a prolonged legal situation.

title: The Daily Shoe | Tods
description: Jane Herman delivers The Daily Shoe from the Bergdorf Goodman shoe salon in honor of the stores 111th anniversary. Todays pick: Tods classic driving shoe in ultra-soft snakeskin. $925.

title: OrderAhead Wants to Offer Takeout for Everything, on Your Phone
description: Ever call your favorite restaurant to order lunch, then wait an excruciating amount of time in line to pay and pick up your meal  only to get home and realize the restaurant gave you tuna salad instead of tuna nioise?

title: U.S. Airlines Set Records For Punctuality, Baggage
description: The 15 largest domestic airlines have set records for on-time performance, for the fewest long tarmac delays and for the lowest rates of canceled flights and mishandled baggage during the first six months of this year.

title: Primaries to Watch in Florida and Wisconsin
description: Voters head to the polls in four states Tuesday to winnow their picks for the House and Senate, and the addition of Representative Paul D. Ryan to the Republican ticket has the potential to add a new dynamic to some of the races.

title: Read All About It: Brooklyn Is Hip
description: Brooklyns days as an unsophisticated and unfashionable urban backwater? Over.

title: Stars Earn Stripes': Respect for Troops, or Fake Soldier Games?
description: Well, they came, they geared up, they zip-lined and they gushed about getting a taste of the military life. In a two-hour premiere last night, Stars Earn Stripes paired eight stars with experts including a former Navy Seal, a member of the Armys Delta Force and a SWAT commander.

title: Pulling Together Real Stracciatella
description: PERHAPS love was in the air. I was on my honeymoon in Italy, after all. But when I took my first bite of just-made stracciatella, thin strands of fresh mozzarella soaked in heavy cream, I knew I had found another true love.

title: The Daily Shoe | Tods
description: Jane Herman delivers The Daily Shoe from the Bergdorf Goodman shoe salon. Todays pick: Tods classic driving shoe in ultrasoft snakeskin.

title: Bloomberg Urges Campaigns to Discuss Immigration Reform
description: 9:50 p.m. | Updated  BOSTON  Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg joined Rupert Murdoch, the chief of the News Corp. media company, in Boston on Tuesday night, appearing in the same city as Mitt Romneys campaign headquarters to make an economic argument for immigration reform and call for a more substantial discussion of the issue in the presidential campaign.

title: A Parks Starring Role in a Yearly Ritual
description: Into the woods, each time you go,/Theres more to learn of what you know. It was hard not to be reminded of those Sondheim lyrics last week when I went to Central Park, which is as close as many New Yorkers get to the woods, for the latest Shakespeare in the Park production. Dodging bikers and runners, walking up the gentle slope and through one of the wooden pathways to arrive at the Delacorte Theater, I was reminded of my first visit years ago.

title: Can a Banker Think Like an Entrepreneur?
description: In a just-published New York Times article, I write about Jolyne Caruso, a Wall Street veteran who founded the Alberleen Group, a company that applies the incubator concept  ubiquitous in the world of tech start-ups  to investment banking. The Alberleen Group provides seasoned investment bankers with the infrastructure and working capital to start their own firms. In exchange, it takes a revenue share.

title: The Dolphin Lovers Conundrum
description: People who express the greatest concern about protecting Floridas wild dolphins are often the same ones who break laws about feeding, petting or swimming with the charismatic species, according to a new study commissioned by the National Marine Fisheries Service. And the report suggests that dolphin harassment is on the rise.

title: Profile in Style | Hannelore Knuts
description: Perhaps the worst thing you could call Hannelore Knuts  is a model-turned-fill-in-the-blank. Fortunately, the title doesnt really apply. After 14 years in the business, the 34-year-old Belgian is still modeling  and does five hours of boxing workouts a week to keep it that way. She is also taking photographs: she shot her first campaign, for the French mens brand Arnys. She acts: shes in the first feature by her boyfriend, the artist Nicolas Provost, and she will play David Bowie in a Radio Soulwax video. She designs bags for Delvaux and just put the finishing touches on a bike for Marniek Kint, which she describes as having a slightly off-white frame, a fluorescent pink brake cable, classic racing handlebars and a hot pink basket. Yep! The perfect man race bike for women, she says. And not least, this fall she will appear on the Belgian version of Dancing With the Stars. So what do you call Knuts? Busy comes to mind.

title: British Bank in $340 Million Settlement for Laundering
description: Standard Chartered, the British bank, has agreed to pay New Yorks top banking regulator $340 million to settle claims that it laundered hundreds of billions of dollars in tainted money for Iran and lied to regulators.

title: Biden Warns Romney Policies Would Put Crowd Back in Chains
description: 9:43 p.m. | Updated Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. created a stir Tuesday at a campaign speech in Virginia when he told the crowd that Mitt Romneys policies would enable the banking and financial sectors to put you all back in chains.

title: Police in Rome Seize Marijuana Farm Operating in Tunnel
description: ROME  The police have discovered and seized a sprawling marijuana farm in a tunnel in the capital built during the era of Mussolini. The crop had an estimated street value of $3.7 million.

title: Mounting Injuries Trouble Giants; Are Beds to Blame?
description: ALBANY  Injuries are starting to pile up for the Giants just as the end of training camp nears. On Tuesday, the team listed four defensive linemen with injuries: Marvin Austin (back), Chris Canty (knee), Martin Parker (back) and Shaun Rogers (leg).

title: The Gifts She Gave
description: WHEN aspiring young food writers ask how I learned the trade  Was culinary school the first step? A journalism degree? Apprenticeship in a three-star kitchen in France?  I brace myself to disappoint them. I didnt do any of those (extremely practical and admirable) things.

title: Memories of a Friend, Sidekick and Foil
description: I TOLD Helen that I thought the manuscript was really good. In fact, it was the type of cookbook that I thought I would have written someday, and I was slightly jealous of it.

title: In the Ordinary, Silicon Valley Is Finding the Next Big Thing
description: Squares tie-up with Starbucks may be this years most important venture capital deal.

title: Instead of a Bedtime Story, a Lullaby From Miles Davis
description: Make no mistake: Rain Pryor, the star of the autobiographical solo show Fried Chicken and Latkes, is not just defined by her father, the comedian Richard Pryor. She most definitely is her own woman. But she sure does one hell of an impersonation of her dad.

title: Your Favorite Julia Child Recipes
description: Since its sold more than 2 million copies since 1961, youd assume a lot of cooks have used Mastering the Art of French Cooking by Julia Child, who would have turned 100 on Wednesday. (She died in 2004.) But I found plenty of Julia Child fans who confessed under pressure that they had made only her coq au vin or boeuf bourguignon  and a lot of those people had made the dish just once.

title: Court to Hear Googles Challenge to Class-Action Lawsuit on Book Scanning
description: In May, the Authors Guild celebrated a decision in the long-running case over Googles book-scanning project when a federal judge granted its authors class-action status.

title: Despite Mixed Reviews, Producers Eyeing Woods Move to Broadway
description: Theater producers are pursuing a possible Broadway transfer of the Central Park staging of Into the Woods in spite of several negative reviews last week that would usually put a damper on such plans.

title: Tigers Stuck in Neutral
description: Things seemed so perfect in spring training for the Detroit Tigers. The team, on paper, had it all: ace pitchers in Justin Verlander and Doug Fister, a cant-miss closer in Jose Valverde, a slugger in Miguel Cabrera and an off-season, big-money acquisition in Prince Fielder.

title: The Apollo to Present Ask Your Mama!
description: Ask Your Mama!  the multimedia musical show based on the poetry of Langston Hughes  will be presented for one night at the Apollo Theater next spring, the theater announced on Tuesday.

title: TimesCast Politics | August 14, 2012
description: The Ryan pick and the race for Congress. | Will Wisconsin flip? | Iowa fairgoers weigh in. | Chris Christie to keynote convention.

title: Chelsea Clinton Does Not Rule Out Run for Office
description: Could another Clinton presidency be on the horizon? Well just have to wait and see  Chelsea Clinton, for one, is not ruling out a run someday for elected office.

title: Nuclear Regulator Ticks Off Her Wish List
description: The new chairwoman of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission said Tuesday that she had asked the agencys staff to look into the likely effects of climate change on nuclear power reactors.

title: Syrians Try to Balance Desires of Life With the Demands of a Growing War
description: ALEPPO, Syria  They can be seen clinging to their parents in war-damaged dwellings across Syria, and heard crying out in response to the gunfire and artillery that boom at all hours of the day and night.

title: Raspberry Jam, Only Better
description: FOR years, homemade raspberry jam was the hands-down favorite in my house. The alchemy of sugar, berries and lemon juice makes a perfect fruity spread.

title: TimesCast Politics: The Ryan Pick and the Race for Congress
description: The Ryan pick and the race for Congress. | Will Wisconsin flip? | Iowa fairgoers weigh in. | Chris Christie to keynote convention.

title: So Soon, Another Sweathog Is Gone
description: First Robert Hegyes. Now, alas, Ron Palillo has left the classroom, dead of a heart attack at 63.

title: New Ad Attacks Obama on Medicare
description: Mitt Romneys campaign signaled that it intended to fight rather than run from Democratic attacks over Republican Medicare policies, unveiling a new ad that stresses that President Obama cut $700 billion from the program.

title: Medicare Confusion
description: An unnamed Republican operative told Politico this week that if Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan win the battle to define Medicare they will win the election, but if they lose it, then they lose big in the fall. Whether thats accurate or not, the Romney campaign doesnt seem to have figured out its Medicare messaging.

title: Edible Selby | Live Stream
description: Ole-Martin Hansen moved from Norway to London 10 years ago to study sound art, but he soon found a very different calling: smoking salmon, the Norwegian way. At his North London shop, Hansen & Lydersen, he recreated his grandfathers special smoking chamber in a 1950s boiler room, where he flavors fresh salmon from Denmarks Faroe Islands with beechwood and juniper, and uses small fans to blow air on the fish. The salmon needs to move, he explains. After curing the fish with salt from Gurande, France, Hansen sends it to some of Londons finest restaurants and markets. Lest there be any doubt about his dedication to the fish, Hansen adds that the chamber is equipped with a piano, on which he plays them Edvard Griegs In the Hall of the Mountain King.

title: Excerpt: 'Blind Date'
description: Andrea Lynn Green, left, and Hallie Foote in one of the one-act plays in "Harrison, TX: Three Plays by Horton Foote."

title: Note to Self: Double-Check Those Electric Bills
description: Are you one of those people who pay monthly electric and gas charges without closely looking at the bills? (You know who you are.)

title: Spike Lees Red Hook
description: Spike Lee, the director behind Red Hook Summer, discusses some of the Brooklyn locations where he shot his latest film.

title: Mirror Fasts Help Take the Focus Off Yourself
description: NARCISSUS had only a pool of water in which to gaze, but we see our reflections at almost every turn. In bathroom mirrors, shop windows, sliding subway doors, brass elevator banks and even in the screens of smartphones: no matter where you go, there you are. Mindful of what happened to Narcissus (it wasnt good), some people are trying to abstain from looking at their reflections for a day, a week, a month or even a year.

title: Wells Fargo Settles Mortgage-Crisis Case for $6.5 Million
description: Wells Fargo on Tuesday settled accusations that it sold troubled mortgage investments without fully researching the products or disclosing the risks to customers.

title: My Baby, the Star
description: The woman who accosts me in the middle of the street wants my baby.

title: Building a Turkish Empire, One Friend at a Time
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark.

title: Photo Replay: Aug. 14
description: A view of the day in sports, including an athletic competition for disabled soldiers in Diyagama, Sri Lanka, and Olympians returning to their home countries as sports heroes.

title: Smash Schedule Prompts Jeremy Jordan To Depart Newsies on Sept. 4
description: Will the hit Broadway musical Newsies continue to flourish without its breakout star, Jeremy Jordan? Disney Theatrical Productions will soon find out. Disney executives said on Tuesday that Mr. Jordan, who has become an audience favorite as the brooding New York City newsboy Jack Kelly, would give his final performance on Sept. 4 so he can concentrate on his new leading role in the NBC series Smash. Disney also announced that a 22-year-old unknown, Corey Cott, who graduated from Carnegie Mellon University in May and joined the Newsies company last month, would take over the role of Jack on Sept. 5.

title: Ryan Begins to Sync His Schedule With Romneys
description: LAKEWOOD, Colo.  Representative Paul D. Ryans days on the campaign trail include public rallies like two on his schedule for Tuesday, one here in a Denver suburb and another in Las Vegas.

title: Utilitys Role in Convention Tests Obama
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  When Charlotte first emerged as the top contender to host the Democratic convention, its lead cheerleader was James E. Rogers, the outspoken chief executive of the hometown utility, Duke Energy. He promised to be a public face and a private fund-raiser for the effort.

title: Manhattan Prosecutor to Centralize Efforts Against Cybercrime
description: Many criminals in the city are becoming more sophisticated, like using high-tech tools for identity theft and other forms of computer crimes. The citys response?

title: The Dirt on Clean | Laundering Fashions Most Elaborate Creations
description: Though Downton Abbey is currently between seasons  Season 3, which will take the fictional Crawley family into the Jazz Age, will have its debut next month in Britain but not until January on this side of the Atlantic  its sumptuous costumes remain firmly planted in our imaginations; for many, theyre reason enough to tune in. So while watching the the Balmain fall 2012 collection unfurl it was easy to embroider a line between the elaborate, mosaic-style beading that the designer Olivier Rousteing dreamed up and the exquisitely embellished clothes worn by Lady Mary and company. The obvious parallels, of course, lie in the richness of the workmanship. But there are less evident similarities between the Downton costumes and Rousteings clothes, as well as those of Erdem Moralioglu, who embroidered lace onto rubber; Marios Schwab, who layered sequined gowns with chiffon; and Gucci, where the designer Frida Giannini sent out a cocktail dress dripping with coq feathers. These creations (and many others, every season) beg the inevitable question: How are they to be cleaned? Once these individual testaments to the skills of seamstresses, embroiderers, featherers and beaders have been worn, perspired in and spilled on, whats the wearer to do?

title: Lawmaker Literally Cant Wait to Leave Congress
description: So much for a long goodbye.

title: A Fiery Introduction for Romney in Ohio Coal Country
description: BEALLSVILLE, Ohio  A Senate candidate, introducing Mitt Romney at a rally here on Tuesday, railed against radical organizations like the Sierra Club and the League of Conservation Voters, and he said he had a message for those, like President Obama, who stood in the way of the coal industry: Over our dead bodies.

title: For Shark Week, the Volkswagen Beetle Sheds Its Shell
description: Had it been Hyundai with its discontinued Tiburon sports car, which took its name from the Spanish word for shark, the promotional materials would have practically written themselves.

title: Koufaxs Roundball Once Trumped His Fastball
description: Sandy Koufaxs sports odyssey took him from a muscular, leaping center for the Lafayette High School basketball team in Brooklyn to left-handed bonus baby for the Brooklyn Dodgers to the Hall of Fame as one of the most dynamic pitchers in baseball history.

title: Biang!
description: Inside the restaurant offshoot of Xian Famous Foods in Queens.

title: In an Endless Loop of Noodles
description: IF you are one of those people who believes that ingredients should always be treated with respect, by all means stay away from Biang!, an excitable name for a frequently exciting new restaurant in Flushing, Queens.

title: David Boudia: An Olympic Silhouette in Gold
description: On Saturday night in London, David Boudia won a surprise gold in the mens 10-meter platform. According to The Times, its the first gold for the United States in diving since Laura Wilkinson in 2000 and the first for the men since Mark Lenzi won the 3-meter springboard in 1992.

title: Dear Pussycat': Editors Remember Helen Gurley Brown
description: The influence of Helen Gurley Brown, who died on Monday at age 90, extended widely across the culture, and deeply within the world of magazines. What follows are remembrances from women who worked with Ms. Brown: Lesley Jane Seymour, Bonnie Fuller, Jill Herzig, Cathleen P. Black, Kate White and Donna Kalajian Lagani.

title: Subway Fire Near Dekalb Station in Brooklyn Causes Delays
description: Update, 6:45 p.m. | A fire in the subway tunnel north of the Dekalb Avenue station in Brooklyn is wreaking late-afternoon havoc on lettered train lines, causing an ever-changing series of delays and reroutings, the Metropolitan Transportation Authority said.

title: Dining Calendar
description: So Very French

title: Times Co. Names Mark Thompson Chief Executive
description: The New York Times Company has named Mark Thompson, the departing director general of the British Broadcasting Corporation, as its new president and chief executive.

title: In Fragmented Brazilian Forest, Few Species Survive
description: The Atlantic Forest in Brazil, which runs along the countrys southeastern shore near Rio de Janeiro, has been fragmented by centuries of human habitation. While the rain forest originally spanned over half a million square miles  an area comparable to the size of South Africa  almost 90 percent of it is now gone. Fields, roads, and cities have taken the place of trees.

title: Pictures of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Syria, France, Afghanistan and Israel.

title: Off the Menu
description: Opening

title: Sect Pastor Is Convicted of Assisting in Abduction
description: After only four hours of deliberation, a federal jury in Burlington, Vt., found an Amish-Mennonite pastor guilty of abetting international parental kidnapping in a widely publicized case involving a same-sex union and religious opponents of homosexuality.

title: Obama Returns to Iowa in Bid to Reignite the Fervor
description: OSKALOOSA, Iowa  This prairie state is the place where his unlikely bid for presidency began. But now it is 2012, and the big question for President Obama is whether, four years after that historic run, Iowa can do for him what it did in 2008.

title: Tribal Threads
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Your Olympic Keepsakes
description: A selection of your favorite mementos from Olympics past.

title: Negative Ad, a First for Akin, Goes Up in the Missouri Senate Race
description: After an ad released by the Democratic Senatorial Campaign Committee criticized his positions on Social Security and Medicare, Representative Todd Akin is responding with an ad of his own that calls the attacks leveled on behalf of his opponent, Senator Claire McCaskill, misleading, deceptive, false.

title: A Quartet of New Spritzes for the Face
description: Facial mists arent new (think of the famous Evian can), but several refreshing skin-care sprays have been recently introduced, all promising to moisturize. Theyre a logical seasonal replacement to heavy serums, and many come in carry-on non-aerosol bottles.

title: Im Staying in Rome Is New Theme for the Summer Vacation Season
description: LIDO DI OSTIA, Italy  For many Romans, this seaside neighborhood at the fringe of the capital has long been the site of summertime rituals, where crowds of children built wobbly castles of soot-colored sand, parents snoozed in clusters and beachfront resorts bustled with sun-soaked hordes of vacationers.

title: Mets Acquire Shoppach to Set Up Platoon at Catcher
description: CINCINNATI  The Mets on Tuesday acquired Kelly Shoppach, a right-handed-hitting catcher, on a waiver claim from the Boston Red Sox for a player to be named.

title: Walking, Talking, Leafy Young Boy Sprouts From a Box of Wishes
description: A small-town couple, Jim and Cindy (Joel Edgerton and Jennifer Garner), grieving over their inability to conceive, write the attributes of their dream child on scraps of paper that they bury in a box in the garden. That night, during a violent storm, a dirt-covered, leaf-sprouting creature claws its way out of the soil and into Jim and Cindys house.

title: 2 New Ways to Relive Childhood
description: Wednesday nights unintentional television contrast: one new show about the childhood you actually had and another about the childhood you wish youd had.

title: Madison Street, Lower East Side, 3:41 P.M.
Giants Lose Rogers for Season
description: ALBANY  The Giants almost escaped training camp without a major injury. That changed Tuesday, the last day of camp here, when the team discovered defensive tackle Shaun Rogers had a blood clot in his calf that will keep him out for the season.

title: Thats a Big Boulder, Indy: Steven Spielberg on the Imax Rerelease of Raiders of the Lost Ark
description: 9:39 a.m. | Updated

title: Lollipops in the Midst of Grief
description: Genius is rare enough, but a good-hearted genius is rarer still, former President Bill Clinton was saying on Tuesday. A good-hearted, humble and hilarious genius? Almost unheard-of.

title: A Composer Focuses on a Small Group of Colleagues at Tanglewood
description: LENOX, Mass.  Heres what makes the Tanglewood Music Centers Festival of Contemporary Music such an enlivening summer oasis most years: As soon as you think youve mapped the festivals stylistic leanings, you run into music that overturns your expectations.

title: An Incessant Birdcall, Then Peaceful Fishing
description: No composer has transcribed bird song with more dedication than Messiaen, an ornithological sampling artist whose obsession manifested itself in myriad colorful works evoking birdcalls. But other composers certainly indulged in the occasional bird-song transcription, including Dvorak. He included the call of the scarlet tanager, which he heard while hiking in the Iowa countryside in 1893, in his String Quartet No. 12 (American).

title: For Obama and Romney, a To-Do List for Travelers
description: Mitt Romney and President Obama are pounding the campaign trail, courting swing voters by talking about so-called issues like jobs, the budget and health care. Anyone notice anything missing here? Like a nod toward the issues that matter to that all-important, nonpartisan voting bloc, the American budget traveler?

title: Data Storage Could Expand Reach of Surveillance
description: A wave of worry about a software program called TrapWire, designed to detect terrorists casing possible targets, appears to be unjustified, as I wrote in Tuesdays Times.

title: 11 Found Slain, Including Ranger, at Park in Kazakhstan
description: MOSCOW  A forest ranger and 10 other people were found stabbed to death this week in a national park in Kazakhstan about 24 miles from the countrys largest city, Almaty, and not far from the border with Kyrgyzstan, Interior Ministry officials said on Tuesday.

title: 2012 Pebble Beach Events Calendar
description: You dont have to buy, or even bid, to enjoy the collector car events on the Monterey Peninsula. Here are some highlights of events taking place in and around Pebble Beach this week:

title: When the Archbishop Hugged Cosmos Queen
description: Of all the men Helen Gurley Brown charmed in her many years of selling sex, beauty and diet tips to the modern woman (and taking full advantage of them herself), Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan  the countrys most influential Roman Catholic bishop  might rank among the most unlikely.

title: Justin Elghanayan
description: Mr. Elghanayan, 34, is president of the Rockrose Development Corporation, a New York developer and manager of residential and office buildings founded by his father, H. Henry, and two uncles. In a split three years ago, Henry retained the Rockrose name and his brothers formed TF Cornerstone.

title: Top Chef Takes to the Seas
description: Cruises that cater to foodies, like Food Network at Sea, are nothing new. Nor are those that feature reality television stars, like Cruising With the Stars. A mash-up of the two genres, Top Chef: The Cruise, will feature hosts of the popular reality competition show, Tom Colicchio and Gail Simmons, and former cheftestants along with 2,000 passengers. Tickets for the five-day cruise on Celebrity Constellation, departing from Miami in April 2013 and making stops in Key West, Fla., and Cozumel, Mexico, go on sale Aug. 16.

title: On TNT, Major Crimes Replaces (and Gets a Boost From) The Closer
description: The debut of Major Crimes, TNTs replacement for The Closer, scored nearly 7.2 million viewers on Monday night, making it the most popular new series on cable this year, TNT said on Tuesday.

title: Coal Mine to Abut Girl Scout Camp
description: A strip mine proposed by a nearby company, Western Kentucky Minerals, could soon surround the camp, altering its bucolic vista for years to come.

title: For-Profit Schools
description: To the Editor:

title: Carlyle Said to Take Lead in Bidding for Getty Images
description: 6:18 p.m. | Updated

title: In Texass Capital, Construction on Many Corners
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Amit Sudharshan, 28, dons shorts and flip flops to walk the two blocks from his downtown apartment here to his job as a quantitative researcher at RGM Advisors.

title: A Bicycle Built for Zines
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: In a Slow New York Market, Brokers Expand Their Repertory
description: Debra LaChance, a senior vice president at the Corcoran Group, spent the heyday of the condominium boom working on projects designed by celebrated architects like Jean Nouvel and Neil Denari.

title: Hulu Faces Privacy Test in Court
description: Can a privacy law passed in the era of videotape rentals be applied in the era of Internet streaming?

title: Visiting Myanmars Threatened Rohingyas
description: Despite official obstacles barring most observers and aid workers from western Myanmar, two months after dozens were killed in sectarian clashes and tens of thousands of Muslims were forced from their homes into resettlement camps, a television crew from Britains Channel 4 News managed to report from the region on Tuesday.

title: Fisker Appoints Tony Posawatz, a Chief With Complementary Roots
description: Fisker Automotive, the struggling manufacturer of luxury plug-in hybrid cars, has chosen Tony Posawatz, who led the development of the Chevrolet Volt, as chief executive, the company announced in a teleconference on Tuesday.

title: Not Every Bad Day Needs to End With Ice Cream
description: RAGU pasta sauce is adopting an innovative and funnier marketing approach with a campaign that notes a new direction for its owner, Unilever Foods, to create less utilitarian, and more playful, advertising for its food products.

title: Americas Aversion to Taxes
description: There is something to be said for universal health care systems.

title: Shopping Snapshots: August 16
description: Steven Alan opens a High Line store; International Concept Brand returns with Prabal Gurung designs; and camouflage is a designer favorite.

title: Branch, a Group Conversation Site, Publicly Branches Out
description: Sometimes, 140 characters just isnt enough. Enter Branch,a Web site that opened to the public on Monday and allows people to have a group conversation in 750-character sound bites.

title: T Fall Womens | Must Haves
description: The must-haves: shoes, boots, clutches, belts and necklaces. More

title: TimesCast Politics | The Iowa State Fair
description: As children frolicked at the Iowa State Fair, the adults debated politics with both Congressman Paul Ryan and President Obama who came by over the course of the day.

title: Remembering Helen Gurley Brown
description: Jamie Brickhouse, Helen Gurley Browns publicist, remembers the editor through her letters.

title: Googoo and the Pussycat
description: I CALLED her Googoo. She called me Pussycat.

title: Group Faults Police as Overly Aggressive in Schools
U.N.C. Humiliated, but Eager to Return to the Field
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C.  The first football practice of a new season and a new era at North Carolina came mercifully this month, a much-needed respite in what has been a two-year nightmare for a once-respected program.

title: Old Queens Burial Ground Is Declared a Landmark
description: A Queens cemetery dating back to the 18th century was declared a landmark by the city on Tuesday: Brinckerhoff Cemetery in Fresh Meadows, a private burial ground that was used from 1730 to 1872. There are no gravestones or markers still visible on the site, located along 182nd Street, but according to a survey, there had been 77 gravestones and markers there.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,070 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans recently:

title: Getting Schooled With Jumaane Williams
In Mexico-U.S. Rivalry, the Edge Heads South
description: The United States has been playing Mexico in soccer since 1934 but has yet to win a game on Mexican soil. The Americans overall record there is 0-23-1, with Game No. 25 set for Wednesday night, when a United States team with many novices and hopefuls will take on Mexicos national team at Estadio Azteca in Mexico City.

title: Nine Straight Days of 110 or More: Thats Hot, Even for Phoenix
description: PHOENIX  Hot is a relative term for people used to the scorching summer weather in this city built on land better suited for cactus than lawns. But nine straight days of excessive heat seem to have stretched even the most elastic tolerance levels to their limits.

title: China: Self-Immolations Continue
description: Two young Tibetan men set themselves on fire on Monday in a Tibetan region of western China to protest Chinese rule, according to Free Tibet, an advocacy group in London, and Radio Free Asia, a news organization financed by the United States government. The men, who were identified as Lungtok and Tashi, self-immolated in the town of Ngaba, known in Chinese as Aba. Free Tibet identified both as former monks of Kirti Monastery, while Radio Free Asia said Lungtok was a monk and Tashi was believed to be a layperson. Forty-eight Tibetans have self-immolated since March 2011. The condition of the two men was unclear on Tuesday, though Free Tibet reported that Lungtok is believed to have died.

title: Mexico: Criminal Leader Found Dead
description: The leader of a criminal syndicate operating in the volatile region of Chran, in the state of Michoacn, was found slain on Tuesday, according to the state attorneys office. A military patrol found the leader, Mauricio Cuitlhuac Hernndez, near a burning van in the town of Santa Mara Urapicho. Residents of Chern have been struggling to drive out armed illegal loggers who they say have destroyed their forests and tormented their families under the protection of cartel henchmen for months. The government deployed 600 police officers to Michoacn this week. No suspects have been named in the killing.

title: Little Candor From Christie Before Keynote
description: It didnt take long for the watch-it, buster, Im-a-bodacious-truth-teller verbiage to start flowing.

title: Mountain Mint Broke My Heart
description: YOU cant help whom you fall for. Sometimes you cant help what you fall for, either. It was a wildflower that did it for me.

title: What Syrias Rebels Need
description: Idlib, Syria

title: Given Opportunity, and Competition, McKnight Gets Serious
description: CORTLAND, N.Y.  Joe McKnight said with a smile that he felt great and was looking forward to the season because he could be put in several positions to make the most of his many talents. Then he practically screeched to a halt, changing directions.

title: Atlas Spurned
description: Palo Alto, Calif.

title: Spanish Construction Rivals Battle on New York Turf
description: The dripping canyons of New York Citys ever expanding network of train and subway tunnels would seem to be a far cry from the euro zones continuing financial debacle.

title: Ron Palillo Dies at 63; Played Horshack on TV
description: Ron Palillo, who portrayed the goofy high school underachiever Arnold Horshack in the hit 1970s sitcom Welcome Back, Kotter with such definitive oddballness that he had trouble for years afterward finding work as an actor, died on Tuesday in West Palm Beach, Fla. He was 63.

title: U.S. Vows to Speed Aid to Iran Earthquake Victims
description: The Obama administration said Tuesday that it would expedite applications to help Irans earthquake victims. Prospective donors have expressed worry and confusion over whether such charitable aid runs afoul of the extensive American sanctions imposed on the country because of its disputed nuclear program.

title: Importing Russias Top Gun
description: IZHEVSK, Russia  The nickname of this town, home of the factory that makes Kalashnikov rifles, is the Armory of Russia. Over the years, it has armed a good number of other countries, too, as the lathes and presses of the Izhevsk Machine Works clanged around the clock to forge AK-47s and similar guns for insurgents and armies around the world.

title: From Izhmash, With Love
description: American hunters and gun enthusiasts are snapping up tens of thousands of the civilian versions of AK-style weapons.

title: Mine Plan Puts Two Kentucky Fixtures on Collision Course
description: UTICA, Ky.  The signs begin around Girl Scout Road, yellow placards dotting yards and affixed to trees along Route 231 here. No Coal Trucks they say, or, more to the point, Stop Strip Mining. Some have a phone number for a clutch of residents in this small town, a dozen miles outside Owensboro, who aim to do just that.

title: The Little Restaurant That (I Wish) Could
description: There is a tiny restaurant in the garment district that I keep rooting for. Its like a dear but troubled friend who has issues. Its 38th Street Restaurant and Bakery, also known as Ming Du, a simple, steam-table Chinese place where neighborhood workers get tasty food cheap.

title: Unprosecuted Hate Crimes
description: Attorney General Eric Holder Jr. told the Senate in 2009 that we have a significant hate crimes problem in this country. The recent murders at the Sikh temple in Wisconsin have raised this issue in the public consciousness.

title: Mr. Bloombergs Immigration Road Trip
description: Mayor Michael Bloomberg took his pro-immigration views on the road on Tuesday to public forums in Chicago and Boston, where he urged President Obama and Mitt Romney to make immigration a central issue in the presidential campaign.

title: Uncertainty Surrounds Next Years Ironman
description: New York Citys first Ironman may be its last.

title: How Can Women Gain Influence in Hollywood?
Guns and Mothers
description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:

title: The Health of Magazines
