Most applicants write in wherever they were born, but for me it was a bit more complicated; I could not, in good faith, claim any country as my own.

title: Conservative Elite in Capital Pay Heed to Ryan as Thinker
description: WASHINGTON  With the debate over the federal deficit roiling last year, David Smick, a financial market consultant, held a dinner for a bipartisan group of connected budget thinkers at his expansive home here.

title: Baltimore Grand Prix Secures SRT as Presenting Sponsor
description: BALTIMORE  After sputtering dangerously, the Baltimore Grand Prix may be shifting out of first gear.

title: As Jets Grab Spotlight, Giants Are Happy to Step Aside
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The prevailing hullabaloo at Giants training camp in Albany arose on Tuesday, relating to uncomfortable dorm room accommodations.

title: A Lesson for Homeowners
description: Paul Sullivan writes this week in his Wealth Matters column about force-placed insurance  insurance that a lender buys when it concludes that a homeowner does not have adequate hazard, flood or wind coverage. But the problem is that this insurance is almost always more expensive than the homeowner could buy in the open market. In addition, the coverage may be redundant or not needed at all. But homeowners have been reporting that they have a difficult time getting their lenders to remove the insurance.

title: Casting in Colorado, Away From the Crowds
description: NORTHERN Colorado was still rubbing the previous nights Independence Day parties from its eyes as I parked beside the ranchers fence, pulled on waders and strung my fly rod. In the valley the drowsy river was a silver twist among green willows. The air smelled of wet sage, and black cattle stood like chess pieces in the distant fields. Beyond them the 12,000-foot peaks of the Mount Zirkel Wilderness had lined up for mornings roll call, their summits lighted up like match tips.

title: Share the Tale of Your Data Trail
description: This week I wrote about how improvements in technology and the capacity to store huge amounts of data cheaply now allow both the government and the private sector to collect and retain vast amounts of personal information. The laws and regulations that govern such collection, in the view of many experts, are outdated and inconsistent.

title: Graphic Books Best Sellers: Talking About The Underwater Welder
description: The Underwater Welder, by Jeff Lemire, enters our graphic books paperback best-seller list at No. 6 this week. Its about Jack Joseph, a man feeling pressure because of his deep sea welding gig and the fact that hes going to become a father. The introduction to the book, by Damon Lindelof, one of the creators of Lost, compares it to The Twilight Zone. The book starts out innocently enough, seemingly a story about Jack, his pregnant wife, their life struggles and Jacks relationship with his own father. Things get a bit eerie after Jack emerges from one of his dives to a changed world. Mr. Lemires characters, even when theyre happy, have a melancholy look to them. They create an almost instant rapport with the reader.

title: For Chipper Jones, a Salute and Two Home Runs
description: It would be perfectly understandable if Chipper Jones slowed down a bit  he is 40 and in the final weeks of his major league career, which started in 1993 with the Braves.

title: Living In | Gerritsen Beach, Brooklyn
description: Gerritsen Beach, a neighborhood on Brooklyns southern shore, is prized by residents for its quiet and off-the-grid seclusion.

title: The Art of Hiding in Plain Sight
description: GEORGE R. BROADHEAD, a retired newspaper executive and Marine Corps veteran, has lived in Beverly Hills and Manhattan Beach, Calif., and Greenwich, Conn., among many other places. The place he is choosing to spend his retirement, though, is the place where he grew up: Gerritsen Beach, Brooklyn.

title: Rerouted to Syria, Travelers Are Asked To Pass the Hat
description: PARIS  The anxieties of an unexpected landing in war-ravaged Syria were compounded for passengers on an Air France flight when they were asked by the crew if they couldnt possibly, you know, come up with some cash to help out with the refueling.

title: Real to the Touch
description: DENIS PIEL sat by a roadside in rural France, chatting on his cellphone. He was winding down from a hectic day that included a wearying drive and a flight punctuated by an infants squalls.

title: Fees Dispute Prompts Blackout of WPIX by Cablevision
description: WPIX, the New York City affiliate of the CW network, is being blacked out in homes serviced by Cablevision, a major New York metropolitan area cable company.

title: Planetary Poetry, Woven Into a Movie
description: WITH exotic imagery fit for the cover of National Geographic, the new film Samsara ranges across the globe: there are fantastical tiered temples in verdant Myanmar and glorious Japanese mohawks, the natural wonders of Namibian sand dunes and orderly production lines of modern agribusiness in China and Europe. The locations are unnamed, and a rich, varied score is heard instead of political or social commentary. One striking image flows into the next, loosely organized according to the cyclical Hindu notion of birth and destruction that gives the film its Sanskrit title.

title: Business Day Live:  Long-Term Jobless Regroup to Fight the Odds
description: For the long-term jobless, a struggle to beat the odds. | James B. Stewart discusses Facebook and the backlash against social media stocks.

title: Failure Is Important (and It Can Also Be Sort of Funny)
description: SEVERAL years ago, Mike Birbiglia was sitting in an office in Los Angeles when he heard what might be the most beautiful words that a president of a television network can say to a comedian: Youre the next Seinfeld.

title: Before Adoption, 79 Lost Days
description: A new baby can bring much more than joy, responsibility and frustration. During one difficult bout with my sons inconsolable tears, I took him for a walk. I strapped him to my chest in a nylon baby carrier, kissed Mommy good-bye and ventured into the cool evening. Together we walked. Well, I walked. He rode.

title: Veteran Algerian Statesman to Succeed Annan as Special Syrian Envoy
description: Lakhdar Brahimi, a former Algerian foreign minister and widely respected statesman, was appointed Friday as the new special envoy to Syria from the United Nations and Arab League to replace Kofi Annan, who resigned in frustration two weeks ago over his inability to advance his plan to halt the Syrian conflict.

title: Eye Intensity
description: I dont have a signature style, says Mark Carrasquillo, the makeup artist who created the dramatic eyes on these pages. But I like to think I can do many things, from full drag to scrubbed clean, and somehow make it look like my hand. He may be versatile, but one thing that carries through all his work is sex appeal. Ive been accused of making girls look oversexed, he admits. The sultry makeup he did here has a tough-girl edge. I wanted to play with the idea of youth, which for me means a bare face with one statement, like a drawn-on eyebrow or a matte black eye. No foundation, no blush  just lots of attitude. While lipstick is optional (I dont believe in the rule that says you shouldnt wear a strong eye with a strong lip  its a good-taste trap), great skin is imperative. Carrasquillos trade secret? A special arnica oil-based luminizer he whips up in his East Village kitchen. Every model I use it on asks me to make some for them, he says. I wont reveal all the ingredients, but its healing and leaves skin with a beautiful, glowing finish. Maquillage magic can only do so much, though, he adds. A woman can have incredible skin, but if shes not happy in it, all the makeup in the world wont help. Im so tired of seeing beautiful young girls with Botox, etc. I want to tell them to just simmer down and enjoy who they are. More

title: Caterpillar Workers Ratify Deal They Dislike
description: Workers who had been striking at a Caterpillar hydraulic parts factory in Joliet, Ill., voted on Friday to ratify a proposed six-year contract that contained almost all of the concessions the company had demanded.

title: A Champion of the Book Takes to the iPad
description: The author William H. Gass has written a 15,000-word essay called Abstractions Arrive: Having Been There All the Time, a collaboration with the noted photographer Michael Eastman, that can be read only on an iPad equipped with iBooks 2. Its a surprising move by Mr. Gass, whose 1999 essay A Defense of the Book is cherished by devotees of the old-fashioned printed book who are distressed by the onrushing digital future. On our sister blog Bits, David Streitfeld recently spoke to Mr. Gass to learn more about the project.

title: Big Ticket | Sold for $19.5 Million
description: In prime position on Fifth Avenues Museum Mile, a nine-room condominium that encompasses the entire ninth floor of 988 Fifth Avenue and offers stunning views of Central Park and the Metropolitan Museum of Art sold for $19.5 million, the biggest sale of the week, according to city records.

title: On CCTV America, Some China Stories Recede From View
description: Although they come from opposite ends of the Chinese political spectrum, for two months this spring Bo Xilai, a Communist Party official who was dismissed from his post, and Chen Guangcheng, a blind, activist lawyer who fled house arrest in his village, shared one important trait: they were the most closely watched Chinese men in the world.

title: In New Ads, Republicans Attack Over Medicare
description: Get ready for the debate over the 2010 health care law  its Medicare component especially  to be reignited on the airwaves.

title: Relevant Links
description: A couple of links that didnt make it into todays column: How unequal, for example, is income in America? (A more difficult question is, Why do we say unequal but inequality?) You might check out the charts and figures here. There are a dozen charts right here that tell the story nicely. Be careful: its brain-wrenching material.

title: A Glass All Empty
description: WHEN I picture my favorite moments with my husband over our 23 years together, someone is always holding a glass, or a bottle of wine, or a plastic cup  well, except for the last 11 years, since Rob stopped drinking.

title: Report Faults Indian Governments Handling of Coal Concessions
description: MUMBAI, India  The Indian government missed out on nearly $34 billion in royalties by selling private companies coal concessions at negotiated prices rather than auctioning them, according to an audit by a government agency released on Friday.

title: Tomatoes Help With Summer Survival
description: ISNT it lucky that just when its too hot to cook on the East Coast, tomatoes are at their sweetest, ripest and juiciest? Or at least it feels that way, like a serendipitous reward for suffering through a heat wave.

title: Frida Clements and Tomo Nakayama
description: FRIDA CLEMENTS first fell for Tomo Nakayamas music, and then for the man.

title: Bill Cunningham | Adieu, Anna
description: On the Street: A hundred years from now, fashion historians will want to know about the astonishing style of Anna Piaggi, an Italian fashion editor who died in Milan on Aug. 7 at age 81.

title: Buy a Print, Help Rwandans
description: Yutaka Sho, an assistant professor of architecture at Syracuse, has helped rebuild housing in Rwanda since she visited the genocide-ravaged country in 2008. She was a founder of GA Collaborative, a nonprofit group of design practitioners and educators, which assists in these efforts. But recently, she hit a fund-raising wall to continue the Rwanda work, so she appealed to Jungil Hong, a visual artist, whom she met when they were students at the Rhode Island School of Design. Fund raising is just not fun, said Ms. Sho. Were not very good at it. We hate to beg. But we can make art, so we wanted to combine those two things together.

title: A Riper Shade of Red
description: When I served the cold tomato soup from this weeks City Kitchen column to friends the other night, the response was positive. Mmm, gazpacho, right? Delicious. Well, yes and no.

title: What Would You Do? Rent or Buy?
description: So youve just learned that the rent on your one-bedroom apartment in Chelsea is going up  again.

title: Four Decisions
description: A look at how four potential buyers came to resolve their own conundrums, and the lessons they learned along the way.

title: Rent or Buy?
description: BLANCHING at their rent bills, more New Yorkers are being forced to confront that age-old question, should I rent, or does buying make more sense?

title: In Andalusia, on the Trail of Inherited Memories
description: ARCOS DE LA FRONTERA, Spain  I still wonder how I ended up living in a former medieval bordello on the brink of a sandstone cliff on the southern frontier of Spain.

title: Where the Beaked Whales Are
description: Scott Baker, associate director of the Marine Mammal Institute at Oregon State University, writes from Samoa, where he studies the formation of local communities among dolphins and their genetic isolation from one another.

title: Debussy at 150: The Impressions Still Deceive
description: CLASSICAL music institutions are usually quick to seize on major anniversaries of a composers birth or death as a convenient programming hook. Get ready for the Wagner and Verdi bicentennial celebrations next year.

title: Britain Blocks a Picasso From Traveling
description: Too big to fail? What about too important to sell?

title: Investment From China Places A123 Systems on the Defensive
description: As reported on Thursday by The Times, the financially troubled electric-vehicle battery maker A123 Systems reached a final agreement with the Wanxiang Group Corporation, a supplier of automotive parts and systems based in China, for an investment of up to $465 million.

title: Its Nearly Impossible to Stay Unknown
description: IF you believe the myth, Ariel Pink is home a lot.

title: Widening U.N.C. Scandal Prompts Independent Review
description: For the past two years, North Carolina officials have liked to talk about getting past the scandal that landed it in N.C.A.A. hot water, embarrassing a university that likes to believe it is one of the few doing things the right way. The embers of the era of Butch Davis as the football coach showed that things had gone seriously off the rails, and now they have gotten only worse with the apparent leaking of Julius Pepperss eye-opening transcript, which indicates the academic fraud stretches back a lot longer than the Davis era.

title: Behind the Scenes at the Armory, an Immersion Course in History
description: The assignment was to make an eight-minute video collage that explained King Lear using images of modern celebrities. Whom to cast as Lear?

title: Still Waiting for Rafa
description: HARRISON, N.J.  Between injuries, suspensions and international duty with Mexico, Rafael Marquez has played in only 38 games (a mere nine this season) since joining the Red Bulls from Barcelona in August 2010.

title: Photo Replay: Aug. 17
description: A look at the day in sports, including lonely fairway walks, blocking home plate and riding big waves in a surfing tournament in Tahiti.

title: Former Chief of Peregrine Pleads Not Guilty to Fraud
description: The former chief executive of the failed brokerage firm Peregrine Financial Group, who last month wrote a note admitting that he had committed a long-ranging investment fraud, pleaded not guilty on Friday to lying to federal regulators.

title: The Auto Insurance Case That Blew Up on the Internet
description: It isnt often that automobile insurance becomes the subject of nationwide outrage. So when it does happen, its worth a peek inside all our policies to figure out how they actually work and what the insurance companies are up to behind the scenes.

title: An Undercurrent of Darkness, Even at Disney
description: HOTSHOT TV animators used to knock on Disney Channels door very infrequently. For a generation of cartoonists raised on The Simpsons, Disney had a reputation as too worried about protecting its brand to have fun. The cool kids wanted to work elsewhere.

title: Just Over Half of Eligible Teachers Receive Tenure
For Selfish Seniors Only
description: Among the many falsehoods in the Romney campaigns new Medicare ad is this remarkable line pitched to the elderly: The money you paid in for guaranteed health care is going into a massive new government program thats not for you.

title: Mens Shorts Regain Fashion Status
description: There are notable figures in mens fashion, who are chipping away at the pant-hem bias, and working to give short pants more respect.

title: How Do You Want It to End?
description: Among the many things that Ellen Goodman has done  written a widely syndicated column, published books, won a Pulitzer Prize for commentary, given probably hundreds of talks on topics from friendship and feminism to bioethics  is this familiar job: Shes been a family caregiver.

title: America and the Mini-Series, in Infancy
description: IN a late 1970s Doonesbury comic strip, the cartoonist Garry Trudeau imagined the NBC programming wizard Fred Silvermans pitch for a docudrama about the Camp David accords  starring John Travolta and Suzanne Somers as Menachem Begin and Anwar Sadat.

title: Shorts Have Men Showing a Little Leg
description: EARLIER this season on the MTV series Savage U, Dan Savage, the syndicated sex columnist, was asked if he wears shorts. His response was as immediate as it was dismissive: No, no. Im a grown-up.

title: Prospect Park, 8:17 A.M.
Many Hats, in France or America
description: THE actor and auteur Guillaume Canet is what the French call un boulimique de travail: a workaholic.

title: Cooking With Summer Tomatoes
description: Every summer, Martha Rose Shulman finds a new way to celebrate the tomato. This year, she unleashes the flavors of the tomato through Provenal cooking.

title: Merging Textures Across the Decades
description: Josh Berman & His Gang

title: About Your Underinsured Motorist Policy
description: In my Your Money column this weekend, I sought out more detail about the auto insurance case that lit up the Internet this week. Its a complicated tale, involving Progressive Insurance and family members of Katie Fisher, who was killed in a car accident. They were trying to make a claim on her underinsured motorist policy, since there was an underinsured motorist at the wheel of the car that hit her.

title: The TV Watch: Saudi Arabia
description: Alessandra Stanley, the Times's chief television critic, looks at several cultures from around the world through the prism of their television programming.

title: Universals Paramount Hits
description: THE first thing you may notice about Universal Rarities: Films of the 1930s, a fine new box set from TCMs limited edition Vault Collection, is that all four features it contains were actually produced and released by Paramount Pictures. Million Dollar Legs (1932), Belle of the Nineties (1934), Artists and Models (1937) and Souls at Sea (1937) are indeed Universal rarities in the sense that (a) they are rare and (b) they figure among the 700 or so pre-1950 Paramount sound films that through a series of acquisitions and mergers, ended up under the control of Universals television division.

title: The TV Watch: Saudi Arabia
description: Alessandra Stanley, the Times's chief television critic, looks at several cultures from around the world through the prism of their television programming.

title: Teenage Dream
description: In the 16 years since its introduction, the Porsche Boxster has steadily evolved into a great sports car. After its first full redesign, the two-seat convertible still shines.

title: The Well Rounded Amber Heard
description: Shes a punch-throwing, gun-shooting, crown-wearing, sash-bearing, beauty-pageant Barbie with a twist, says the actress Amber Heard of her role in the Robert Rodriguez action film Machete Kills, due out next year. Similar words could be used to describe the 26-year-old actress, who at age 16 fled Catholic school in Austin, Tex., for a try at modeling in New York  but who still listens to the blues and is a crack shot with her .357 Magnum. Heard is also a Guess model, whose va-va-voom looks and progressive views on sexuality  she spoke out on behalf of the L.G.B.T. community at a 2010 Gay & Lesbian Alliance Against Defamation event  have earned her many a racy headline. Not that shes noticed; Heard doesnt read the gossips, anyway. (So dont ask her about Johnny Depp, Amber Heard Are 100 Percent Dating. ) If I had the time, Id be reading my book or doing the crossword, she says, referring to her one-week summer before filming Paranoia, a thriller with Liam Hemsworth. (Her most recent role was in the film adaptation of Hunter S. Thompsons The Rum Diary.) In between movies, Heard, who has made trips to the Mexico border with Amnesty International, will work with the organization on a bilingual campaign to help raise awareness about current immigration policies. Itll be something we present both on a grass-roots level and a lobby level, she says. Barbie goes to Washington? More

title: The TV Watch: Saudi Arabia
description: Alessandra Stanley, the Times's chief television critic, looks at several cultures from around the world through the prism of their television programming.

title: Registry: Wedding Gift Ideas for Picnic Enthusiasts
description: For couples who enjoy biking, or better yet, riding a bicycle built for two, there are accessories to carry provisions.

title: Panic Seizes India as a Regions Strife Radiates
description: BRAJAKHAL, India  Like a fever, fear has spread across India this week, from big cities like Bangalore to smaller places like Mysore, a contagion fueling a message: Run. Head home. Flee. And that is what thousands of migrants from the countrys distant northeastern states are doing, jamming into train stations in an exodus challenging the Indian ideals of tolerance and diversity.

title: Arkansas Police Release More Footage Related to Mans Death
description: Witnesses in the Chavis Carter case in Arkansas said they heard a popping sound, then saw two police officers involved in his arrest approach the back seat of the patrol car where Mr. Carter had been placed in handcuffs and was later found with a fatal gunshot wound. That was according to new material released by the Jonesboro Police Department, which has said Mr. Carter apparently shot himself during the arrest last month.

title: Marriage Is No Picnic? Begging to Differ
description: ONCE back from the honeymoon, newlyweds will still have romantic places to go.

title: Obama Releases $470 Million for Highway Work
description: The Obama administration will make nearly half a billion dollars available to states to create thousands of construction jobs and fix the nations aging infrastructure.

title: Congressional Leaders Issue Medicare Talking Points for August
description: With members of Congress back home for a five-week recess, leaders in both parties are working overtime to make sure that their respective messages on Medicare are being pounded in their Congressional districts. The case is particularly urgent now that Representative Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin has been chosen as the number two on the Republican ticket.

title: In India, Many Flee Fearing Violence
description: Prime Minister Manmohan Singh assured migrants that they were safe as thousands fled big cities, fearing a backlash from violence against Muslims in Assam.

title: Baseball Hall of Fame Player Settles Insider Trading Case
description: On the standout Baltimore Orioles baseball teams of the late 1970s, Eddie Murray, the Hall of Fame first baseman, shared the infield with the all-star third baseman Doug DeCinces.

title: Week in Review: Credit Cards and Corzine
On Their Way to Pebble Beach, Driving Every Mile
description: MUSCLING his 1931 Pierce-Arrow through a sharp turn in the Gifford Pinchot National Forest of Washington State, Al McEwan might have been living out a passage from The Kings of the Road, a book he read and reread as a boy.

title: The Rolls-Royce That Built a Reputation
description: ON its way to the Pebble Beach Concours dlgance as a participant in the 1,500-mile Motoring Classic tour, the 1912 Rolls-Royce Silver Ghost owned by Charles Howard of Gloucestershire, England, was sidelined by an engine failure. That will not affect the Silver Ghosts place in history, however. Some experts consider the Ghost the greatest Rolls of all.

title: Can a Mom Get a Break?
description: SOMEHOW, my local manicure ladies always feel inclined to turn my $35 finger-and-toe sessions into a barrage of myriad personal questions. In halting English, they will pepper me with, How old are you? Where you born? How much you make? What your husband do?

title: Porsches Baby Turns 16; Seeks a Bigger Allowance
description: PORSCHE doesnt like to be rushed. But while it took the companys lab-coated obsessives 16 years to fully redesign the Boxster, the two-seat convertible has steadily evolved into one of the worlds best sports cars.

title: On the Market in the Region
description: A five-bedroom colonial in Maplewood, N.J., and a four-bedroom waterfront home in Rowayton, Conn.

title: On the Market in New York City
description: A Financial District condo, a Morningside Heights co-op and a Prospect Park South Victorian.

title: On Set | Amber Heard
description: T goes behind the scenes at the Terry Richardson photo shoot with Amber Heard.

title: A Debutante Grows Up
description: IF you were invited by Cornelia Guest for lunch and didnt know better, you might dress up for it. But that would be as silly as worrying about being late to Templeton, the 15-acre estate in Old Westbury, N.Y., where she lives with a menagerie, a small staff, some Warhols and many boldface memories.

title: Aug. 19  25
description: IN their uniformity and attire  youre all one size here  the students at the Institute Benjamenta, a school for domestic servants, seem as much prisoners as pupils. Because this is a Quay Brothers movie, they also seem like automatons, something between men and machines. Later in life, Jakob (Mark Rylance) says, we shall all be something very small and subordinate. The Quays, masters of stop-motion animation, are the subjects of a gallery show at the Museum of Modern Art and a linked film series, which begins with what might seem like an anomaly in their canon, a live-action film, INSTITUTE BENJAMENTA, OR THIS DREAM PEOPLE CALL HUMAN LIFE.

title: Svetlana Legetic, Washington Night Life Promoter, Moving to New York
description: Svetlana Legetic has grown into a party-production juggernaut that she plans to bring to New York in September.

title: Can She Party On in New York?
description: WASHINGTON

title: A Renaissance for a Space Age Relic
description: ON a recent evening, I struggled to hold a squat during what felt like a wildly electric earthquake. Forget the burn of the pose; my chief discomfort was the way my brain seemed to rattle, my ears buzzing.

title: Editors Letter
description: More and more, when I sit in the front row or speak to students, I am asked to comment on the relevance of magazines and editors in the age of live streamed fashion shows and immediate news from the catwalks. Its a timely and good question, one that deserves not to be brushed aside; and something I thought about as we reviewed the final pages for this issue, which is devoted to the fall womens collections.

description: AT the beginning of the summer, my farm share inundated me with bowling-ball-size cabbages for six weeks straight. I made mountains of slaw and then just started giving the cabbages away.

description: 11:32 p.m. | Updated

title: Paul Ryan and the Auto Bailout
description: At an Ohio campaign stop on Thursday, Paul Ryan ventured into auto-bailout territory. He described a shuttered GM factory in his hometown of Janesville, Wis., and said I remember President Obama visiting it when he was first running, saying hell keep that plant open. One more broken promise. Later, in an interview with an ABC affiliate, he said the auto rescue didnt help Janesville. They shut our plant down.

title: On Energy Policy, a Week of Venus and Mars
description: Support for green energy is emerging as one of the starker divides in the presidential race, raising questions about the renewable energy sectors ability to thrive.

title: Iranian Currency Traders Find a Haven in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  With American and European sanctions spurring a currency crisis in Iran, officials say a growing number of Iranians are packing trucks with devalued rials and heading to the freewheeling currency market next door in American-occupied Afghanistan, to trade for dollars.

title: The Week in Culture Pictures, Aug. 17
description: A slide show of photographs of cultural events from this week.

title: United Nations Is Looking to Spur a Billion People to Act
description: Is one weekend enough time to mobilize an additional 750 million people to do something meaningful? Perhaps, if you combine celebrity power, huge global brands and a humanitarian message from the United Nations.

title: When an Interview Subject Gives You a Lemon
description: In the August issue of the British music magazine The Word, there is a profile of Lou Reed. The story, hilariously titled Iceberg Ahead! is indicative of the magazines wit and irreverence, as well as a case study of how to produce a lively, readable story out of a difficult interview. Here, the author, James Medd, describes what its like to talk to the 70-year-old rock legend:

title: Syrian Rebel Forces Advance Close to the Airport at Aleppo
description: Syrian insurgents fighting loyalist forces in the northern city of Aleppo seized areas near its airport on Friday, threatening the governments control of a strategically vital supply conduit and scoring a propaganda victory in what has become a protracted battle in Syrias largest metropolis.

title: Paul Ryan and Tax Policy
description: Scott Galupo, the former Capitol Hill staffer turned blogger for the American Conservative, responds to my last post on Paul Ryans policy record, mixing some praise for Ryan with the following critique:

title: Vintage Postcards From the West Coast
description: The Pebble Beach Motoring Classic, a 1,500-mile tour now in its eighth year, reflects an evolving belief among collectors that vintage cars are meant to be driven, not just displayed.

title: The Week in Culture Pictures, Aug. 17
description: More Photographs

title: New on Madison Avenue
description: Dozens of new stores are drawing a younger clientele to the traditionally sedate neighborhood above 60th Street.

title: Twitter Changes Lead to Online Protests
description: Twitters new rules for third-party developers have spurred an online uproar.

title: Getting Close and Personal With Imran Khan
description: For this weeks profile of Imran Khan, the Scottish photographer Finlay MacKay travelled to Pakistan to photograph the popular politician. MacKay, who has been a regular contributor to the magazine since 2006, is known for his highly choreographed portraits of celebrities and athletes (as his portraits of Javier Bardem, Nastia Liukin and Floyd Mayweather Jr. demonstrate).

title: Tougher Crash Test Brings Lower Scores
description: NEW models typically receive the top rating  Good  in front offset crash tests conducted by the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety. So the institute raised eyebrows throughout the auto industry last week when it released results of a new type of frontal test in which only two of the 11 tested cars received the highest score.

title: All-American Food With New-Age Touches
description: LEAVE it to a former vegan to produce one of the best hamburger platters in northern New Jersey. Lauren Dwyer, whose cookbook collection now includes Fergus Hendersons The Whole Beast: Nose to Tail Eating, serves it at the Laurel, the tiny but excellent restaurant she opened in May in Maplewood.

title: Heineken Clinches Deal for Asia Pacific Breweries With $4.5 Billion Offer
description: Heineken claimed victory in its fight to gain control of Asia Pacific Breweries on Friday, announcing a sweetened deal to buy the rights to the beer maker held by Fraser & Neave for about $4.5 billion.

title: Mining Golden Kernels From the Cob
description: Im writing about corn in my column this week, with a recipe for a baked pancake that includes fresh kernels. In the video above, I give some tips on cutting the kernels off the cob, but I dont go into the different methods of cooking corn. There is, of course, boiling (for a minute or two), broiling (slicked with olive oil, broil for a minute or two until browned in spots) and grilling, either in the husk or peeled.

title: False Hope in the First Dawn
description: Alexander Kumar, a physician and researcher at Concordia Station, writes from Antarctica, where he conducts scientific experiments for the European Space Agencys human spaceflight program.

title: Chic in Review | Paul Ryan, Topless
description: All the fashion news of the week thats fit to reprint.Banks, AzealiaHer cover for Dazed and Confuseds September issue, which was banned in multiple countries, is, naturally, the most-viewed page on Dazeddigital.com. Check it.

title: Adding Stevie Nicks and Paul Simon, Then Setting the Songbook to Shuffle
description: Hilary Kole, a singer who has uneasily straddled the line between cabaret and jazz in her shows at Birdland over the years, revealed a strong pop presence on Wednesday evening at 54 Below, where she is appearing with a five-piece band.

title: A 20-Year Low in U.S. Carbon Emissions
description: Energy-related carbon dioxide emissions in the United States from January through March were the lowest of any recorded for the first quarter of the year since 1992, the federal Energy Information Administration reports.

title: Changes in Egypts Top Military Command
description: On Aug. 12, President Mohamed Morsi purged Egypts top generals to reclaim the political power that the military had seized after the fall of Hosni Mubarak in 2011.

title: With Defiance, Laughter and a New Single, Russian Riot Grrrls Go to Jail
description: As my colleague David Herszenhorn reports, three members of the all-female protest band Pussy Riot were sentenced to two-year prison terms on Friday by a judge who ruled that their impromptu performance of a song deriding Vladimir V. Putin in a Moscow cathedral last February was motivated by religious hatred.

title: Second World Mind Sports Games in France
description: LILLE, France  At the Second World Mind Sports Games here, the United States open and senior teams qualified for the quarterfinals, which started on Friday and will end on Saturday at 1:20 p.m. Eastern time. The results are at worldbridge.org.

title: In a U.P.S. Truck in Canarsie, Buckets of Green Contraband
description: Canarsie, Brooklyn, 5:30 a.m. Thursday. A tip to the police: buckets of marijuana in a U.P.S. truck on Farragut Road and East 104th Street.

title: Where Playwrights Take Center Stage
description: In the front window of the Drama Book Shop, on 40th Street in Midtown Manhattan, there is a sign that reads, Playwright working, with an arrow pointing down to just that. At 3:30 on a recent Friday afternoon, the featured writer was Hilary Bettis, one of 76 participants in Write Out Front, a three-week project continuing through Sept. 1.

title: Liberty Media on the Cusp of Controlling Sirius XM
description: John C. Malones Liberty Media appeared to be close to victory on Friday in its continuing, and often sharp-elbowed, battle to take over Sirius XM Radio.

description: To the Editor:

title: In Report, British Officials Question Testimony of Barclays Chief
description: LONDON  In a report released early Saturday in London, British politicians said the former Barclays chief Robert E. Diamond Jr. had not provided lawmakers a full account of the actions inside the bank during recent hearings into the rate-rigging scandal.

description: FOR more than 30 years, Long Islanders have enjoyed the desserts made by Elio Sobrero at the restaurants he owned with his business partner, Bobbi Schwinger  La Primavera in East Hills, followed by Capriccio in Jericho.

title: A Year After New-Car Cavalcade, Pebble Beach Falls Conspicuously Quiet
description: Last year, Lexus chose Pebble Beach as its stage for the global debut of its redesigned GS sedan. The Japanese marque was not alone. Infiniti showed its JX crossover and Cadillac unveiled its stunning Ciel concept during the collector car festivities there.

description: The complete tax 2011 tax returns from Paul and Janna Ryan.

description: To the Editor:

description: Jokes, puns and an intimate encounter with a bubbly sea lion dominated the headlines after Mayor Michael R. Bloombergs visit to the New York Aquarium on Thursday.

title: Now Online | T Womens Fashion Fall 2012
description: The fall womens fashion issue of T stars Emma Watson, who after a decade of Harry Potter films is opening a new bag of tricks. Inside, meet Amber Heard, the model, activist and actress, and journey to Wellington, New Zealand, with the catwalker Miranda Kerr, who is photographed by her husband, Orlando Bloom, in the seasons white shirts and strappy flats. For the newest fashion trends, check out our report on the decorated jacket, the wrap and the new suit, or see what Diane Kruger, Mati Diop and Annie Clark have worn in Styled to a T. Our spotlight on Hollywood includes an essay by Rashida Jones on business-friendly looks, an excerpt of the former Brat Packer Andrew McCarthys new book and a chat between the actor Mads Mikkelsen and A.O. Scott. Want more? Then check out Lynn Yaegers report on the Paris Museum of Fashion, read Suzy Menkes musing on the return of the pantsuit or watch the model Liya Kebede lead a Velvet Revolution. See more from the issue >>

description: To the Editor:

description: To the Editor:
