title: Effects of Delirium Are Found to Linger
description: The more researchers learn about delirium, the clearer it is that attention must be paid. For years, people thought of it as a transient condition: Patients, especially older ones, grow confused and irrational and sometimes even violent during hospital stays  then in a few days, the delirium passes and people return to themselves.

title: Hedge Fund Proposal Would Allow Secretive Enclave to Open Up
description: The tight-lipped world of hedge funds might soon be able to speak more freely.

title: Potluck for the Eyeballs: Amazons Streaming Service
description: In the olden days, bargains added spice to life. Youd get a free toaster with a new bank account, or a collectible drinking glass with a gas fill-up. Old-timers even claim that at one time, you got free meals on airplanes.

title: Were You Shot at the 1977 U.S. Open?
description: As Michael Steinberger wrote in his recent magazine article about the 1977 U.S. Open, one of most startling moments during the tournament was the shooting of a spectator in the stands. James Reilly, a 33-year-old Manhattanite, was shot in the leg by  as police would later come to believe  someone in an apartment building near the stadium in Forest Hills, Queens. Whoever fired the gun was never found.

title: A Football Watch Party With a Few Thousand Guests
description: The only thing better than watching college football on Saturday is watching the games with your friends on a college football Saturday. Paul Myerberg of The Times is back this year to host the best college watch party in the country and offer up his own analysis and insights on all of the big games and a lot of the not so big ones.

title: We Built It: Flood-Control Edition
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Someone from the Louisiana delegation ought to steal the We Built It sign from the convention hall and hang it on one of the giant flood-control pumps now protecting New Orleans, because thats where it belongs.

title: Drogba Provides Hope for Fans of Chinese Club
description: The first sight that Didier Drogba encountered on a Chinese soccer field was a familiar one. As Shanghai Shenhuas newly introduced substitute waited for the second half to start, he shared a smile and a word with Aiyegbeni Yakubu, Guangzhou Fulis recently acquired striker.

title: Booksellers Group Partners With Canadian E-Book Company
description: Nearly five months after Google said it would end a little-used program that allowed independent bookstores to sell its e-books, a Canadian e-reading company named Kobo has stepped in as a replacement.

title: Field Trip! The Magazine at the R.N.C.
description: Christoph Niemann has filed another dispatch from Tampa, where he is live-illustrating tweets from the Republican National Convention:

title: Happy Birthday, Parks. Now Open Your Web Site.
description: It is safe to say that in 1916, when the National Park Service was created, no one could have imagined how the institution would be marking its 96th birthday: a Web site created with mobile devices in mind.

title: Finding Effective Advertising in Surprising Places
description: Recently, I heard that riff of music that I always hear when confronted with a piece of fine advertising. At the time, oddly enough, I was paused at an intersection in Austin, Tex., staring at the back end of a delivery truck for a local hardware store, Zinger Hardware.

title: The Peanut Gallerys View of the Convention
description: If Chris Christie ever runs for president, America will continue to lead the world in fat jokes. That is abundantly clear to anyone who was paying close attention to the vast peanut gallery that is Twitter last night. Comedians, who have embraced the form as much as any other artist, were hard at work reacting to the Republican National Convention in Tampa, Fla., especially the major speeches of Mr. Christie, the New Jersey governor, and Ann Romney, wife of the partys nominee, Mitt Romney. Relying on Witstream, a Web site that collects Twitter postings from the comedy world, as well as some searching, I hereby offer a few of the best jokes suitable for a family newspaper.

title: Pre-Publication Disclosure of Dowd Column: A Breach of Two Boundaries
description: My final column as public editor was published in print on Sunday. However, I remain on duty through Friday and want to offer my take on the controversy this week over the pre-publication disclosure of a Maureen Dowd column. I see this as a problem of boundaries  the failure to maintain them.

title: Day 2: TimesCast Politics Schedule and Convention Day at a Glance
description: 5:26 p.m. | Updated Tuesdays Republican National Convention schedule featured nominations, protests, keynotes and 3 Doors Down, and that was only the beginning. The Timess political unit is back in action in Tampa, Fla., broadcasting live with the latest from the convention hall. The next broadcast will be at 7 p.m.

title: Scouting Report
description: EVENTS

title: Cultural War of 1992 Moves In From the Fringe
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Twenty years ago, Patrick J. Buchanan rocked the Republican convention in Houston by declaring there was a cultural war taking place for the soul of America, denouncing the Democratic Party as one that supported abortion, radical feminism and the homosexual rights movement.

title: Google Plus Goes to the Office
description: Now Google Plus means business.

title: Ryan Speech to Focus on the Economy, With Shots at Obama
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Representative Paul D. Ryan, framing the presidential election as the clearest choice possible, intends to use his prime-time moment at the Republican National Convention on Wednesday night to assure Americans that he and Mitt Romney can oversee a strong economic recovery.

title: Katy Perry Wants Snackers to Dream of Popchips
description: Popchips hopes to put more, well, pop in its chips by adding the pop singer Katy Perry to its roster of celebrity endorsers.

title: Citigroup in $590 Million Settlement of Subprime Lawsuit
description: Citigroup said on Wednesday that it had agreed to pay $590 million to settle a class-action lawsuit brought by shareholders who contended that they had been misled about the banks exposure to subprime mortgage debt on the eve of the financial crisis.

title: Ex-Senator Criticizes Republicans Tone on Immigration
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Mel Martinez is a former United States Senator from Florida, served as chairman of the Republican Party under President George W. Bush, and is one of the highest-level Hispanic Republicans in public life. So it was striking on Wednesday morning to hear him speak starkly about his partys problems with Latino voters after a primary season in which all the candidates stressed measures that would severely curb immigration

title: Master Glass | Carlo Scarpa: Venini 1932-1947
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Yoko Ono and Sean Lennon Organize Artists Against Fracking
description: Yoko Ono said it was not hard to recruit more than 180 artists to help convince Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo of New York not to allow natural gas drilling in the Marcellus Shale through the hydraulic fracturing process known as fracking.

title: FX Orders 90 More Episodes of Anger Management
description: Heres something no one has been able to say about Charlie Sheen for a while: now he knows what hell be working on for the next two years, or, at least, where hes supposed to go when hes working. On Wednesday, FX said that it had committed to an additional 90 episodes of Anger Management, the sitcom that has served as Mr. Sheens comeback vehicle after his  didnt you hear?  tumultuous departure from Two and a Half Men.

title: Georgia Frees Hostages Along Border With Russia
description: TBILISI, Georgia  The Georgian authorities said Wednesday that their forces had engaged in a fierce gun battle to free five Georgian villagers being held by a band of heavily armed militants who had crossed over the mountainous border from the Russian republic of Dagestan. Three Georgian officers and at least 10 militants were killed, officials said.

title: French Banks Prepare to Pull Out of Greece
description: PARIS  Frances biggest banks are preparing to pull out of Greece in the coming weeks, the latest large international business to abandon the country as it grapples with a debilitating recession and nagging questions about its future in the euro zone.

title: Two Views of This Summers Deal-Making
description: Looked at in one way, this summer was a dire time for deal-making. But from another perspective, its been a great one.

title: Severe Diet Doesnt Prolong Life, at Least in Monkeys
description: For 25 years, the rhesus monkeys were kept semi-starved, lean and hungry. The males weights were so low they were the equivalent of a 6-foot-tall man who tipped the scales at just 120 to 133 pounds. The hope was that if the monkeys lived longer, healthier lives by eating a lot less, then maybe people, their evolutionary cousins, would, too. Some scientists, anticipating such benefits, began severely restricting their own diets.

title: Super PACs and Party Stalwarts Mix in Tampa
description: ST. PETERSBURG, Fla.  Why did the super PAC go to Tampa? Because that is where the money is.

title: An Online Retailer Gets Its Own Makeover
description: SHOPBOP, the online powerhouse of contemporary fashion, has never gone in for bells and whistles.

title: Authenticity and Ethnicity
description: EDINBURGH  Fifty writers from around the globe assembled in a large tent in Edinburgh in mid-August, and over five days they spoke about the relationship between literature and politics; about whether style and content are really opposites (as people who lack style often claim); and about censorship and the future of the novel.

title: Chris Christie: But Enough About Mitt, Lets Talk About Me
description: Gov. Chris Christie is getting rave reviews today for his performance at the National Republican Convention, and theres no doubt in my mind that he did a huge amount of good for the three most important people in his life  he, himself, and him.

title: A Day in Indianapolis, and a Night in Tampa
description: TAMPA, Fla.  A day after being formally nominated for president, Mitt Romney left the Republican National Convention on Wednesday to address the American Legion in Indianapolis as Republicans tried to focus on national security.

title: Gay Republicans Try to Join the Party
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The go-go dancers at the party for gay Republicans on Tuesday night were, by go-go dancer standards, modestly dressed in T-shirts and jeans, baring only their midriffs and arms. Their choreography, set to dance remixes of Call Me Maybe and other Top 40 hits, conveyed enthusiasm more than sexual enticement.

title: Mazda Enters the Midsize Fray With Sleeker Mazda 6 Sedan
description: Mazda introduced its 2014 Mazda 6 at the Moscow motor show on Tuesday. The redesigned midsize sedan will mix it up with recently updated entries from Ford, Chevrolet, Nissan, Honda and Toyota. Judging by the details released by Mazda at the show, the 6 seems well equipped for the fight.

title: Indians in Venezuelan Amazon Report Attack by Gold Miners
description: The human rights group Survival International says it has received reports, not yet independently verified, of a July massacre of a Yanomami Indian community by Brazilian gold miners in the Venezuelan portion of the Amazon rain forest along the border with Brazil. The details are in a news release posted by the nonprofit group.

title: Forget Tequila, September Makes Me Crazy
description: A shout-out to all the fellow parents on Facebook madly grappling with pulling together the fall schedule. Its transition time again, and just like what happens every June, September is the time to shift from the schedule devil we know to the devil we dont know. School (bless school!) has its lovely, predictable schedule, and kindly provides us with even the date for the holiday concert months in advance.

title: In Parole Transcripts for Lennons Killer, a Familiar Account, and Decision
description: Last week, Mark David Chapman was denied parole for the seventh time in the killing of John Lennon. On Wednesday, the New York State department of corrections released the transcript of his Aug. 22 parole board hearing.

title: PEN American Center Announces Literary Awards
description: The PEN American Center has announced the winners of its annual literary awards, naming Susan Nussbaum, the author of Good Kings Bad Kings, the recipient of the $25,000 Bellwether Prize for Socially Engaged Fiction, an honor for the author of an unpublished novel. Vanessa Veselka, author of Zazen, was named the winner of the $25,000 Robert W. Bingham Prize.

title: The U.S. Open Chronicles: Listen to the Music
description: Irina Falconi, who is playing at the United States Open this year, will write posts throughout the tournament for Straight Sets. She has her own tumblr page, and can be followed on Twitter. On Tuesday, she lost in three sets to Olga Puchkova in the first round of the womens singles competition.

title: Wedding Q. and A.
description: Gifts Are Optional for a Second Wedding

title: Madonna in Philadelphia
description: The pop queen kicked off the North American leg of her tour at the citys Wells Fargo Center on Tuesday night.

title: Baker and Isner Open on Very Different Stages
description: On the Arthur Ashe Stadium court Wednesday, John Isner was thrilling a big crowd and brushing away thoughts that he was under pressure to advance far in the United States Open. He professed, after a hard-fought, 6-3, 7-6 (5), 5-7, 7-6 (9) victory over Xavier Malisse, that he was just happy to finally be awarded the honor of opening his tournament on the Opens feature court.

title: Trey Songz Reaches No. 1; Adele Drops Out of Top 10
description: On the music charts this week: The fifth time is a charm for the R&B singer Trey Songz, Adele is finally bumped from the Top 10, and a South Korean pop song goes viral.

title: By Request, Merkel Is Returning to China for Economic Talks
description: BERLIN  Continuing a fast pace of international diplomacy, Chancellor Angela Merkel is visiting China on Thursday and Friday for the second time in seven months, acting as a conduit both for German business and the European Union.

title: Touring Streets, Highlighting Gutters
description: LOS ANGELES  Who here likes hookers?

title: Questioning Kristof on Chinese Education
description: Nicholas Kristof last wrote about Chinese schools shortly after the release of some stunning news: on a comprehensive exam testing students in 65 countries, China had come in first  thirty spots ahead of the U.S. in math. Kristof praised the Chinese model and ended with a warning: These latest test results should be our 21st-century Sputnik.

title: U.N. Leader Broaches Delicate Topics in Meetings With Top Iranian Officials
description: TEHRAN  Making his first visit to Iran as United Nations secretary general, Ban Ki-moon met with four members of the countrys hierarchy on Wednesday, including the supreme leader, in sessions that Mr. Bans spokesman described as very serious meetings that addressed the disputed Iranian nuclear program, the Syria conflict, human rights problems and what he called the leaderships objectionable comments about Israel.

title: Optical Allusion
description: Like so many trappings of midcentury manliness, brow line eyeglasses  the kind favored by Malcolm X  have landed in the hipster bargain bin. Leave it to Tom Ford to rescue them with this exquisite version made of gold-plated metal and water buffalo horn, the way they used to be in the 1960s. (The horn component even comes with a certificate of authenticity, along with a special cleansing cream.) The only thing thats not midcentury about these limited-edition frames is the $2,950 price tag.

title: U.S. Open Food of the Day: Shortrib Sandwich
description: This is our daily review of an item from the United States Open concession stands.

title: In Executive Shake-up, Nickelodeon Fires Its Animation Chief
description: LOS ANGELES  Nickelodeon, under pressure to reverse sharp ratings declines, fired its president of animation and longtime head of preschool programming on Wednesday amid a broader management shake-up.

title: Mayor Makes It Official: It Was a Big Year for Isabella and Jayden
description: Looking pink-skinned, diminutive and a little bit wrinkly, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg appeared in City Halls Blue Room on Wednesday morning to deliver one of the years more adorable bundles of news: the way we name our babies now.

title: Preparing for the Day After President Assad
description: If Syrians ever get a chance to build a democracy, they should have an advantage over their Arab Spring brethren. Forty-five Syrian intellectuals have just finished a 122-page, post-Assad plan for how to take the country to an open, more pluralistic future.

title: Yankees Welcome Ugandan Little League Team
description: The Yankees had special guests visit them on Wednesday: the Ugandan Little League team, the first African team to advance to a Little League World Series, was given a tour of the clubhouse by Manager Joe Girardi.

title: Chris Christie Channels Oprah
description: Watching Gov. Chris Christies combative keynote speech last night reminded us of the cover piece I wrote about him last year. His mention of his mother teaching him the difference between love and respect, in particular, brought me back. The greatest lesson Mom ever taught me, Christie told the crowd in Tampa last night, was this one: She told me there would be times in your life when you have to choose between being loved and being respected. She said to always pick being respected, that love without respect was always fleeting  but that respect could grow into real, lasting love.

title: Majority in Poll Say Akins Remarks Dont Reflect G.O.P.s Views
description: In the wake of the widespread outrage over a Missouri congressmans remarks about rape and abortion, about 60 percent of Americans do not think his comments reflect the views of most Republicans, according to the latest CBS News poll.

description: A view of the day in sports, including final preparations for the Paralympics in London and Stage 11 of the Tour of Spain.

title: She Makes Fitness Look Like Fashion
description: ON a recent Thursday night, Bianca Kosoy, the 41-year-old executive creative director at Equinox, was at a club. Not, as one might imagine, a fitness club, but its diametrical opposite.

title: Housing Market Improvements Lessen Consumer Distress
description: Improvement in the nations housing markets has helped ease consumer financial woes, according to a quarterly report from a large credit counseling agency.

title: Samsung Is First in Line With a Windows Phone 8 Device
description: Samsung, the worlds biggest phone maker, on Wednesday showed the first smartphone to include Windows Phone 8, the next version of Microsofts mobile operating system. In making this announcement, Samsung is beating even Nokia, Microsofts official partner for making Windows phones, in unveiling the first Windows Phone 8 device.

title: Ann Romneys Red Dress Ended One Debate
description: THE color red claimed its usual place of prominence Tuesday night at the Republican National Convention, this time in the form of the belted knee-length Oscar de la Renta dress that Ann Romney wore during her much-anticipated speech to the partys delegates in Tampa, Fla.

title: JetBlue Sign Joins the New York Skyline
description: 4:36 p.m. | Updated Look, up in the sky. Its a bird. Its a plane. Actually, its a sign to promote a company that owns a lot of planes.

title: Fox News Is Biggest Draw on First Night of Convention
description: TAMPA, Fla.  More than 20 million people tuned in to the Republican National Convention on Tuesday night, and more of them watched on Fox News than on any other channel by far.

title: Whats Your Workout? A Food Stars Fitness Plan
description: The Food Network chef Robert Irvine hosts the popular show Restaurant: Impossible, in which he and his team race to turn around a troubled restaurant on a 48-hour deadline. During a recent episode, Mr. Irvine renovated a community center in Washington that provides tutoring and healthful meals to children  a challenge issued to him by Michelle Obama.

title: Colorful Pigeons in St. Marks Square Stir Controversy
description: They may not rank with the Bridge of Sighs or gondolas as Venices top tourist attractions, but the pigeons of St. Marks Square definitely have their fans  and protectors. That has been amply demonstrated in recent days as the result of an art project undertaken as part of this years Architecture Biennale in Venice, in which two European artists have tinted some of the St. Marks flock in gaudy colors.

title: Tattoo You
description: Fashion Week may induce cravings for an It bag or a pair of shoes that last only a season, but the jewelry designer Pamela Love is hoping to leave showgoers with something a bit more permanent this time around. In the ultimate test of designer devotion, Love has nixed her usual presentation to host a pop-up tattoo parlor at Milk/Mades Digital Bar from Sept. 8 to Sept. 9.

title: The Ryans in Rehearsal
description: TAMPA, Fla.  With the hours ticking down to his prime-time speech embracing the vice-presidential nomination, Representative Paul D. Ryan made the customary walk-through of the convention hall stage on Wednesday afternoon.

description: 6:01 p.m. | Updated  Adding details.

description: REMEMBER the big pre-Labor Day shopping excursion, the reunion with beloved classmates, the specter of newly minted bullies and the scent of pencils in the air? There was drama, emotion and heightened energy to the moment.

title: The Twins Are Fine. The Parents Are Not.
description: Alex and Leslie Twisden, the central couple in Chase Novaks Breed, lead a double life. So does Chase Novak. His name is a not even remotely secret pseudonym for Scott Spencer, the gently literary author still best remembered for the lush prose of his 1979 Endless Love. Now,  la John Banville/Benjamin Black, he has started writing in a pulpier and more diabolical vein, and Breed is just the first installment. Mr. Spencer has said that Brood will come next.

title: Brinda tregua de pandillas frgil paz a El Salvador
description: SAN SALVADOR, El Salvador.- Se haban enfrentado muchas veces antes, en las calles, con armas en las manos. Pero cuando los lderes principales de dos de las pandillas callejeras ms violentas del hemisferio se sentaron uno frente al otro en el sofocante ambiente de una prisin de mxima seguridad en San Salvador este ao, el encuentro tuvo un objetivo muy diferente: la paz.

title: Soaked
description: THESE days, New York hotels are less about lodgings than being one-stop entertainment Goliaths. With Soaked, a skyscraping outdoor bar that opened in July, the Mondrian SoHo joins the Standard, Dream Downtown, Wythe and other hotels taking clever advantage of prime rooftop real estate.

title: In the Syrian Fight, Rebels Prospects Can Change With the Weather
description: Sometimes when working in the field you make the mistake of looking right past a story. There  right there  is an element of your subject, squarely in front of you, all but screaming, and you dont hear it.

title: TimesCast Politics | August 29, 2 P.M.
description: Jeff Zeleny analyzes Tuesday night's speeches. | Notes on the campaign trail. | BuzzFeed on Social Media. | Opinion: Frank Bruni talks to Ross Douthat.

title: ING to Sell Canadian Unit to Scotiabank for $3.1 Billion
description: The ING Group said on Wednesday that it would sell its Canadian unit to Scotiabank for about $3.1 billion in cash, as the Dutch bank continues to sell assets to pay for its government bailout.

title: Wheelies: The Land of Lincoln Edition
description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Milestone for Twitter Spambot, and Andreessen Horowitz
description: Some interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. See more here.

title: Romney Tells Veterans That Obama Dodged the Tough Choices
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Mitt Romney promised veterans at a convention on Wednesday that he would stop reckless defense cuts set for the end of the year and slammed President Obama as a commander in chief who has failed to lead and has dodged the tough choices.

title: Q. and A.: Caroline Skinner, Executive Producer of Doctor Who
description: On Saturday night, fans of the long-running British science-fiction series Doctor Who will celebrate the start of a new season that may be among its most ambitious and turbulent. In a paradox that a dimension-spanning Time Lord from Gallifrey would surely appreciate, the new season, the seventh since Doctor Who was revived in 2005, leads up to celebrations next year for the 50th anniversary of the shows birth in 1963.

title: Pictures of the Day: Louisiana and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Louisiana, Mississippi, Kenya and Syria.

title: Special Correspondents
description: Kurt Vonnegut: Letters (Delacorte, $35). The great writers life unspools in these frank missives. In 1945, he writes his parents of being a German P.O.W.: One boy starved to death and the SS troops shot two for stealing food. He jabs Norman Mailer: I am cuter than you are. In the last letter, dated 2007, he declines a speaking gig: I resemble nothing so much as an iguana, hate travel, and have nothing to say.

title: Fantasy Football: Quarterback Primer
description: Jason and Justin Sablich will provide fantasy football advice and analysis throughout the season on this blog and on Twitter @5thDownFantasy.

title: Biloxi Surprised by Isaacs Rain
description: BILOXI, Miss.  As Hurricane Isaac carved a slow, relentless path north, attention Wednesday was focused largely on its effects on New Orleans. But just 80 miles to the east, the storm was delivering an even harder blow.

title: Defining Mitt Romney
description: Gail Collins asks her fellow columnist David Brooks how Republican efforts to humanize Mitt Romney in three days is going.

title: Romney Criticized for Dry Land Remark at Campaign Event
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Mitt Romney made a comment about being on dry land Wednesday, prompting criticism that he was making light of Hurricane Isaac, which was continuing to lash the Gulf Coast.

title: Newly Released Books
description: Volumes of short fiction often masquerade in novels clothing  the easier, the thinking goes, to sell them. This month brings four books that read like story collections, though only the muscularly named Battleborn has the confidence to call itself what it is.

title: Safety Vests for the Cellphone, Some Waterproof
description: AS director of technical operations for CPR, a nationwide chain of cellphone repair shops, Edgar Navarro has seen some epic phone fiascos. Take the cellphone a customers cat used as a scratching post (bad kitty!) or the cellphone another customer placed atop sodas in an ice chest to keep it cool (bad condensation!).

title: TimesCast Politics: Christies Night
description: The Associated Press

title: Ryan Medicare Plan Is Already Shaking Up House Races
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Paul D. Ryan will take the stage at the Republican National Convention here on Wednesday to accept his partys nomination for vice president, but around the country, his plan for a sweeping remake of Medicare is shaking up Congressional campaigns, in some cases allowing Democrats to make inroads in races in which they were once seen as dead in the water.

title: A Loving Peek Into an Enchanted Land of Dreams
description: Bill Evanss wistful, lightly skipping Waltz for Debby is a classic 1950s jazz composition that doesnt really need words to conjure an evanescent childhood dream world. But its lyrics, added several years later by Gene Lees, about a little girl who will soon outgrow her dolls and clowns and a big purple bear, deepen the poignancy of a song that imagines those toys missing her once she abandons them.

title: Homeowners See Benefits in Bank Plan
description: More than 130,000 homeowners have received $10.5 billion in relief under the national settlement over foreclosure abuses, according to a preliminary report issued Wednesday by the settlement monitor.

title: At U.S. Open, Alex Waske Takes a Final Bow
description: The doubles match on Court 16 lasted exactly two hours, the last two hours of Alex Waskes 12-year career on the international mens tour.

title: Looking for Cushion Before Tough Stretch, Yankees Have a Hard Fall
description: As the Yankees head into an important 10-game stretch, it would have served them well to wrap up their final game against the last-place Toronto Blue Jays with a series-winning victory. Then they could have moved on to more significant matters, like playing their divisional rivals, with a clear conscience.

title: Transnational Mixed Teams in Lille, France
description: At the Second World Mind Sports Games in Lille, France, the Transnational Mixed Teams was for players eliminated from the main events and anyone who cared to come to compete in this picturesque town just south of the Belgian border.

title: Cloud Computing for the Poorest Countries
description: In Tuesdays article on Amazon Web Services, I wrote about lots of different data-crunching companies, mostly in the developed world.

title: Syrian migrs Seek Aid in U.S. to Arm Rebels
description: WASHINGTON  From a one-room office in an unfinished glass tower three blocks from the White House, an amorphous network of activists is doing what the Obama administration will not: attempting to arm the rebels trying to overthrow Syrias government.

title: The Hurricane and the Undocumented
description: As Hurricane Isaac continues its agonizingly slow crawl over southeast Louisiana, it is exposing one of the regrettable consequences of a broken immigration system  a shadow population of the undocumented who cant or wont seek emergency help. The authorities and immigrant advocates have learned from prior storms that fear can have a crippling effect on peoples willingness to flee a disaster zone. That is why they have urged the Department of Homeland Security not just to suspend its immigration enforcement during this emergency, but to make that policy highly public and official, so that families will not hesitate to enter public shelters or to just get in the car and go.

title: On Chris Christies Flop
description: I wrote my Campaign Stops columntoday about Ann Romneys convention speech, but I should say something about Chris Christies address, given how quickly its been branded as a solipsistic flop. There is, of course, no real way to disprove the conventional wisdom in a case like this: Nobody (to my knowledge)conducts insta-polls of the TV audiences reaction to a keynote speech, so if the chattering and political classes agree that Christie laid an egg, then thats how his remarks will be remembered. But its worth noting that the indictment against the New Jersey governor is  distinctly underwhelming. He stands accused of talking too much about himself and not enough about Mitt Romney (or maybe not enough about Barack Obama, depending on which critique you read), and generally of failing to deliver the kind of tour de force that reporters are accustomed to seeing in his YouTube clips. But as even the big Politico piece calling the speech a flop allows, the most famous keynotes Mario Cuomo in 1984 and Barack Obama in 2004 were less about touting the nominee than laying out a broader vision of what the party stood for, and that was pretty clearly what Christie was trying to do as well. And I dont think he did it all that badly. He made conservatism seem attractive, caricatured liberalism effectively, recast Romney in his own truthtelling image without mentioning of the details that might complicate that recasting, and generally came across as what he is: A tough-talking, charismatic politician, and an effective spokesman for the G.O.P.

title: The Snooker Factor
description: Kudos to William Saletan for admitting that Paul Ryan snookered him:

title: No Rest for Four Red Bulls
description: After Wednesday nights game at D.C. United, the Red Bulls will be idle in Major League Soccer until facing Columbus on Sept. 15. That respite, however, does not apply to four players who were called to their national teams.

title: Excerpt: My American Revolution
description: Part One: The Panorama of the Revolution

title: A Republican Platform Line Friendly to Immigrants
description: It was no surprise that the Republicans declared their intention to strictly crack down on illegal immigration in their platform, which was released last week.

title: Drawn Again to the Images of the Illustrator Antonio Lopez
description: Although Mr. Lopezs name may mean little today, at one time he was among the most celebrated talents in fashion.

title: Drawn to His Shining Light
description: JESSICA LANGE slipped into a booth at Le Drugstore in Paris, face bare of makeup, hair a nimbus of soft blond curls. She was not a standout beauty or, for that matter, in any apparent way exceptional. Certainly she was not as crazy pretty as Jerry Hall or as oddball gorgeous as the gaptoothed model Donna Jordan, with her shaved eyebrows and platinum bleached mane, or as startling to gaze at as the lunar Warhol superstar Jane Forth.

title: A Shelf Full of Cookbooks at Your Fingertips
description: Theres a shelf in one of my kitchen cabinets thats rarely touched. Its not empty. Some of the interesting things it holds are old; some of them are inherited. Its where we keep our recipe books.

title: Study Suggests a 7 Percent Solution for Mobile Marketing
description: A consultancy that helps marketers improve the effectiveness of their advertising spending is proposing that they significantly increase the amount of money they spend in the United States on ads on smartphones, tablets and other mobile devices.

title: These Women Dont Blush While Earning Their Rent
description: As the stars of a movie about a phone-sex line, Lauren Anne Miller and Ari Graynor quickly learned that anything could lend itself to double-entendre, even a joint telephone interview. They were, after all, sitting together on a hotel bed, tag-teaming a conversation.

title: Live Updates From the Republican National Convention
description: The Times will be providing updates and analysis from Tampa on our live dashboard. You can also follow along on Twitter @thecaucus, or follow our list of Times journalists covering the convention.

title: Future Classics of the Early Century
description: A dozen contemporary experts offer a showrooms worth of potential design classics.

title: At Her First Slam, Burdette Reaches the Third Round
description: Mallory Burdette, a 21-year-old wild card from Jackson, Ga., has advanced to the third round of her first Grand Slam singles tournament, notching a 6-2, 6-4 win over 69th-ranked Lucie Hradecka at the United States Open on Wednesday afternoon. Hradecka, who won a silver medal in womens doubles at the London Olympics, hit 13 winners, to Burdettes 21.

title: The Classics, Circa 2050
description: DESIGNED by Philippe Starck in 2002 with an eye to the 18th century, the Louis Ghost chair pays homage to French baroque style. The chair has an oval back and twisted angular arms  fancy stuff for a piece of transparent plastic furniture.

title: Leaving Home, but None of Its Comforts
description: I DONT remember everything I took with me when I went to college, but do I know it all fit easily into the back seat of our family car. The twin-size sheets were new; nearly everything else (pillow, stereo, ugly green rug) had been scavenged from home or a thrift store.

title: Works Culled From Wanderlust Find a Home
description: AS a child the sculptor Saint Clair Cemin spent two years living on a 5,000-acre property in rural Brazil, where his father, an engineer, tried and failed to grow wheat. This was in the late 1950s, when the area surrounding the small city of Cruz Alta was, he said, still known as gaucho land, as primitive as the American West in the 19th century. There was no running water or electricity on the vast spread, which belonged to his mother, so his family depended on gas lamps for light.

title: Different Worlds
description: A look at the work of the Brazilian artist Saint Clair Cemin.

title: A Dream Home Achieved in 870 Square Feet
description: In Charleston, S.C., a professional mandolin player built what he calls the Smallest Palladian Villa in the World.

title: In Charleston, a Palladian Villa, Preshrunk
description: REID BURGESS has long been enamored of Palladian architecture. As a child, he fell in love with it during a visit to Italy, and as a teenager, growing up in a Chicago suburb, he used to make elaborate drawings of villas for his high school crushes.

title: Market Ready
description: Q. We have an unused bedroom. Is it better to stage it as an office or a guest room?

title: A Late Bet on Coal May Not Pay Off
description: The Prairie State Energy Campus, a vast new coal-fired power plant and mine that is now approaching completion in downstate Illinois is likely to be one of the last of its kind in this country, given that new Environmental Protection Agency regulations bar plants that put out as much carbon dioxide as conventional coal plants. The builders, a consortium of municipal utilities and co-ops across eight states from Missouri to West Virginia, rushed to get it up and running before greenhouse rules could stop it, convinced that coal would be cheaper for the next few decades than alternative sources, like gas or nuclear.

title: Appreciating Edith Whartons Other Career
description: In 1911, her marriage in tatters, Edith Wharton sailed to Europe, where she remained for the rest of her life. Ahead were many productive years of novel writing and a Pulitzer Prize. Behind was the Mount, her country estate in western Massachusetts, to which she applied her formidable design skills.

title: Pagoda Red Moves East
description: After 15 years in Chicago, Pagoda Red has opened a showroom on the 1st Dibs floor of the New York Design Center, adding Asian flair to the predominantly midcentury modernist mix. People who arent familiar with Chinese furniture think of highly ornate lacquered pieces, but those were for export, said the owner, Betsy Nathan, of her offerings, 19th-century Chinese furniture and decorative arts as well as new work by contemporary Chinese designers. The pieces the Chinese designed and built for themselves are very simple, more reserved and more along the Ming principles.

title: Dishing Out Works of Art for a Good Cause
description: A friend of mine was visiting and her son broke a plate, Edwina von Gal recalled. But it wasnt just any plate; it was a no-longer-available limited edition one by the late Dan Flavin. Ms. von Gal is best known as a designer of gardens and outdoor spaces. Less than a year after this sad episode, she also became a plate maker. She chose six artists she knew well enough to call up and ask to design something that would look good in a circle, that could be cropped round. Teresita Fernndez, April Gornik, Mary Heilmann, Maya Lin, Richard Prince and Ed Ruscha (left) all said yes, and Lenox agreed to produce an edition of 500 sets.

title: Look Books for Design Pros
description: Beth Daugherty spent 18 years as a bookseller, the last 11 at Potterton Books, a New York store specializing in interior design and architecture titles. Now she has founded Bauer and Dean, a publishing house, and will produce titles sold at Potterton and other bookstores.

title: Crystals That Look Into the Future
description: Digital Crystal: Swarovski at the Design Museum, which runs in London Sept. 5 through Jan. 13, explores what the museums director, Deyan Sudjic, says is a crucial question facing design: the future of memory in the digital age. With the impending demise of the analog era, and the growing fragility of our connection to the tangible and the real, what happens to our photographs, diaries, letters and ephemera?

title: Sales at Casa.com, Hable Construction, Calico and Others
description: Through Sept. 3, many kitchen, bath, storage, garden and other home accessories are up to 65 percent off at Casa.com (Black+Blums lunch pot in green, regularly $22, is about $18; Kosta Bodas Mine tumbler, regularly $25, is $20); (855) 687-2272, casa.com.

title: Suspicions Cloud Citys Glossy Overhaul for National Games
description: SHENYANG, China  At a sprawling construction site here in the capital of Liaoning Province, workers fend off the August sun with towels on their heads while cranes swing above. An athletes village is taking shape, along with a light-rail line to connect it to the airport.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,090 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans recently:

title: Classy Drinks, but No Glass, at the Open
description: Behold, tennis fans, the plastic martini glass.

title: Shoppach Making Good Impression With Mets
description: PHILADELPHIA  For catcher Kelly Shoppach, the last two months of the season have been something of a feeling-out period in which the Mets will evaluate whether they would like to pursue a new deal with him this winter.

title: Progress Slow in N.H.L. Talks
description: Negotiations for a new collective bargaining agreement between the N.H.L. and the players union made incremental progress on Wednesday, but the two sides remained far apart, 17 days before the expiration of the current agreement and a promised lockout by the owners.

title: Freeh Calls for Peace in Fight Over MF Global Money
description: An MF Global trustee on Wednesday called for a global settlement in the scramble to recover money from the bankrupt brokerage firm, a bid for peace amid a bitter fight over limited resources and missing customer cash.

title: As the Republicans Make Their Pitch
description: To the Editor:

title: Five Questions for Marco Rubio
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Senator Marco Rubio of Florida will take the stage at the Republican National Convention on Thursday with a critical assignment: introduce Mitt Romney before he delivers his acceptance speech for the presidential nomination. Here are five questions from an interview on Wednesday.

title: Prosecutors Link Money From China to Iran
description: Prosecutors say they have unearthed evidence in recent international money-transfer investigations that Chinese banks may have flouted United States sanctions against Iran.

title: West Nile Deaths Rise, but Isaac Seen as Unlikely to Add to Peril
description: HOUSTON  The number of reported deaths and infections from West Nile virus in Texas, Louisiana and other parts of the country continues to rise, but federal health officials said Wednesday that they did not expect the outbreak of the mosquito-borne disease to worsen in the wake of Hurricane Isaac.

title: Kentuckians Take Distilleries to Court Over Black Gunk
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  The sooty-looking black gunk has been here for as long as anyone can remember, creeping on the outside of homes, spreading over porch furniture, blanketing car roofs, mysterious and ever-present.

title: Secret Service Agent Accidentally Leaves Gun on Romneys Plane
description: TAMPA, Fla.  A Secret Service agent was pulled off Mitt Romneys campaign plane on Wednesday after accidentally leaving her loaded handgun in the bathroom.

title: 2 Women Received $32,000 From Assemblyman, Beyond Money From State
description: ALBANY  Two women who brought sexual harassment claims against Assemblyman Vito J. Lopez this year received $32,000 from him, in addition to $103,080 in state money, according to a redacted copy of the settlement agreement obtained by The New York Times. They also received an unspecified amount of pay and benefits.

title: The Right to Vote
description: In the first episode of an Op-Docs series called Electoral Dysfunction, the political humorist Mo Rocca explores a curious fact about the U.S. Constitution: why is there no universal right to vote?

title: Pemex Finally Strikes Oil in Deep Waters
description: President Felipe Caldern of Mexico announced Wednesday that the national oil company, Pemex, had struck oil in deep water, its first success after years of exploration in the deeper reaches along the bottom of the Gulf of Mexico.

title: The Right to Vote
description: Pop quiz. Which of the following countries does not guarantee its citizens the right to vote? Is it:

title: Steve Franken, Actor in Dobie Gillis, Dies at 80
description: Steve Franken, a character actor specializing in comedy who appeared in films with Peter Sellers, Jerry Lewis and others, but was best known for playing the wealthy and snobbish Chatsworth Osborne Jr. on the hit sitcom The Many Loves of Dobie Gillis, died on Friday in Los Angeles. He was 80.

title: Augustas Policy on Women
description: To the Editor:

title: How People at the R.N.C. View Paul Ryan
description: New York Times Metro editor Carolyn Ryan talks to people about Paul Ryan at the 2012 Republican National Convention.

title: The Importance of Dads
description: To the Editor:

title: Judge to Toss Out Changes in Florida Voter Registration
description: MIAMI  A federal judge said on Wednesday that he planned to block provisions of a Florida measure that made it harder for organizations to register voters in the state.

title: At Site of Success, Clijsters Bows Out and Says Goodbye
description: Kim Clijsters did not cry. She looked around at the crowd at Arthur Ashe Stadium on Wednesday afternoon and waved goodbye to the fans who cheered her to three United States Open titles.

title: Growing Wealth, Shrinking Democracy
description: Luanda, Angola

title: Shadows and Victories Follow Trainer
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y.  Every horse he sends out is pointed to the only destination that matters: the winners circle. In a colorful and controversial training career, Richard Dutrow Jr. has delivered 1,765 of them to that promised land and racked up more than $85 million in purse earnings.

title: Women Employed by Lawmaker Describe Sexually Hostile Office
description: Five women who worked for Vito J. Lopez, the assemblyman at the center of a broadening sexual harassment scandal, described in interviews an atmosphere of sexual pressure and crude language in his office, with frequent unwanted advances by him and others, requests for provocative dress, personal questions about their boyfriends and fears of reprisals if they complained.

title: Astride the Painted Ponies of Youth, Reaching for Heaven
description: GREENPORT, N.Y.  Thursday night was Saras first night out. Not as in first night out in a while or first night out in this particular town, but first night out. Period.

title: Is the Deficit Urgent, or a Distraction?
Man Who Killed and Dismembered a Lost Boy, 8, Gets 40 Years to Life
description: A hardware store clerk who killed and dismembered an 8-year-old Brooklyn boy in 2011, stunning both the close-knit Orthodox Jewish community where they lived and the city, was sentenced Wednesday to 40 years to life in prison.

title: Marketing Wine as a Respite From Womens Many Roles
description: IN the 1970s, Miller High Life introduced the Its Miller Time campaign with commercials featuring men working at harrowing professions, like aerial firefighter pilots and high voltage wire repairmen, who joined co-workers for an after-work beer.

title: The Vacuum Behind the Slogans
description: The party that claims to have all the answers on Medicare seemed to have no interest in sharing them with the American people at its convention on Wednesday. The session, devoted to the theme of We Can Change It, never went any deeper than that slogan or a few others: Reform Medicare. Strengthen Medicare. Protect Medicare.

title: GSV Capital, Placing Bets on Start-Ups, Falters
description: Few investors have ridden the recent Internet boomlet like the GSV Capital Corporation.

title: Women Voters, Conservative Candidates
description: The Times's Carolyn Ryan talks to Sandra Mortham from the political action committee Maggie's List about women voters and conservative candidates.

title: Measuring a Convention Bounce
description: Polling generally becomes more accurate as you get closer to Election Day. The exception to the rule is in the period immediately after the party conventions, when the polls can be a wild ride.

title: Reginald Bartholomew, Busy Diplomat, Dies at 76
description: Reginald Bartholomew, a senior diplomat and ambassador who served four presidents, negotiated for nuclear disarmament with the Soviet Union and for the preservation of American military bases in Europe, and survived a bomb attack while he was ambassador to Lebanon in 1984, died on Sunday in Manhattan. He was 76.

title: Germany: Old Bomb Is Detonated
description: An intentional detonation of a 550-pound World War II bomb found in Munich set off fires late Tuesday that damaged a shop and nearby apartment buildings. About 2,500 people had been evacuated from nearby when the bomb was discovered Monday. Bomb disposal experts said it could not be defused, so a decision was made to set it off.

title: Pandora Posts a Loss but Continues to Expand
description: A year after going public, the popular Internet radio service Pandora is still expanding rapidly, with growth in audience size and revenue. But Pandora Media, the company behind it, continues to post a loss, as its revenue has not kept up with music royalties and other costs.

title: Despite Loss to Williams Sisters, Doubles Team Relishes Opportunity at U.S. Open
description: Around 9 p.m. Tuesday, Megan Moulton-Levys phone rang.

title: The Chemical Threat to America
description: SINCE Sept. 11, 2001, the American government, under two presidents, has taken unprecedented steps to ensure the safety of its citizens. Unfortunately, more than a decade later, a major flaw in our national security remains, leaving millions of Americans at risk. Its a flaw that policy makers have known about for years but not yet done enough to fix.

title: Sitting Out for Chance to Move Up
description: For those who have followed the life and career of Clint Dempsey, what may be the end of his run at Fulham will not come as a surprise. That is not to question Dempseys loyalty after playing for just two clubs in the last eight years, but his character is one of resilience and determination, of an innate desire to succeed and move higher. Which he is trying to do now, and, so far, failing to succeed.

title: Britain: Former Journalist at Murdoch Paper Arrested for Hacking
description: A former journalist with Rupert Murdochs Times of London newspaper was arrested Wednesday on suspicion of computer hacking during his time there, Scotland Yard said in a statement. The man, whom the British news media identified as Patrick Foster, was questioned about alleged computer hacking relating to the identification of a previously anonymous blogger in 2009, the statement said. It said he was also suspected of obstructing justice.

title: Kenya: Officers Hurt by Grenade
description: Seven Kenyan police officers were wounded, some critically, late Wednesday in the second grenade attack in two days in the port city of Mombasa, the police said. The city has been racked with protests by Muslim youths this week over the killing of a radical cleric. A criminal investigations officer, Ambrose Munyasia, said two unidentified attackers had hurled the grenade at the police officers as they prepared to head out on patrol.

title: Mark Leibovich on the Candidates
description: Mark Leibovich talks about the human side of the Republican candidates.

title: In College Town, Obama Jokes at G.O.P.s Expense
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va.  President Obama on Wednesday provided counterprogramming for a second day to the Republican National Convention, mocking its proceedings and contrasting his agenda with what he called the backward positions of Mitt Romney.

title: Book on Bin Laden Killing Contradicts U.S. Account
description: WASHINGTON  A new first-person account of the Navy SEALs raid that killed Osama bin Laden in Pakistan last year contradicts the Obama administrations previous descriptions of the mission, raising questions about whether the leader of Al Qaeda posed a clear threat to the commandos who fired on him.

title: Lottery Numbers
Amid Tournaments Chaos, an Oasis for Players
description: Tucked into a far corner of the United States Open grounds, away from the autograph hounds clustered by the practice courts, away from the plaza filled with television sets and thousands of fans, there is a lawn. A small, worn, crowded, sun-kissed lawn. But, still, a lawn.

title: Haas Fails to Roll Back the Years
description: Tommy Haas, who surged back into the top 20 of the ATP World Tour rankings this season at 34, played in his 15th United States Open on Wednesday. He was seeded 21st.

title: A Night of Problems and Fixes While Keeping an Eye on a Storm
description: NEW ORLEANS  The room went from relaxed to tense in an instant.

title: Judge Criticizes M.T.A.s Delay in Ad Case
description: Most people who get frustrated at delays caused by the Metropolitan Transportation Authority have little recourse, other than to suffer quietly.

title: Discriminatory Purpose in Texas
description: Hispanic and black voters in Texas were vindicated on Tuesday when a federal three-judge panel rejected the states new redistricting plans for Congressional and state legislative seats. A panel of the United States District Court in the District of Columbia properly found that the maps, based on the 2010 census, had a discriminatory purpose and effect in reducing the ability of minority voters to elect candidates they favor.

title: Precise Foreign Policy Intentions Can Be Tough to Gauge
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Bill Clinton said he would crack down on China. George W. Bush said he would stay away from nation building. Barack Obama said he would restore civil liberties in the war on terror and sit down with rogue leaders.

title: Public Role in Species Protection
description: One of the virtues of the Endangered Species Act is its openness to citizen participation. The Fish and Wildlife Service can designate likely species for federal protection. But ordinary citizens and nongovernmental organizations can petition to have candidates of their own choosing considered for protection. Not everyone thinks this is a virtue. The enemies of the Endangered Species Act are legion, especially in the House of Representatives, and one of their major complaints has always been citizen petitions, which they claim are politically motivated and expensive, especially when they include litigation.

title: Pirates Seek to Swap Hope for Belief
description: PITTSBURGH  Janice Martell directed an early-morning visitor Tuesday to a popular site at the hilly Jefferson Memorial Cemetery here: the grave of Honus Wagner, a shortstop who won eight National League batting titles and, in 1909, led the Pirates to their first World Series championship.

title: Chicago Teachers Give Notice of Possible Deadline for Strike
description: CHICAGO  As parents here prepare to send their children back to school next week, the union representing Chicago Public Schools teachers gave a 10-day notice on Wednesday of its intent to strike, the next legal step in a series of maneuvers amid continuing contract bargaining with the city.

title: 2012: Rubio on the Future of the G.O.P.
description: Jeff Zeleny in conversation with Foridas Senator Marco Rubio on the future of the Republican party.

title: Some Neighbors of the Nets Worry About Drinking Hours That Last Longer Than the Game
description: The moment comes during the seventh inning of a Yankees game, immediately after halftime at MetLife Stadium and, for Knicks fans, after the third quarter. For many patrons sitting in the stands and bleachers, drinks stop flowing.

title: Kvitova Finding Success in North America
description: The summer of 2012 has been quite a season for Petra Kvitova. Long a successful player abroad  Wimbledon and WTA Championships titles in 2011  she has struggled in North America, compiling an 11-22 record outdoors.

title: A Politician Walks Into a Bar
description: Very few politicians can tell jokes. Ronald Reagan was among the very rare exceptions, and Sarah Palin manages a zinger now and then. Even fewer politicians can laugh sincerely on stage. And yet at national conventions, politicians who previously exhibited no known sense of humor suddenly feel the need to deliver standup routines.

title: Mumbai Attack Sites
description: Coordinated terror attacks struck the heart of Mumbai, Indias commercial capital, killing more than 100 in assaults on multiple locations in the city.

title: Will They Decipher the Cipher?
description: TAMPA, Fla.

title: On Night for Backups, Nicks Returns to Action
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  With its full-price tickets and undiminished parking fees, an N.F.L. teams final preseason game surely remains one of the greatest magic tricks in all of sports. It looks like a real game, sounds like a real game and absolutely costs the same as a real game, yet for most spectators the preseason finale ultimately packs all the reward of going to a Broadway show on the day the understudy takes the stage.

title: Renovating Mitt Romney
description: TAMPA, Fla.

title: A Crowd-Pleasing Game, and Story
description: Brian Baker may have the best all-around game in United States mens tennis. You know Brian Baker, although you probably dont remember him from his last United States Open appearance  seven years ago (he lost in the second round). Hes the feel-good story of the 2012 pro tour.

title: Things I Saw  No. 29
description: Suggestions for what youd like Jason to see and draw may be sent to thingsisaw@nytimes.com.

title: John McCain's Speech at the R.N.C.
description: John McCain focused his speech at the Republican National Convention on foreign policy.

title: Fighting to Have the Last Word
description: Whos telling this story anyway? Youve heard that question, uttered impatiently or perhaps even furiously, by one half of a couple to the other in midanecdote. We all mythologize our lives, and most of us fight to ensure our version stands as the official one, even  no, make that especially  when the alternative view comes from the person whos closest to us.

title: First of Its Kind
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  Be very careful when writing in your grid today. You know how fragile eggs can be.

title: Corrections: August 30, 2012
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Estimating the Cost of a Nonnuclear Japan
description: Closing Japans 50 nuclear power plants would result in insolvency for some of the countrys leading electric power utilities.

title: Convention Voices Hope to Add Texture to Romneys Faith
description: After years of largely resisting public discussion of his Mormon faith, Mitt Romney will embrace it on Thursday night when the Republican convention will stage a carefully chosen tableau of speakers who are expected to offer accounts of the candidate as a man of compassion, character and deep beliefs.

title: Do Americans Have the Right to Vote?
description: The humorist Mo Rocca tells Op-Ed columnist Bill Keller that the American electoral system is enough to make him cry.

title: From Sibling Rivalry to Protective Brother, Scott Romney Stands by Mitt
description: Sitting in the sun-filled lobby of the Marriott hotel, Scott Romney paused to reflect how his father, George, the former governor of Michigan, would feel about his son taking the stage as the Republican nominee for president.

title: Abortion Will Stay Legal, Romneys Sister Predicts
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Mitt Romneys sister promised that a ban on abortion was never going to happen under her brothers presidency, a reassurance to women that is at odds with the nominees stated position on the issue.

title: For a Game, a Share of the Spotlight
description: FLORHAM PARK. N.J.  Forty-six Jets lined up for calisthenics before practice Wednesday, and Mark Sanchez and Tim Tebow were not among them. Neither were 17 other front-line players who also were invited to a six-hour leadership seminar.

title: A Plagiarists Rant Against Birth Control
description: WHILE anatomically illiterate politicians in America babble about legitimate rape, a Filipino legislator opposed to birth control has been shedding crocodile tears in Parliament and plagiarizing speeches to bolster the case against reproductive rights.

title: Trying to Imagine a World Without Men
description: To the Editor:

title: Most Regions Experienced Modest Growth
description: A roundup of regional economic conditions in the Federal Reserves 12 districts, according to survey results released by the Fed on Wednesday. The survey is based on information collected on or before Aug. 20.

title: Rousing G.O.P., Ryan Faults Missing Leadership
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Representative Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin, whose budget plans have come to define conservative opposition to President Obamas governing philosophy, accepted the Republican vice-presidential nomination on Wednesday as his party embraced the gamble that the small-government principles he represents have more political payoff than peril.

title: Harvey Continues to Be Bright Spot for Mets
description: PHILADELPHIA  The hope is, one day, preferably in the not-too-distant future, Matt Harvey will be standing on the mound at Citizens Bank Park, wearing a Mets uniform, and pitching a contest of some significance.

title: Carl Hulse on Paul Ryan
description: Rick Berke and Carl Hulse discuss how Representative Paul D. Ryan is progressing as a candidate.

title: Results of Primary Elections Feed Arizona Democrats Hope
description: PHOENIX  Representative Ben Quayles loss on Tuesday in a tough and expensive battle for the Republican nomination in a newly drawn Congressional district made uncertain the political future of a young conservative whose well-known family name was at once an asset and a liability on the campaign trail.

title: For Hewitt, Shadows Get Longer, but the Big Stadium Still Beckons
description: On a jam-packed and cozy Court 13, with Arthur Ashe Stadium looming large as a backdrop, Lleyton Hewitt appeared to a warm early-afternoon ovation before his four-set victory over Tobias Kamke of Germany. It was affection for a fading veteran that he had never quite earned in New York as a champion.

title: Ryan Speech Equal Parts Biography, Policy and Contrast
description: Paul D. Ryan offered a mix of folksy charm, family biography and biting criticism of President Obamas administration, earning huge applause from the delegates gathered in the convention hall on Wednesday.

title: Reports of Storm Damage
description: Strong winds and rain from Hurricane Isaac battered cities in Louisiana and Mississippi, with some streets in New Orleans under several feet of water.

title: Anatomy of a Speech: Republican National Convention
description: The Timess political unit is breaking down some key speeches from the Republican National Convention, checking them for accuracy and adding context.

title: Red Bulls Rally and Tie D.C. United
description: Defender Wilman Conde scored his first goal of the season, on a long shot to the upper-right corner in the 88th minute, as the Red Bulls rallied for a 2-2 tie with D.C. United on Wednesday night in Washington.

title: Condis World
description: TAMPA, Fla.

title: In Conversation With: Prosecutor Gopal Subramanium
description: Indias highest court on Wednesday upheld the death penalty for Ajmal Kasab, the sole survivor among a group of militants who attacked Mumbai in 2008. Mr. Kasab, a Pakistani, confessed to the attacks and asked to be hanged while in custody. He later retracted his confession, saying he was framed by the police. Judges said the conspiracy behind the attack was vicious, the trauma and loss of life caused by the attacks made them the the rarest of the rare since the birth of India and the attackers attempt to pass off as Indian Muslims was ominous and distressing. (Read the full judgment here.)

title: Defeat, Introspection, Reinvention, Nomination
description: BOSTON  Not long after Mitt Romney dropped out of the presidential race in early 2008, a titan of New York finance, Julian H. Robertson, flew to Utah to deliver an eye-popping offer.

title: Tim Pawlenty's Speech at the R.N.C.
description: Tim Pawlenty attacked President Obama's tenure in his speech at the Republican National Convention in Tampa.

title: Condoleezza Rice's R.N.C. Speech
description: Former Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice speaks at the 2012 Republican National Convention.

title: Life, Interrupted: Five Days of Chemo
description: Day 1

title: Giving a Child a New Heart
description: Once I get that call, everything changes. I might be out with my children, at the movies with my wife, or perhaps sleeping when the call comes: There is a donor for one of our patients on the pediatric cardiac transplant waiting list.

title: Word of the Day | discordant
description: discordant \dis-kr-dnt\ adjective

title: Powell Was More Skeptical About Iraq Than Previously Thought, Annan Says
description: Colin L. Powell, who as secretary of state famously made the case for war against Iraq in 2003 with an impassioned speech at the United Nations Security Council, was more skeptical about the evidence he used to justify the American-led invasion than previously known, according to a new memoir by Kofi Annan, the secretary general at the time.

title: U.S. Open: Day 3
description: Action from the second round at the United States Open, including victories by Victoria Azarenka and Andy Murray.

title: In India, Businesses Named After Hitler Defend Their Decision
description: Whats wrong with naming your business after Adolf Hitler?

title: Clinton to Visit China Amid Diplomatic Storms
description: HONG KONG  As U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton prepared to leave Thursday for a visit to Asia, Chinas state-run news agency Xinhua published a commentary saying Washington has resorted to diplomatic, economic and strategic means, which Clinton has dubbed smart power, to create disturbances in the Asia-Pacific region.

title: Charges Filed in Bronx Street Vendor Killing
description: One of two shooting victims in a dispute among street vendors near Yankee Stadium last week died Saturday, and murder charges have been filed against the accused gunman, the police said Wednesday.

title: 5 Australian Soldiers Die in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Five Australian soldiers were killed in southern Afghanistan within hours of one another on Wednesday and Thursday, three of them at the hands of a turncoat Afghan soldier, making it the deadliest period in a decade of fighting here for one of the United States staunchest allies.

title: Wooden, but Wishful
description: Pinocchio wants to be a real person, and on Thursday night hes going to attempt to make the transformation on national television.

title: Scores Missing After Australia-Bound Refugee Boat Reports Distress
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Ninety or more people remained missing Thursday after a boat carrying about 150 migrants sank off Indonesia, in another disaster this year for asylum seekers from the Middle East and Asia trying to reach Australia by sea.

title: Man, 74, Opens Fire at Staten Island Bowling Alley
description: A 74-year-old man opened fire on his wife as she prepared to start work at a Staten Island bowling alley on Wednesday morning, the police said. No one was hurt.

title: Conversations With Andy Murray: A Fantasy Trophy to Go With the Rest of His Hardware
description: Andy Murray battered Ivan Dodig of Croatia at the United States Open late Wednesday, the final score a lopsided 6-2, 6-1, 6-3. It took Murray roughly the same amount of time to conduct his regular postmatch interview with Straight Sets, in which he talked about his passion for fantasy sports. And by fantasy football, he did not mean N.F.L.

title: Where Will Literature Go From Here?
description: Considering the views and the hair color of the 50 writers who had assembled for a quaint conference in Edinburgh, the congregation could have been called 50 Shades of Grey,' Manu Joseph wrote in The International Herald Tribune. But most of the writers agreed, at the World Writers Conference, that they were repulsed by the lowbrow book that has probably outsold all their works put together, he wrote.

title: Paul Ryan's R.N.C. Speech
description: Republican Vice Presidential nominee Paul Ryan speaks at the 2012 Republican National Convention.

title: News Quiz | August 30, 2012
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays paper. Good luck!

title: Pictures of the Day From Wednesday | August 29, 2012
description: Representative Paul D. Ryan takes the stage.

title: Illustrating the Tweets of the R.N.C.
description: Day 3 of Christoph Niemanns live drawing from the Republican National Convention.

title: Veterans and the Caucus
description: Toma Tarantino discusses the role of veterans in the 2012 electoral campaign.

title: Bob McDonnell Interview
description: Michael D. Shear spoke with Gov. Bob McDonnell of Virginia, discussing Paul Ryans speech and Virginias state of play in the 2012 presidential election.

title: Summit Meeting in Iran Disrupted by Rebukes of Syria
description: TEHRAN  Irans triumphal stewardship of the Nonaligned Movement summit meeting here veered off script on Thursday when the two most prominently featured guest speakers  President Mohamed Morsi of Egypt and the United Nations secretary general, Ban Ki-moon  denounced the repression of the armed uprising in Syria, a close Iranian ally.

title: Fighting the Whiskey Fungus
description: Melena Ryzik talks to residents around Louisville, Ky., who filed a lawsuit to stem the growth of a black mold that was recently linked to whiskey production.

title: In Kerala, Feasting, Splurging and Mollywood Usher in Onam
description: Visiting Kerala this week is like visiting New York during Christmas week, except for the scale. Both places have the festive atmosphere, illumination, feasting everywhere, high alcoholic consumption and crass commercialization, including a grand shopping festival. None of these have anything to do with the traditional Onam festival, but care is taken to do all these in the name of Mahabali, the legendary ruler of prehistoric times. His majestic and well-fed figure juts out of every hoarding like Santa Claus in the West.

title: Aug. 29: So Much Depends Upon Ohio
description: Polls that are published during the party conventions can be anticlimactic, representing old news since they wont fully reflect the effects of the convention bounce. And none of the surveys that came out on Wednesday were that newsworthy to begin with  although there was one, in Ohio, that had encouraging news for Barack Obama, and another, in Nevada, that was slightly favorable for Mitt Romney.

title: Test Yourself | English, Aug. 30, 2012
description: The question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the article A Very Long Journey Was Very Swift.

title: Why Are the Big Banks Suddenly Afraid?
description: Simon Johnson is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: A Fresh Take on the Oldest Profession
description: With sweaty palms, a heavy step and a stutter, Marc McAndrews entered a brothel in Elko, Nev., without much of a pitch or a plan. Facing the line of half-naked sex workers, he had to choose one and pose a question that made him blush.

title: Gangs Truce in El Salvador
description: WHO is Carlos Tiberio Valladares?

title: Beyond Antarcticas Photo Opportunity
description: Alexander Kumar, a physician and researcher at Concordia Station, writes from Antarctica, where he conducts scientific experiments for the European Space Agencys human spaceflight program.

title: Houston Texans, 2012 N.F.L. Season Preview
description: Andy Benoit completes his look at the A.F.C. South with an analysis of the Texans. He picks them to win.

title: What to Watch on Thursday
description: Its hard to know exactly what happened in Mondays match between Jack Sock and Florian Mayer. Given Socks youth (hell be 20 next month), inexperience and mid-200s ranking, beating the No. 22 seed and Wimbledon quarterfinalist here was a monumental upset by any definition.

title: From the Magazine: Day 3 of Illustrations From the R.N.C.
description: Christoph Niemann is in Tampa this week, where he is live illustrating posts on Twitter relating to the Republican National Convention.

title: Barclays Picks One of Its Own as Chief
description: 8:27 p.m. | Updated Barclays, which has been tarnished by scandal, appointed a new chief executive on Thursday, as the British bank looks to restore its reputation and overhaul its culture.

title: BRICS in Space
description: DELHI  Lets send a mission to Mars, Prime Minister Manmohan Singh announced a couple of weeks ago, just as his government was fending off corruption charges and the country was still recovering from the biggest blackout since the invention of electricity.

title: Tip of the Week: Learning About Your Browser
description: The wrench icon in the Google Chrome toolbar offers a menu of settings you can use to control and adjust how the browser looks and behaves. Chrome can also reveal more information on its internal pages with a series of commands typed directly into the address/search box (also known as the omnibox). While many of these commands are designed for programmers looking to debug Web-page code, some are helpful for quickly seeing what plug-ins and extensions are installed, or to see the browsers bookmarks list.

title: Finding the Divine in Madrids Red-Light District
description: Contemporary cooking in Spain is polarized in an odd way, from the avant-garde cuisine on the one hand and the wonderful men del dia joints on the other. The center  talented chefs who are not necessarily trying to reinvent cuisine  is somewhat difficult to find.

title: Who Wears the Pants in This Economy?
description: Patsy Praters office looks like something between an executives and a teachers, her large desk crowded with neat piles of grant applications and daily logs but also with dishes of candy and other freebies for the young and old who pass through. On the bulletin board behind her head are big, colorful signs designed to remind her public-housing clients of what they are eligible for: cellphones, computer classes or prescriptions that she makes sure they have even if she has to drive them to the pharmacy herself. At the front of her desk is a photo of her grandbaby, who lives in Madison, Ala., three hours away. She wishes she could be there, taking care of the infant now that her daughter is back at work. I love this job, she said. I know its where Im supposed to be. But I am not a womens-rights-type person. My place is in the home, and Im fine with that, so long as my husband is earning the bacon. Course, that hasnt been happening so much lately.

title: Pitching an Organic Cigarette for Hipsters
description: In my last post, I reviewed a company focused on helping students find their passions. This week, I review a pitch for a product that may seem a bit contradictory in nature  an organic cigarette.

title: Wibbly-wobbly
description: It wasnt the biggest thing in Paul Ryans speech, but many people are wondering why Ryan keeps using the closed Janesville GM plant to illustrate the failure of Obamas policy  when the plant actually closed under George W. Bush.

title: Rain From Isaac Puts Wide Area at Risk
description: BATON ROUGE, La.  Tropical Depression Isaac, weakening from tropical storm status as it made its way across land, continued to cause problems across Louisiana and Mississippi on Thursday.

title: European Conservatives Steer Clear of Romney
description: LONDON  It is just as well for Mitt Romney that Europeans dont have a vote in Novembers presidential election.

title: Carlyle to Acquire DuPont Coatings Unit for $4.9 Billion
description: The private equity firm the Carlyle Group has agreed to buy DuPont Performance Coatings, a maker of automotive paints and related products, for $4.9 billion as it continues its drumbeat of acquisitions.

title: Nine Killed in Midair Collision of Air Force Choppers
description: Two Indian Air Force helicopters collided midair during a training exercise in western Gujarat on Thursday, killing all nine people on board.

title: Life Sends Lemons? Make Comedy
description: ABOUT 15 minutes into his stand-up set in his film Laugh at My Pain, following bits about his inability to spend money as lavishly as his athlete friends and the strange performer he hired to play SpongeBob SquarePants at his daughters birthday party, Kevin Hart pivots to a routine about his fathers cocaine addiction.

title: Morning Take-Out
description: Barclays Names C.E.O. Amid Tumult | Barclays has appointed Antony Jenkins, head of the retail and business banking unit, to be its new chief executive, as the British bank deals with fallout from an interest-rate manipulation scandal and other legal issues.

title: Thursday Reading: Severe Diet May Not Prolong Life
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and on our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: Opinion Report: Vouchers
description: From the editorial page

title: A Poem for the End of Summer
description: Dear Diary:

title: Edible Selby | French Laundry
description: Everything starts out raw and goes straight on the tart, says Julianne Jones, explaining why her pastries have gained a cult following. At Vergennes Laundry, the bakery Jones opened in 2010 with her French husband, Didier Murat, in a former laundromat in Vergennes, Vt., all tarts are made to order with the freshest seasonal ingredients. Summer brings berries or tomatoes; the spring months asparagus with goat cheese and mint. In fall and winter its Gilfeather turnips, potatoes, rosemary and crme frache. Jones wont use glaze, and she insists on an open kitchen. I prefer that somebody can see the tart as Im making it, she says. They see the bag of potatoes or the crate of berries. They see the wheel of cheese. Though Jones and Murat are also renowned for their slow-rise bread and nougat, a few locals have yet to register the boulangerie. We still have people come in with their laundry bags from time to time, Murat says. More

title: Daily Report: A Misplaced Bet on Facebook
description: Few investors have ridden the recent Internet boomlet like the GSV Capital Corporation, Randall Smith reports for DealBook.
