After GSV announced in June 2011 that it was buying a stake in the privately held Facebook, the closed-end mutual fund surged 42 percent that day. Capitalizing on the euphoria, GSV sold another $247 million of its shares, using the money to expand its portfolio of hot start-ups like Groupon and Zynga.

title: Saying Its Time to Move On, Yale President Will Retire
description: Richard C. Levin, who has directed a vast expansion and modernization of Yale University while improving university finances and relations with the city of New Haven, announced on Thursday that he would retire as president at the end of the school year, after 20 years. Dr. Levin is currently the most senior president in the Ivy League and one of the longest-serving in Yales history. The university is expected to undertake a nationwide search for a successor, who will take the helm next summer at an elite institution with a global reputation and a $3 billion annual operating budget.

title: A 12-Year View of the Global Pulse of Fire
description: A recent reader comment about this years season of heat and wildfire in Siberia prompted me to scan NASA Web pages for relevant data and images. I found this fascinating 12-year animation showing the annual shifts in frequency and distribution of fires  both wild and human-set  around the planet. Heres some of the space agencys explainer, with a link to the rest:

title: Biking in Vermont, Body Armor Optional
description: IT was an idyllic Vermont view from halfway up Burke Mountain. A patchwork of forest and pasture rolled westward to a distant mountain ridge. Puffy white clouds hung in a blue sky. But I was focused on a brown ribbon that plunged down the slope like a dirt bobsled track, nervously clenching the handlebars of a hulking bicycle that resembled a motocross motorcycle.

title: Twin Rock Dreams Prevail
description: ON YouTube theres a brief documentary, made six years ago, about a teenage rock band in Alabama called the Ackleys. Its a four-piece, anchored by an irrepressible set of apple-cheeked female twins, Allison and Katie Crutchfield. Seventeen years old, they name-check Fugazi, Guided By Voices and the Velvet Underground as influences and are shown playing accomplished, jangly indie rock in graffitied warehouse spaces.

title: At Political Conventions, Stay Tuned for the Archbishop
description: For the politically minded, the focus Thursday night will be on Mitt Romneys acceptance speech at the Republican National Convention. But you may want to keep watching even after Mr. Romney is done and the last balloon has dropped.

title: What Were Reading
description: Eater: After 28 years at the helm of Gotham Bar and Grill, Alfred Portale hints that he has plans to open other places, and laments that todays restaurant critics tend to focus on a single facet: Now you can see restaurant reviews where it can be that the food is wonderful but everything else is lacking.  Patrick Farrell

title: What Will It Take?
description: Two years ago, at a Washington symposium observing the 40th anniversary of the Clean Air Act, much of the discussion centered around the use of the landmark pollution law to try to address a problem its authors never anticipated  climate change caused by increasing concentrations of carbon dioxide and other heat-trapping gases in the atmosphere.

title: ... And in Eternal Stagecraft
description: Size mattered  really mattered  to Stella Adler. Make it big, she would say again and again to her students in the dramatic arts, whom she spent four decades training to be giants. Be as large as the stage is, she said. Dont be afraid of the size. You need it as actors  we need it in America.

title: When to Brief the Teacher, and When to Bite Your Tongue
description: Is your child left-handed? Left-brained? Sensitive to feeling left out? And to the extent you know that these things impact her schoolwork, how much of a heads-up will you give her teachers before or around the first day of school?

title: Contested Will Delays Burial of Jeffersons Star Sherman Hemsley
description: More than a month after his death, the Jeffersons star Sherman Hemsley has not yet been buried. His embalmed body remains refrigerated at a funeral home in El Paso while a dispute over his will is resolved, The Associated Press reported.

title: Junot Daz: By the Book
description: As a child, the author of the new story collection This Is How You Lose Her loved the unabashedly smart Encyclopedia Brown. Smart was not cool where I grew up.

title: Fact-Checking Ryans Convention Speech
description: Interactive Feature: Anatomy of a Speech: Republican National Convention

title: Eugene Mirman Comedy Festival Sets Lineup
description: Brooklyn comedy is bustling. The Brooklyn Academy of Music recently started a stand-up series. Spaces like Littlefield and the Knitting Factory in Williamsburg have become reliable homes for great comedy. And Louis C.K. has made a habit of working out early versions of his annual stand-up specials at the Bell House. But the anchor of the Brooklyn scene is probably Eugene Mirman, the comic who runs a weekly Sunday show at Union Hall (where much of Mike Birbiglias movie Sleepwalk With Me was set) and curates and hosts the Eugene Mirman Comedy Festival. This freewheeling, talent-packed event has none of the stuffy air of more established festivals. It takes place Sept. 13-16 at the Bell House and Union Hall. Veteran comedians like Jon Glaser, Todd Barry and Sarah Silverman will appear. So will young, emerging comics like Michael Che and Brent Sullivan. You can also expect some special guests. The events include a Saturday show titled Uh Oh: Dangerous, Inappropriate Comedy for Teenagers and a film festival of short films on Sunday.

title: Deflating Inflation
description: BUENOS AIRES  Every month, when the official statistics agency INDEC releases estimates for inflation, the Argentine government lies to its people. Everyone knows the figures fall far short of reality, which is that Argentina has one of the worlds highest rates of inflation. INDECs July figure brought 12-month inflation to 9.9 percent, well below the 24.1 percent estimated by private analysts.

title: Business Day Live | August 30, 2012
description: California tests its carbon emissions cap-and-trade program. | The best shoes for travel? Ask a flight attendant.

title: Painted on the Walls, the Stories of New York Communities
description: A passing security guard stopped and did a double take. So did some young mothers with strollers. Murals have always been intended to awe, instruct and inspire, and the enormous image of an outspread hand slowly creeping up a naked brick wall at 512 Rockaway Avenue in Brownsville, Brooklyn, was no exception.

title: The Sweetness of Figs, the Crunch of Toast
description: Crostini is one of my favorite things to make during fig season, especially with fruit from my backyard tree (for more about fig trees in Brooklyn, you can check out my column). I love the way the crunch of the toast echoes the fig seeds.

title: Employers That Forbid You From Telling Others What You Make
description: I was surprised earlier this month when I tuned in to a Marketplace report that noted that there are employers that contractually forbid employees from telling anyone how much money they make.

title: G.O.P. Platform Seeks to Weaken Powers of Unions
description: Unlike in the past, this years Republican platform in Tampa, Fla., does not contain any sympathetic nods to the nations labor unions, which have become among the Republicans most formidable political foes. Instead, the platform calls for numerous steps that could significantly weaken Americas labor unions  public-sector and private-sector ones  and help speed organized labors overall decline.

title: Election Unit, Part 3: The Campaign Strategy
description: This week is Election Week on our blog, and each day weve published a new section of our Election Unit.

title: Site to Be Seen | Bureau of Trade
description: Michael Moskowitz is on a mission to abolish what he calls the meaningless materialist. It may sound a bit peculiar coming from a merchant, but Moskowitz maintains that his recently launched e-commerce site Bureau of Trade is replete with goods meant to provoke more than the pocketbook. Items in the Bureaus wide-ranging collections are eminently valuable for a lifetime, he explains, Your progeny will be sitting around the dinner table  arms crossed  waiting for you to pass away, so they can get their hands on them.

title: Isaac Weakens, Leaving Behind Flooding in New Orleans
description: The storms once fierce winds slowed to 40 miles an hour on Thursday as it moved out of southern Louisiana and headed north, continuing to bring heavy rains and flooding.

title: Buffett Celebrates His 82nd Birthday
description: How does the second-richest man in America celebrate his birthday? By giving other people presents.

title: A War on Women?
description: Op-Ed columnists Frank Bruni and Gail Collins talk to voters from around the country and across the ideological spectrum about topics central to the presidential race

title: Venezuela to Investigate Report That Brazilian Miners Massacred Indian Village
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  The authorities in Venezuela said Wednesday that they would investigate claims that illegal Brazilian gold miners massacred a village of Yanomami Indians deep in the Amazon jungle.

title: Red Bull Racing: 190 M.P.H. in the Lincoln Tunnel, Among Other Amusements
description: With its president having stepped down and Bernie Ecclestone, the president of Formula One, having expressed doubts that the race would go forward on schedule, the Grand Prix of America has experienced no shortage of tumult this summer.

title: Business Day Live: California Tests a Plan to Cut Emissions
description: California tests its carbon emissions cap-and-trade program. | The best shoes for travel? Ask a flight attendant.

title: Image of the Day: August 30
Republican Women Seek to Play Down Social Issues
description: TAMPA, Fla.  About a block from the Republican National Convention, in a strip mall next to a Hooters restaurant, is the Woman Up! Pavilion, sponsored by the Young Guns Network, a super PAC promoting conservative candidates.

title: David Bowie Denies Involvement in British Exhibition of His Clothing
description: As if it werent bad enough that his song Life on Mars was not, in fact, the first song broadcast from Mars, David Bowie has briefly resurfaced on Earth to say that he is not involved in a coming exhibition of his fashion and costumes at the Victoria and Albert Museum in London.

title: Style Coalition Introduces Online Video Channel
description: First came the bloggers, then came the blogger agents, alliances and partnerships. Now, stay tuned for blogger programming. Just before New York Fashion Week, the Style Coalition, one of the leading blogger networks focused on helping bloggers monetize their work, will introduce Style Coalition TV, also called SCTV.

title: Paul Backers Aided Disruption of Ryans Speech
description: The womens antiwar group CodePink was behind the disruption of Representative Paul D. Ryans speech on Wednesday night, but it was in part a product of the Romney campaigns continuing dispute with Ron Paul supporters.

title: Is This Thing On? Yahoo Firing Proves the Perils of Feeding Many Platforms
description: David Chalian, the Washington bureau chief of Yahoo News, was fired in record time on Wednesday after he was overheard on a hot mic making a remark about Mitt Romney and his wife not caring about the African-American victims of Hurricane Isaac. The comment came during a webcast at the Republican National Convention in Tampa, Fla., where Yahoo is partnered with ABC News.

title: On the West Side, Marking the Path of a Conga Line of Rats
description: If rats could read, they would now know where to cross West 76th Street.

title: Hall of Fame for Great Americans, 3:57 P.M. Wednesday
A New Rolling Stone Documentary Is Announced
description: A new documentary about the Rolling Stones, which chronicles their early years and their rise to stardom, will debut on HBO in the United States on Nov. 15, as part of the bands 50th anniversary celebration, the network announced on Thursday. The film, Crossfire Hurricane, was directed by Brett Morgen, the documentary filmmaker known for films like The Kid Stays in the Picture and Chicago 10.

title: I.O.U., and U., and U.
description: One cold day last November, Amy and I came home from work to a sickish young daughter and started to toy with just staying in for the night. Problem was, we had these tickets to see Miranda July, the performance artist, being interviewed by someone over at the Herbst Theater. Two tickets, $50 sunk into the situation. We hemmed and hawed, one of us made pasta, and finally I put a last-minute, Hail Mary ad on Craigslist. It was 7, and the event started at 8. No way. But five minutes later I had an e-mail from a guy named Joe. I picked up the phone.

title: Why Are Some City Restaurants Exempt From Letter Grades?
description: Chefs Table at Brooklyn Fare, the eccentric 18-seat restaurant in downtown Brooklyn, has just about everything its customers could want, except more seats. The boroughs only three-star Michelin restaurant (one of seven in the city) has a three-star review from The New York Times and attracts a devoted clientele that reserves six weeks ahead.

title: Reckoning in Irish Court for a Tycoon in Disgrace
description: DERRYLIN, Northern Ireland  It is only a short distance, but a vast world apart. The stately brick-and-glass headquarters that was once Sean Quinns realm is only a six-minute drive from the cinder block bunker where Mr. Quinn, a bankrupt former billionaire, is now making what could be his last stand.

title: Romney Will Argue Obama Has Failed to Meet Promises
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Mitt Romney will call upon disappointed and disaffected Americans to turn President Obama out of office in November, arguing in his convention speech that the president has failed to deliver the hope that he promised four years ago.

title: Kids Draw the News: Peacock on the Loose
description: New Assignment

title: Beyond Factual Dishonesty
description: TAMPA, Fla.An army of fact-checkers swarmed around Paul Ryans acceptance speech last night, and the verdict was swift and unanimous: lies, omissions, a sweeping rewrite of recent history. But theres one question no checker can answer: Why was it necessary to lie in the first place?

title: Sure Beats Bunking in a Barn
description: IN the 1950 movie musical Summer Stock Judy Garland plays a farm owner who lets a young acting company rehearse in her barn in exchange for doing chores. As enthusiastic as the troupe might have been to sleep country style, these days the farm might be in hot water with Actors Equity Association. The union has negotiated rules about what accommodations its members are entitled to when they work out of town.

title: Yale University President Is Stepping Down
description: After 20 years at the helm, Richard C. Levin, the president of Yale University, announced on Thursday that he will be leaving the Ivy League school at the end of the academic year, our colleague Richard Prez-Pea reports:

title: A Third Option for Regulators in the Money Market Fund Fight
description: The biggest battles are sometimes decided by the most arcane tactics.

title: Papers of a Puerto Rican Poet Will Find a Home at Columbia
description: In 1996, Jack Ageros, a Puerto Rican author and advocate who wrote sonnets about poor immigrants and Latino street life, would have seemed an unlikely candidate for inclusion in the library of New York Citys most prestigious university.

title: Definition of Storms by Category Is Questioned
description: NEW ORLEANS  Why were people in Plaquemines Parish and other coastal areas of Louisiana and Mississippi so blas about Hurricane Isaac? The answer could have something to do with the yardstick most commonly used to measure storms.

title: Wheelies: The Fly-in-the-Ointment Edition
description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: Gym, Tan, Later: MTV Ending Jersey Shore
description: The fists will continue to pump and the spray-on tans will continue to be applied in Seaside Heights, N.J. But the reality-TV adventures of Snooki, JWoww, the Situation and their fellow beach-side revelers will soon be no more: MTV said on Thursday that the coming season of Jersey Shore will be its last.

title: An Effort Aims to Use Biomarkers to Pinpoint PTSD
description: Is post-traumatic stress disorder underdiagnosed or overdiagnosed?

title: Look of The Moment | Catherine, the Duchess of Cambridge
description: The Look: Brocade Brigade. A paisley coatdress breaks out the bubbly, and an envelope-style clutch goes for the gold.

title: Keeping Score: Good Bullpen and Good Luck Keep Orioles in the Race
description: The Baltimore Orioles have no business being in a playoff race. A team that is near the bottom of the American League in batting and pitching, the Orioles are in a position to win one of the leagues two wild-card spots and only three games behind the first-place Yankees in their division. With 10 more wins, they will clinch the teams first winning record since 1997.

title: The Slow Reveal on Globalization
description: NEW YORK  In my column this week, I complain that the economic debate in the United States  and, for that matter, in Europe, too  is being fought in the 20th century. My point is that todays clash of ideas  which is real, and welcome  is being waged without enough regard for the changed facts on the ground in the 21st century.

title: Struggling Gleacher & Co. Explores a Sale
description: Gleacher & Company, the struggling investment bank started by the longtime Wall Street deal maker Eric Gleacher, has put itself up for sale.

title: Orthographic Misstep Disrupts Political Campaign
description: The words negro and neighbor both begin with ne and have a g and an r and an o somewhere later on.

title: A Chance to Paint Where OKeeffe Did
description: The artist Georgia OKeeffe made the high desert landscape around her home in Abiquiu, N.M., famous through her paintings of cottonwood trees and rock formations. Now less celebrated artists can bring their own art supplies and sketch or paint in her figurative shoes for one day, Sept. 24.

title: App From The A.P. Gets Ad Campaign
description: One of the most robust advertising categories these days is media, as companies like Time Warner, Viacom, News Corporation, Disney, CBS and Discovery Communications promote their television, film and other entertainment products and properties.

title: An Agnostics Guide to Marriage
description: WHEN my husband, Fred, and I planned our wedding, he had two strong opinions: 1) brisket should be served, along with the fried chicken; and 2) we would recite the Lords Prayer in the ceremony.

title: With Speech, Ryan May Have Helped Himself More Than Romney
description: TAMPA, Fla.  By every measure  the cheers in the hall, the praise from commentators across the country, the elation among aides to Mitt Romney  Representative Paul D. Ryans speech accepting the vice-presidential nomination was a hit. He aggressively framed the campaign against President Obama, signaled that he, unlike some previous vice-presidential candidates, had no compunctions about leading the attack, and anchored Mr. Romney in a conservative school of thought that has come to define the Republican Party.

title: Meet the Parents
description: TAMPA, Fla.In her convention speech last night, Condoleezza Rice said the essence of America is the idea that you can come from humble circumstances and do great things. That it doesnt matter where you came from but where you are going.

title: Revolutionary Inroads
description: To Robert Sullivan, history is not so much a collection of dates and facts but actual places you can revisit  layers of geography that can be excavated one by one. Sullivans seventh book, My American Revolution (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $26), chronicles his quest through some of Americas chaotic birthplaces, parts of New Jersey and New York where forgotten battles still haunt the landscape. His journey begins at the top of the Empire State Building, where Sullivan looks into the distance and sees greater New York as a palimpsest of the Revolution, a painted-over canvas of ancient routes walked smooth. . . .

title: Memories Of The Bush Administration
description: John Updike once wrote a novel titled Memories of the Ford Administration; it was largely about sex in the era after the sexual revolution but before the microbes.

title: How to Propose the Pogue Way
description: Two weeks ago, I proposed. To the sweetest, funniest, wisest woman Ive ever known.

title: A Quiet, Modest Brooklynite
description: LATE summer twilight on Carlton Avenue, faint hurrahs from the family reunion in the pastors backyard, firefighters lobbing a football outside Engine 210.

title: Threat to Syrian Civilians Is Growing, Officials Say
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Human rights workers and diplomats said Thursday that Syrias military was increasingly relying on indiscriminate air power to crush the insurgency, as top United Nations officials attending a special Security Council session reported alarming new data on the severity of the crisis, including a doubling in the number of civilians who need emergency aid.

title: The Getaway: Shoes for the Road
description: Columnist Stephanie Rosenbloom seeks out tips on comfortable shoes for travel and finds the best advice from flight attendants, experts at striding in style.

title: A Tablet That Moves Closer to Becoming a Laptop
description: The French electronics company Archos is hoping to bolster its presence in the United States with a new line of Android tablets that include an integrated keyboard.

title: A Music Player for Soapy Singers
description: If your singing in the shower requires accompaniment, you can use the iShower wireless speaker to bring music from your Bluetooth-equipped phone or music player along.

title: The Ryan Record and the Ryan Speech
description: Two weeks ago, I wrote a trio of posts analyzing Paul Ryans record as a policy entrepreneur in the Obama era. My overarching argument was that he deserves substantial credit for pushing his party toward substance and away from the pathologies of the post-Bush moment; that he deserves credit, as well, for putting forward his own ideas and proposals on issues where he hadnt yet brought the entire party on board; and that he deserves particular credit for his willingness to offer up multiple iterations of his signature entitlement reform idea, tweaking and rewriting and partnering with Democrats in an effort to make his proposals more plausible and marketable.

title: A Tig Notaro Primer
description: In this weeks Talk, the comedian Tig Notaro recountshow she lost her mother, was given a diagnosis of breast cancer and broke up with her girlfriend in quick succession  and how she turned the worst four months of her life into material for a show at the Largo in Los Angeles last month.

title: 36 Hours in Sofia, Bulgaria
description: FIRST came the Thracians, about 2,700 years ago, followed by the Romans, the Byzantine Empire, the Ottoman Turks and then the Communists. These days  more than two decades after the fall of the Iron Curtain, and five years after joining the European Union  the Bulgarian capital is finally coming into its own. In place of the old Lenin monument, a statue of Sofias patron saint now stands tall  a dark princess that somehow embodies the citys East-meets-West, old-meets-new allure. Under her gaze, a youthful, creative energy displays itself as Sofia angles for the title of European Capital of Culture 2019.

title: Scenes From Sofia, Bulgaria
description: See a secret hangout during the Communist regime and more in this tour of the Bulgarian capital.

title: U.S. Open Food of the Day: Vegetable Curry Combo
description: This is another in the daily series of food reviews from the United States Open concession stands.

title: Chicagos Meal-Market Hybrids
description: CHICAGOS culinary scene has in the last year and a half been enlivened by big-name chefs: Grant Achatz, Jean-Georges Vongerichten and Michael Shrader have all opened restaurants in that time. But you dont have to make a reservation to sample the best in local cuisine. Lately, a number of hybrid restaurant-specialty markets have popped up, catering to customers who hope that, armed with the same spice rub, they can recreate a chefs dishes at home.

title: In Police Shooting of Miners, South Africa Charges Miners
description: LUANDA, Angola  Two weeks after the police opened fire on a crowd of 3,000 workers engaged in a wildcat strike at a platinum mine near Johannesburg, killing 34 people in the bloodiest labor unrest since the end of apartheid, prosecutors are bringing murder charges against a surprising set of suspects: the miners themselves.

title: U.S. Open: Who's Next in Women's Tennis?
description: Kim Clijsters is retiring and the Williams sisters are nearing the end of their careers. Who will fill the void in Women's tennis? Lynn Zinser reports from Flushing.

title: Video: Whos Next in Womens Tennis?
description: (function($){var data = chameleonData;var ticker = new NYTD.NYTMM.NewsTicker($('#nytmm_embed_690'), data);})(jQuery||NYTD.jQuery);

title: Jobs Outlook Remains Tepid
description: This weeks economic data has come in broadly as expected, leaving the forecasters at Moodys Analytics to continue to forecast that job growth will be slower in August  but still faster than it was in the spring. The latest post on Moodys Dismal Scientist blog explains:

title: Court Blocks Texas Voter ID Law, Citing Racial Impact
description: WASHINGTON  A federal court on Thursday struck down a Texas law that would have required voters to show government-issued photo identification before casting their ballots in November, ruling that the law would hurt turnout among minority voters and impose strict, unforgiving burdens on the poor by charging those voters who lack proper documentation fees to obtain election ID cards.

title: In Tampa, the Obama Campaign Has Its Own War Room
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The awning over the door says American Institute of Architects.

title: Apples Are Earlier, But Not as Red or Crunchy
description: Apples are in the Greenmarket earlier, thanks to the longer, warmer summer. But the fruit is likely to have less crunch and skins colored rose, peach or lemon, rather than red. The heat affects color and texture, but not flavor.

title: GLAAD Gives Networks Passing Grade for TV Portrayals of Gays
description: Most of the broadcast networks are satisfactorily portraying gays and lesbians on television, a leading media advocacy group said in a report released on Thursday.

title: Amazon Hints About Fires Sales Success
description: On the eve of its introduction of new tablets next Thursday, Amazon is putting out of print the original Kindle Fire it introduced a year ago.

title: Send Us Your First-Day-of-School Photos
description: There is something amazing and painful about revisiting your first-day-of-school photos. Its not just the parade of bad clothes and worse hairstyles. Its the fact that those clothes and hairstyles were chosen so carefully, so deliberately, in an effort to make you look your absolute best for your first new-year impression. Like the engagement ring flashed ostentatiously at a college reunion, those loafers or baby-doll dresses or No Fear shirts were your way to signal to your classmates how far youd come since they saw you last and how this year would be different. To see that striving and posturing laid bare with the curse of hindsight can be a trying exercise in humility.

title: Inspectors Confirm New Work by Iran at Secure Nuclear Site
description: WASHINGTON  Iran has installed three-quarters of the nuclear centrifuges it needs to complete a site deep underground for the production of nuclear fuel, international inspectors reported Thursday, a finding that led the White House to warn that the window that is open now to resolve this diplomatically will not remain open indefinitely.

title: The China-U.S. Smartphone Gap Grows Larger
description: Smartphones are so popular here that its difficult to avoid seeing one, and in China, these devices are poised to become even more widespread.

title: At Gazprom, Views Conflict on Viability of Barents Sea Gas Project
description: MOSCOW  Gazprom, the Russian energy company, has long presented the Shtokman field in the Barents Sea as the jewel in the crown of its natural gas reserves, a find that might hold enough gas to meet global demand for a year.

title: N.F.L. and Union Agree to Change in Injured Reserve Rule
description: The N.F.L. and the players union agreed Thursday to a change to the injured reserve rules and a move of the trade deadline that owners first approved in the spring.

title: Rescue Fund Is Sufficient, Spains Leader Asserts
description: MADRID  The Spanish prime minister, Mariano Rajoy, sought to reassure markets on Thursday that Spain could meet the financial obligations of its troubled regions despite word from Valencia that it would require 1 billion more euros in rescue money than it requested in July.

title: Telluride Film Festival Announces Lineup
description: The Telluride Film Festival, keeping with its practice, made a last-minute announcement of the program for its proceedings, which begin in Colorado on Friday and continue through Monday. The festival includes 25 documentary and narrative films, like the Cannes Palme dOr winner Amour, from Michael Haneke; Midnights Children, based on the Salman Rushdie novel; and The Act of Killing, a nonfiction film in which former members of death squads in Indonesia re-enact their killings as if they were scenes from favorite films.

title: Contempt for the Mainstream
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The campaign platform adopted by the Republican party this week became instantly notorious for its plunge to the right, deleting all memory of moderation in previous years. The document might be even more remarkable, however, for its tone of utter defiance.

title: Lulu & Po
description: Inside the half-hidden restaurant on Carlton Avenue in Fort Greene, Brooklyn.

title: Market Research Firm Dampens Its Forecast for Facebook
description: Courage to those who try to read the tea leaves about the future of Facebook.

title: Adaptation of Jonathan Franzen Essay Heads to Stage
description: House for Sale, a play adapted from an essay by Jonathan Franzen, is coming to Off Broadway.

title: The Honor of a Partners Presence
description: I received a promotion at work, and my boss proposed a celebratory dinner with my partner and me. I feel obliged to accept, but my partner does not care for my boss and has refused to go. I told my boss that I would be delighted to dine with him, but my partner could not attend. He then became insistent that my partner join us. I honor my partners wishes first, and am put off by my bosss determination. How do I decline again, firmly and politely, and maintain good relations with him? Or is there another solution? Nadine, Washington

title: The Get | Bonpoints Hi Panda Baby Pajamas
description: I really imagined this collection as a dash of humor to start the school year, says Christine Inammorato, the artistic director of Bonpoint. For fall, shes brought the insolent creatures of the contemporary Chinese artist Ji-Jis Hi Panda collection to an exclusive series of cotton tees for children and moms, plus these pajamas for infants (available Sept. 1). His now famous Evil Pandas are made even cuter  if thats possible  for the young and stylish with the addition of glasses, a book (how studious) and, of course, theFrench companys signature cherries. Lest we forget, though, the bespectacled icons, which the fashion world fell in love with at the artists 2010 Palais de Tokyo show, arent there to just look adorable. Innamorato explains, Ji-Ji gave them a true meaning: they reflect the passion, narcissism and endless search of identity of the Chinese generation born after 1980. Lesson learned.

title: Speech, Lies and Apathy
TimesCast Politics | August 29, 7 P.M.
description: Part one of Wednesday evening's broadcast of the Republican National Convention.

title: International Atomic Energy Agency Report on Iran
description: Iran has installed most of the centrifuges it needs to complete an underground site for the production of nuclear fuel, according to the International Atomic Energy Agency.

title: Johnson & Johnson Unit Settles State Cases Over Risperdal
description: Johnson & Johnson announced Thursday that its pharmaceutical unit had reached a $181 million consumer fraud settlement with 36 states and the District of Columbia over its marketing of Risperdal, an antipsychotic drug.

title: Border Crossing Identity Crisis
description: NORTH ADAMS, Mass.  As Marshall McLuhan once wrote about his homeland, Canada is the only country in the world that knows how to live without an identity, which makes Oh, Canada: Contemporary Art from North North America, at the Massachusetts Museum of Contemporary Art here, a challenging kind of survey to undertake. It is,after all, a country that has nurtured numerous international art stars and has plenty of government support for the arts but has not had a coast-to-coast biennial since 1989.

title: Fifth-Seeded Tsonga Is Upset; Fish Rallies to Win in Five Sets
description: After several days without bracket-rattling upsets, the United States Open got complicated on Thursday.

title: Taymor, Spider-Man Producers Reach Undisclosed Settlement on Dueling Lawsuits
description: 4:43 p.m. | Updated

title: Discipline and Indiscipline
description: Im having a meta kind of day, so heres another piece on the strangeness of whats going on in the GOP.

title: The Caucus Click: On Radio Row
Photo Replay: Aug. 30
description: A view of the day in sports, including the first day of the Paralympic Games in London.

title: A Good Season for the Mets, at Least in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA  Jon Niese fought gamely through the aftereffects of the flu, but he received little help from his teams ailing offense as the Mets lost to the Phillies, 3-2, on Thursday.

title: Quietly Ferocious Requiem for the Land
description: NEW HAVEN  A prophet in the wilderness of modernity, the photographer Robert Adams has devoted almost five decades to decrying what fecklessly industrious humans have done to the landscape of the American West.

title: Democrats Outline Convention Schedule
description: Just when it seemed as if there could not possibly be any more red, white and blue speeches ringing across the airways from the convention floor, the Democrats are unveiling their counterpunch to the Republican show that has been under way all week in Tampa.

title: Which Bug Repellent Is Best?
description: If your family is like ours, youll be spending time outdoors this Labor Day weekend. And if youre a mother like me (read: a worrier), youre well aware of news reports about the abundance of ticks this year, and about an increase in cases of West Nile virus in some parts of the country.

title: What Are You Cooking This Labor Day Weekend?
description: The last sunny days of August are upon us, a long weekend beckons, and theres still plenty of time to enjoy a good summer meal before autumn officially arrives.

title: Vain Glorious | True Blood?
description: Everyone thought it was complete insanity, admits Melanie Simon, the celebrity facialist, of her new Circ-Cell ABO Blood Serum, a somewhat eerily named eye gel said to mimic certain functions of human blood topically with the help of powerful perfluorocarbons. As we get older, our blood vessels break down and become increasingly unable to deliver nutrients to our tissues and metabolize waste, she says. ABO Blood is targeted to the under-eye area, specifically dark circles and puffy or crepe-y skin, but Simon slathers it over her entire face. Its especially great for city dwellers, she says. If you press it in after your skin-care regimen, it will lock in your products, protect your skin from the environment and feed it, all at the same time. $118; circcell.com.

title: Credit Suisse Hires Head of Canada Metals and Mining Unit
description: Credit Suisse has hired Matthew Hind as the head of its Canada metals and mining business in its investment banking department, the firm announced in an internal memorandum reviewed by DealBook. Mr. Hind, who will start his new position in December, is joining from Morgan Stanley.

title: Curiosity Visits Mars
description: NASAs Curiosity rover landed on Mars on Aug. 5, 2012, to begin a two-year mission to examine the planet.

title: At Baltimore Grand Prix, the Eyes Have It
description: BALTIMORE  For any motorsports fan who wonders how that pulse-quickening cockpit footage is captured, the answer involves 6 miles of fiber optic cable, 11 receiver stations, 24 radio cameras, an unused military radio frequency, a truckload of electrical generators and three trailers of studios.

title: As Barclays Retail Chief Rises, What of the Firms Investment Bank?
description: With the ascension of Antony Jenkins as Barclays new chief executive, attention will inevitably fall to the part of the British bank that has grown the fastest in recent years: its investment bank.

title: Chris Lighty, Manager of Hip-Hop Stars, Dies at 44
description: Chris Lighty, an influential manager of hip-hop stars like 50 Cent, LL Cool J, Missy Elliott and Diddy, was found dead on Thursday morning at his home in the Bronx, apparently from a self-inflicted gunshot wound. He was 44.

title: N.H.L. Union Plans Response to League Proposal
description: The N.H.L. Players Association will respond on Friday to the leagues latest offer for a new collective bargaining agreement, the union said in a statement Thursday, just days ahead of a Sept. 15 lockout promised by N.H.L. Commissioner Gary Bettman if a new agreement is not in place.

title: You Sent Me Packing  to California
description: Thanks to all for your suggestions for where I should visit for the magazines Food & Drink issue. After much consideration and brain-racking, and reading through hundreds of your e-mails and comments, Ive decided to travel to Californias San Joaquin Valley next week; I could think of no place more exotic  or at least foreign  to which I might do a little justice in the short time I have. Many of you asked that I stay in America rather than venture abroad. The valley is the most important food center in the United States (and among the most important in the world), and it gets short shrift, largely because we tend to see it as industrial, monolithic, ugly and uninteresting. Though it has elements of all of those things (except the uninteresting), it has the opposites as well. Im hoping to take a look at both extremes as well as the middle, through people, the land, the crops and animals, and of course through cooking.

title: Mr. Romney Reinvents History
description: Mitt Romney wrapped the most important speech of his life, for Thursday nights session of his convention, around an extraordinary reinvention of history  that his party rallied behind President Obama when he won in 2008, hoping that he would succeed. That president was not the choice of our party, he said. We are a good and generous people who are united by so much more than divides us.

title: Chinese Citys Retirees Given a License to Ticket
description: BEIJING  Imagine what might happen if civilians were given the power to issue tickets for minor traffic violations and other quality-of-life infractions  and keep 80 percent of the fines.

title: Slave Potters Presence Emerges in Fragments
description: Newly discovered vessels by David Drake, an enslaved 19th-century potter in Edgefield, S.C., keep emerging, either whole or in shards.

title: River-to-River Views, on a Budget
description: IN the spring, after four years of college and two years working in Denver, Chris Bauer landed a job in New York. So he packed up, left much of his stuff at his parents house in the Boston suburbs, and started work.

title: Freewheeling Musician Gets Free-Form Tribute
description: Not far into Ornette: Made in America, Shirley Clarkes kaleidoscopic film portrait of the saxophonist and composer Ornette Coleman, is a scene in which Mr. Coleman sits on the porch of his childhood home in Fort Worth. Hes talking with his son, Denardo, about the imperative of original artistic expression and how it survives both the barbs of ungenerous critics and the bile of envious peers.

title: Still in Fashion, a Century Later
description: THE soft sea breezes make the Brooklyn Heights Promenade, overlooking New York Harbor, a transcendent summer sunset stroll. But get there an hour early for a sultry saunter down the flanking street, Columbia Heights, especially the block between Clark and Pierrepont Streets. A century ago this dead end was the most fashionable street in Brooklyn, and houses with water views now trade for $10 million.

title: With Spirit and Variety, A Festival Unfolds Anew
description: Bargemusics Here and Now Labor Day Festival is a motley but spirited new-music celebration that brings together composers of all stripes and draws some of the biggest crowds the barge gets all season. Listeners dont always know what they are in for. Though an overall schedule is published on the barges Web site, on each of the festivals four nights  it runs through Sunday  the performers and works are juggled anew for each program.

title: Staying Power
description: Christopher Hitchens began his memoir, Hitch-22, on a note of grim amusement at finding himself described in a British National Portrait Gallery publication as the late Christopher Hitchens. He wrote, So there it is in cold print, the plain unadorned phrase that will one day become unarguably true.

title: Fear-of-China Syndrome
description: Ah. Lets give thanks to Rob Portman, who offered a nice break from all the lies in Tampa, and instead offered us some good old-fashioned bad macroeconomics.

title: Under an African Sky, Gazing Up With Awe
description: WASHINGTON  When the sun sets in rural Africa, the world changes. Temperatures drop. New scents rise as street dust settles and cooking fires start. Markets empty, voices quiet down. Bodies and eyes that struggled all day with heat and glare relax and move toward sleep.

title: The Torment of High-End Decorators
description: YES, real estate is ultimately about location and price. But at the high end, marketing counts for a lot, too.

title: Q & A
description: Getting Back a Co-op Deposit

title: Eyes on Bottom Line, Canoeists Ponder Rio
description: Eric Hurd has been an elite-level athlete for more than a decade. He and Jeff Larimer make up the fastest slalom canoe doubles team in the United States; they finished 12th at the London Olympics. Yet their athletic future is hardly secure.

title: Downsizing the Jumbo Loan
description: WITH interest rates still low, many homeowners have been saying goodbye to their jumbo mortgages and refinancing into conventional loans. They may need to write sizable checks at the closing, but in the end they are likely to reduce their monthly payments while improving their cash flow.

title: Hudson River School Art Trail
description: Following the expanded trail and comparing the paintings of the past with the views of the present.

title: African Cosmos: Stellar Arts
description: Images from the new exhibition at the National Museum of African Art in Washington.

title: The Mudroom Gets a Revival
description: A WRAPAROUND porch curves around the front door of an old Bridgehampton, N.Y., farmhouse that Pamela Glazer, an architect based in Southhampton, renovated and enlarged last year. But that formal entrance is seldom used. Instead, just beyond the porch, Ms. Glazer designed a more utilitarian foyer  a mudroom  with a glass-paned exterior door with its own stoop where family and friends go in and out.

title: Following the Artists Who Followed the Hudson
description: THE landscape painters of Americas first homegrown art movement, the Hudson River School, hauled easels, sketchbooks and pigment-filled pig bladders as they picked their way along cliffs vulnerable to avalanches and across mucky shores.

title: A Neighborhood Built From Scratch
description: TO most Manhattanites, Long Island City brings to mind a waterfront with soaring glass towers, reclaimed gantries and a neon-infused Pepsi sign. But farther inland, in another section surrounding a neo-Classical-style courthouse, a residential neighborhood is being created.

title: Before Romneys Big Speech, a Focus on Bain
description: As Mitt Romney prepares to take the stage at the Republican National Convention on Thursday night to make his case for the presidency, his record at Bain Capital continues to be a focus  some might say the focus  of both his supporters and detractors.

title: Up Front
description: Over the years, Judith Martin has become recognized as Americas most entertaining and informative arbiter of etiquette, and was even recognized as such with the National Humanities Medal. Born, as her Miss Manners Web site has it, a perfect lady in an imperfect society, she continues to contend, through her books and her newspaper and Internet columns, with the gamut of social discourse and recourse  an activity that also deeply engaged the novelist Edith Wharton, whose fictional portrait by Jennie Fields she reviews this week.

title: Ryans Night at the Convention Draws About 20 Million Viewers
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Representative Paul D. Ryans speech to the Republican National Convention on Wednesday night drew roughly 20 million viewers, a decline from the 37 million who viewed Sarah Palins speech after she was selected as Senator John McCains running mate in 2008, according to Nielsen Media Research.

title: Auction Provocateur
description: Men will bid as much for a Jabugo ham as a gold Rolex, declares Fabien Naudan, the associate director of the Paris auction house Artcurial. I want to have a 360-degree view of what our client might be interested in, from a bottle of wine to an office set by Herms  the whole domestic landscape! Lets try to open things up  lets make it wide!

title: Finding a Musical Crossroads Onstage
description: Lisa Gerrard would not be swayed when Dead Can Dance played the Beacon Theater on Wednesday night. Fans shouted her name between songs; she replied only with a serene smile. When she sang, the lyrics were in her own invented language. Dressed in a long black dress and a golden cape, standing before a hammered dulcimer, she was an emanation from earlier times, even though she was flanked by synthesizers.

title: DogTV: Species Tune In, Then Drop Out
description: Cross-species experimentation can be dangerous, as Syfy channel movies like Piranhaconda and Sharktopus have made clear. And yet if a journalist isnt willing to court danger in pursuit of truth, what good is he?

title: Race for Gas by Cypriot Rivals Adds to Tensions
description: SINIRUSTU, Cyprus  The island of Cyprus, split by one of Europes most intractable ethnic conflicts, is now the focus of another contest, over who will control the significant natural gas wealth found in nearby waters. The question is whether the gas discovery will become an incentive for the two sides to cooperate, or yet another obstacle to reunification of the island.

title: A Band Sprawls Its Way Across Genres on a Rigorous Wavelength All Its Own
description: Zs is a band; its also a perpetual itch, an index of unease around the restrictions of genre in New York experimental music.

title: How Do You Say Abstract Expressionism in German?
description: A media agency has brought together two clients, an airline and a museum, for an unusual campaign.

title: Dominant Against Familiar Foe, Sock Advances to Third Round
description: A month ago, the American teenager Jack Sock lost to Flavio Cipolla of Italy, 6-3, 6-1, in Los Angeles. A different Jack Sock showed up on Thursday at the United States Open.

title: Spare Times for Children for Aug. 31-Sept. 6
description: RICHMOND COUNTY FAIR

title: The Sea, Seen Through the Eyes of Dutch Painters, in Haarlem
description: In the waning days of summer, thoughts often turn to the sea. For those near Amsterdam, the distinguished De Hallen Haarlem museum, only 20 minutes from the city, can get their last dose of the season by taking in a major show about the sea in Dutch art since 1850, through Sunday. Dutch artists have always been drawn to it as a subject, whether depicting sea battles, coastal scenes or shipwrecks, changing their styles and perspectives according to their period.

title: Finding Drama in Newfangled Filmmaking
description: There are quarrels that are certain to be provoked by Chris Kenneallys new documentary, Side by Side, which explores the impact of digital technology on 21st-century moviemaking, but one thing is beyond argument. For a film geek this movie is absolute heaven, a dream symposium in which directors, cinematographers, editors and a few actors gather to opine on the details of their craft. It is worth a year of film school and at least 1,000 hours of DVD bonus commentary.

title: The Great Divide
description: Im not going to lie; there are easier people to share a closet with. People who wouldnt flinch at the idea of hanging more than one shirt on a coat hanger; people who could forgive an ad hoc filing system, one that, say, mixed colors with neutrals, formalwear with casual wear, or  heaven forbid  anything sequined next to anything silk. (The risk of snagging? Who does that?)

title: A Note to Readers
description: Arthur S. Brisbanes tenure as public editor will end on Aug. 31. His final column appeared in print on Aug 26.

title: Comedy Listings for Aug. 31-Sept. 6
description: Comedy

title: I Will, He Said: Romneys Campaign Promises
description: Even before Mitt Romney stepped on stage at the Republican National Convention, he had promised a lot to voters.

title: A To-Do List for Romneys Speech
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The list of things Mitt Romney has to do in his address to the Republican National Convention on Thursday night is a long one.

title: Undersize Qualifiers Roll Comes to an End
description: For Tim Smyczek, a 24-year-old qualifier from Milwaukee, a fifth win at the 2012 United States Open proved too much to ask Thursday.

title: This Subway Series Is About Commerce, Not Baseball
description: A fast-food chain known for its ardent embrace of branded entertainment, embedding its products and restaurants in episodes of television series, is commissioning a series of its own, to be watched on a Web site where consumers watch TV shows.

title: Movie Listings for Aug. 31-Sept. 6
description: Movies

title: Taking Steps Into the Future
description: Over the past several years choreographers have been rethinking what constitutes a stage. The more options, the better, which is why the new BAM Fisher building at the Brooklyn Academy of Music was designed with a flexible 250-seat theater in which choreographers and others can do whatever they want, however they want.

title: Pictures of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Syria, Jordan, Iran and Afghanistan.

title: Pop Listings for Aug. 31-Sept. 6
description: Pop

title: Live Updates From the Republican National Convention
description: The Times will be providing updates and analysis from Tampa on our live dashboard. You can also follow along on Twitter @thecaucus, or follow our list of Times journalists covering the convention.

title: Base Turnout Strategy May Be Too Narrow for Romney
description: Mitt Romneys strategy once seemed self-evident. First, skewer President Obama over the tepid economic recovery. Second, lean just enough to the center over the course of the fall campaign so you wont lose because of social issues, temperament and tone, controversial proposals about the welfare state or other things that might distract voters from your economic message.

title: Jazz Listings for Aug. 31-Sept. 6
description: Jazz

title: Talk Is Cheap, Unless, of Course, Its Dirty
description: The enterprising New York women who establish a flourishing phone sex business in the boundary-breaking farce For a Good Time, Call ... know how to talk the talk. But can they walk the walk? The running joke of this fizzy, potty-mouthed comedy, directed by Jamie Travis, is that anyone with an erotic imagination  even the nicest of nice girls  can talk dirty and make money at it.

title: Roberts Leaves Good Morning America for Medical Treatment
description: Starting Friday, ABCs Good Morning America  which has surged ahead of the Today show in recent weeks to become the No. 1 morning television show in America  will be without its biggest star, Robin Roberts.

title: Classical Music and Opera Listings for Aug. 31-Sept. 6
description: Classical

title: The Moderate Fringe
description: TAMPA, Fla.As the G.O.P. has moved from compassionate conservatism to the severe conservatism of Mitt Romney, from Rockefeller Republicans to the Tea Party, from Richard Nixon, who called himself a Keynesian, to Paul Ryan, a Hayekian, viewpoints that once seemed to fit under the partys big tent seem out of place. That tent also seems closed to socially progressive opinions rapidly gaining acceptance in America at large.

title: Convention Fashion
description: August 28, 2012 - Matt Stopera of Buzzfeed.com joins Marcus Mabry to discuss the fashion sense of  Republican National Convention delegates.

title: Dance Listings for Aug. 31-Sept. 6
description: Dance

title: An Interview Turns Unruly
description: TAMPA, Fla.  A confrontation between a television producer and Sheldon Adelsons daughter, captured on video, illustrates escalating tensions as the news media tries to scrutinize the mega-donors who are pouring millions into the presidential race.

title: After the Open, Retirement for Roddick
description: Andy Roddick celebrated two seemingly contradictory milestones Thursday. The first was his 30th birthday. The second was his impending retirement.

title: This Weeks Movies | Aug. 31, 2012
description: The New York Times critics on The Flying Swords of Dragon Gate, For a Good Time, Call ... " and Side by Side.

title: Representative Tom Price on Health Care
description: August 30, 2012 - A discussion with Representative Tom Price on the Republican's health care plan.

title: U.S. Approves an Initial Step in Oil Drilling Near Alaska
description: WASHINGTON  The Interior Department granted Shell permission on Thursday to begin preparatory work on its first well in the Arctic Ocean, moving the company a critical step forward on its tortuous quest to drill for oil off the coast of Alaska.

title: Museum and Gallery Listings for Aug. 31-Sept. 6
description: Art

title: Theater Listings for Aug. 31-Sept. 6
description: Theater

title: Lawrence Mead Jr., Aerospace Engineer, Dies at 94
description: Lawrence Mead Jr., the aerospace engineer who led the design team for the A-6 Intruder, the bulky twin-engine jet that served as the Navys primary attack bomber for more than three decades, died on Aug. 23 in New Haven. He was 94.

title: Oh, Canada
description: Images from an exhibition at Mass MoCA in North Adams, Mass.

title: Apple Rejects App Tracking Drone Strikes
description: This month, the British newspaper The Guardian ran an interactive map of American drone strikes, pinpointing the locations in Pakistan where missiles from the unmanned aerial vehicles struck suspected terrorists. The map, which was based on data from the Bureau of Investigative Journalism in Britain, was available through The Guardians app for the iPhone, as well as its Web site.

title: Labor Day Weekend Events, Aug. 31-Sept. 3
description: Labor Day Weekend

title: Ashley Parker on Ryans Speech
description: August 30, 2012  Ashley Parker breaks down Paul Ryans address to the Republican National Convention.

title: The Art of Illumination in the Industrial Age
description: Before there were energy summit meetings and wind farms, clean tech and a green economy, there was electricity. And it was exciting  electrifying even (although the Oxford English Dictionary says that adjective wasnt used outside science until 1807).

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Drone-Tracker App, and Social Media Crime Fighters
description: Some interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web recently. See more here.

title: Shopping for the Classroom
description: Carol School Supply in Fresh Meadows, Queens, which has been in business for 48 years, is a popular destination for teachers and students all over the city.

title: At Convention, Lines Blur for Party and Super PACs
description: TAMPA, Fla.  For more than a year, the 2012 campaign has featured two Republican Parties: the official one of candidates, party leaders and elected lawmakers, and the unofficial one of super PACs and other outside groups raising and spending tens of millions of dollars to help the Republicans win in November.

title: SAIC Plans Two-Way Split
description: The Science Applications International Corporation said on Thursday that it planned to cleave itself into two publicly traded companies, becoming the latest in a string of corporate breakups.

title: The Attack Ad, Pompeii-Style
description: Decorah, Iowa

title: After a Life of Exile, Hes Taking on an Unusual Line of Work
description: For a teenager stuck in a juvenile detention center, diverted by swimming and subjected to strip searches, 19-year-old Roman does not exactly choose a low-impact job for his work-release program. We first see him freaking out at a welding task in the opening scene, and the reaction of his parole officer shows that Roman has willingly botched previous attempts at gainful employment. After all that, the sulky boy  as a ward of the state from an early age, he has a childs blinkered life experience  decides to apprentice at the Vienna city morgue.

title: Seven Held Briefly in Anti-Romney Protest
description: TAMPA, Fla.  On the last day of the Republican National Convention, the authorities took into custody seven people who had blocked a roadway Thursday outside a power plant on the eastern edge of Tampa Bay.

title: Yale University President Is Stepping Down
description: After 20 years at the helm, Richard C. Levin, the president of Yale University, announced on Thursday that he will be leaving the Ivy League school at the end of the academic year, our colleague Richard Prez-Pea reports:

title: Tornadoes and Eunuchs on the Really Big Screen
description: For a movie thats all about the new  the first Chinese-language production in Imax 3-D!  Tsui Harks Flying Swords of Dragon Gate is surprisingly old-fashioned. It seems to be having an argument with itself: the dazzling but often antiseptic immersiveness of the viewing experience is countered by storytelling suffused with nostalgia for a simpler, messier, livelier period in Chinese film.

title: Ever Loyal, Stocking Up for School
description: Robert Salgado needed a record book to keep track of his Far Rockaway third graders in Queens. JacquelineMarshall sought language learning cards for her special education students in the Bronx. Dina Fecentese hoped a No Bully Zone poster would encourage harmony in her fourth grade in Howard Beach, Queens.

title: Oh, for a Nice Internist Who Makes House Calls
description: Heaven forbid that anyone should have the misfortune to be treated by a physician like Martin Blake (Orlando Bloom), the poker-faced new resident in internal medicine at a Southern California hospital in The Good Doctor.

title: Majority of New Jobs Pay Low Wages, Study Finds
description: While a majority of jobs lost during the downturn were in the middle range of wages, a majority of those added during the recovery have been low paying, according to a new report from the National Employment Law Project.

title: Fate of the Capitol Dome
description: To the Editor:

title: Ryans Speech Echoed in a Super PAC Ad
description: One of the biggest lines Representative Paul D. Ryan of Wisconsin uncorked during his acceptance speech Wednesday night was his appeal to the disaffected young voters who were once among President Obamas staunchest supporters.

title: Wishing On, and Seeking Out, a Star
description: The optimism and good humor of John Lavins crude, endearing documentary Hollywood to Dollywood are so unquenchable that its disturbing underlying theme  growing up gay in the South is no picnic  is partly obscured by its openheartedness. The subjects, Gary and Larry Lane, are gay identical twins in their mid-30s from a Southern Baptist background who grew up in a small North Carolina town and moved to Los Angeles a decade ago.

title: New Arrest Amid Inquiry on Hacking
description: LONDON  Police officials investigating phone hacking by journalists at Rupert Murdochs British newspapers arrested a man on Thursday who was identified in news reports as Tom Crone, a former senior lawyer for the newspapers.

title: G.O.P. Balances Ticket With a Picture of Diversity
description: TAMPA, Fla.  They had Ann Romneys tuna and pasta dinners and her Welsh mining grandfather, Paul Ryans mother on the bus, Tim Pawlentys truck-driving father, and Susana Martinez, growing up on the border and living paycheck to paycheck.

title: Reacting to Ryans Acceptance Speech
description: To the Editor:

title: On to Mars? Well, Were Already There
description: To the Editor:

title: Koch Opens Up About His Financing of Super PACs
description: TAMPA, Fla.  David H. Koch, the billionaire oil executive and conservative philanthropist, does not often speak publicly about his political life.

title: Egypts Leader in Tehran
description: To the Editor:

title: Harvard Says 125 Students May Have Cheated on a Final Exam
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  Harvard University revealed Thursday what could be its largest cheating scandal in memory, saying that about 125 students might have worked in groups on a take-home final exam despite being explicitly required to work alone.

title: Campaigns Hit the Road for Labor Day Weekend
description: So where to from here?

title: Unjustified Arrests
description: To the Editor:

title: Hopes Raised, Roma in France Still Face a Date With the Bulldozer
description: STAINS, France  Half-obscured by a tangle of scrap metal, battered home appliances and trash, a campaign poster for President Franois Hollande hangs on the outer wall of Adriana Dragois lean-to in a squalid encampment of ethnic Roma here, in the poor suburbs north of Paris.

title: A Child and a Box. What Could Go Wrong?
description: Malevolent boxes abound in horror movies (the Rubiks Cube-like container of Hellraiser being one of the most memorable), their contents inevitably wreaking havoc on humankind. The ratty receptacle in The Possession is no different: scooped up at a yard sale by Emily (Natasha Calis), the younger of two daughters toughing out the tension between their divorced parents, this particular box wastes no time releasing its inhuman contents.

title: A Small-Town Buzz About the Missing
description: Strange and sneaky and driven by a fury that only slowly reveals itself, The Tall Man opens like a ghost story and closes with its feet firmly in the real world. Until then, Pascal Laugiers chilly little thriller manhandles our sympathies and gladdens our eyes in almost equal measure.

title: Three Georgia Soldiers Face Death Penalty in Killings
description: ATLANTA  Prosecutors will seek the death penalty against three soldiers in Georgia accused of killing a fellow soldier and his girlfriend and plotting terrorist attacks at their own military base.

title: Snedeker Nearing End of a Tense Marathon
description: NORTON, Mass.  Brandt Snedeker was finished with his pro-am round at the Deutsche Bank Championship by noon on Thursday. Instead of hitting balls for at least an hour on the range, as he normally would, Snedeker practiced his putting for less than 30 minutes and then left T.P.C. Boston to rest for his Friday morning pairing with Tiger Woods and Nick Watney.

title: New Hope for Turnaround at Troubled Service Academy
description: Placing his hand on a Bible, wearing the gold shoulder boards that had been pinned on him moments before, Rear Adm. James A. Helis looked out at several hundred uniformed students last month and took the oath of office as the new leader of the United States Merchant Marine Academy. He was the fourth person to do so in the last four years.

title: The Medicare Killers
description: Paul Ryans speech Wednesday night may have accomplished one good thing: It finally may have dispelled the myth that he is a Serious, Honest Conservative. Indeed, Mr. Ryans brazen dishonesty left even his critics breathless.

title: No Bullet, but Plenty of Questions
description: In Lo Chi-leungs entertaining 1930s-era policier, The Bullet Vanishes, theres been a killing at an arms factory in Tiancheng Province, China. To find the culprit, two detectives are summoned: the wise, middle-aged and slightly eccentric Song Donglu (Lau Ching-wan), a forensic investigator and expert in criminal psychology; and the handsome Guo Zhui (Nicholas Tse), the fastest gun in Tiancheng, as he is called more than once.

title: Selected Excerpts of Morsis Speech
description: Excerpts from the speech by President Mohamed Morsi of Egypt at the meeting of the Nonaligned Movement in Tehran on Thursday, Aug. 30, 2012, as translated by The New York Times.

title: The Fallen in 1943 Get an Audience in 2012
description: Unlikely to arouse much interest beyond its niche audience of Americans affiliated with the military, the well-meaning but poorly realized documentary Until They Are Home celebrates the Joint POW/MIA Accounting Command (a k a JPAC) and its mission to repatriate the remains of those left behind on foreign soil.

title: Venus Williams Is Eliminated in Second Round
description: Kim Clijsterss singles career is over, Andy Roddick will retire after the United States Open and fans lost another Open darling early Friday morning when Venus Williams fell to Angelique Kerber of Germany, 6-2, 5-7, 7-5.

title: Where the Elite Meet (Open Bar, Anyone?)
description: At the bar, Tom Brokaw, the NBC News legend, sipped a martini and traded war stories with Dan Balz, the chief political correspondent for The Washington Post. A few tables over, Newt Gingrich and his wife, Callista, nibbled on bacon cheeseburgers and fries. By the front door, Mary Hart of Entertainment Tonight held court with Representative Darrell Issa of California, chairman of the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

title: An App for Couch Potatoes With Places to Go
description: THUMBING through printed television listings is a fading household pastime, but TV Guides digital business is hoping to start a new habit with a mobile app that makes it simple for people to track their favorite shows and discover new ones.

title: Party of Strivers
description: America was built by materialistic and sometimes superficial strivers. It was built by pioneers who voluntarily subjected themselves to stone-age conditions on the frontier fired by dreams of riches. It was built by immigrants who crammed themselves into hellish tenements because they thought it would lead, for their children, to big houses, big cars and big lives.

title: Boise State Says Its Not Fazed by Ranking as Season Begins
description: BOISE, Idaho  No matter how high the expectations, Boise State Coach Chris Petersen remains staunch in his dismissal of preseason rankings.

title: Judge Rules Against Arbitration by a Delaware Court
description: A federal judge on Thursday ruled that sitting judges of Delawares Chancery Court cannot hold secret proceedings in business disputes by calling the proceedings arbitrations instead of trials.

title: Brazil Enacts Affirmative Action Law for Universities
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Brazils government has enacted one of the Western Hemispheres most sweeping affirmative action laws, requiring public universities to reserve half of their admission spots for the largely poor students in the nations public schools and vastly increase the number of university students of African descent across the country.

title: Court Grants New Trial, Citing a Detectives False Testimony in an Earlier Case
description: A federal appeals court in Manhattan ruled on Thursday that a man convicted of weapons possession should have been able to tell the jury that the main witness against him, a New York City police detective, had been found to have testified untruthfully in proceedings involving an unrelated gun case.

title: Priest Puts Blame on Some Victims of Sexual Abuse
description: A prominent Roman Catholic spiritual leader who has spent decades counseling wayward priests for the archdiocese provoked shock and outrage on Thursday as word spread of a recent interview he did with a Catholic newspaper during which he said that youngsters were often to blame when priests sexually abused them and that priests should not be jailed for such abuse on their first offense.

title: A Reporter Whos Part of the Story
description: TAMPA, Fla.  There were no fewer than five people pointing cameras at the man who from a distance resembled a scarecrow: tall and broad-shouldered with long, long arms.

title: Scheduling Losses to Start a Turnaround
description: SAVANNAH, Ga.  On a resplendent afternoon in late August, when no college football team in the country had yet lost and no player blessed with youthful confidence expected to, the Savannah State Tigers were immersed in a spirited practice peppered by the language of positivity: Good block. Nice tackle.

title: Deportation Nation
description: Newton Centre, Mass.

title: Low-Profile Victims Hard-Hit on Gulf Coast
description: PICAYUNE, Miss.  Seven years ago, 238 people were killed here in Mississippi by Hurricane Katrina. This year, Isaac killed just one here.

title: The Sexual Bully in Albany
description: The stories about Assemblyman Vito Lopez groping and demeaning female staff members are flooding out of the back rooms in Albany. Female former employees told The Times this week that Mr. Lopez had asked them not to wear a bra to work. He routinely commented on their clothes  skirts not short enough  and their physique, preferring that they be well endowed.

title: Justice for Voters in Texas and Florida
description: Republicans in Texas and Florida have been in the vanguard of the pernicious, widespread efforts to suppress voting by Hispanics and blacks. Fortunately, federal courts are seeing these efforts for what they are: a variation on the racist laws that disenfranchised millions before those tactics were outlawed by the Voting Rights Act.

title: M.T.A. Expands an Effort to Decrease Subway Trash
description: The evidence has piled beside turnstiles and beneath benches, along subway platforms where riders found nowhere else to place their coffee cups or apple cores and on the tracks where tattered newspapers and crushed bottles seem to have taken up permanent residence.

title: Is Teach for America Working?
Software Meant to Fight Crime Is Used to Spy on Dissidents
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Morgan Marquis-Boire works as a Google engineer and Bill Marczak is earning a Ph.D. in computer science. But this summer, the two men have been moonlighting as detectives, chasing an elusive surveillance tool from Bahrain across five continents.

title: Orrin Hatch on Medicare and Mormonism
description: Jonathan Weisman talks with Senator Orrin G. Hatch of Utah about Medicare, the Ryan budget plan and Mormonism.

title: No Charges Filed on Harsh Tactics Used by the C.I.A.
description: Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. announced Thursday that no one would be prosecuted for the deaths of a prisoner in Afghanistan in 2002 and another in Iraq in 2003, eliminating the last possibility that any criminal charges will be brought as a result of the brutal interrogations carried out by the C.I.A.

title: Al Jazeera, Seeking U.S. Viewers, Bets on Soccer
description: Al Jazeera, once known in the United States mostly for televising videos of Americans and others taken hostage in foreign countries, but now a serious presence as a worldwide network, is betting heavily on sports to win American viewers.

title: East Coast National Parks at Risk From Sea Levels Rise
description: Labor Day is summers last hurrah, and families from across the country will be flocking to the beach this weekend to soak in some final rays.

title: Jonathan Weisman on Medicare and Mormons
description: Marcus Mabry talks with Jonathan Weisman at the Republican National Convention about Mormonism and the Medicare issue.

title: Tata Motors Finds Success in Jaguar Land Rover
description: MUMBAI, India  This summer, Jaguar Land Rover cranked up production to 24 hours at its plant near Liverpool, England, adding 1,000 jobs to help meet demand for its hot-selling and acclaimed Range Rover Evoque. Now, the company is readying the release of its much-anticipated Jaguar F-Type roadster.

title: Lottery Numbers
Obama Team Sharpens Attacks on Rivals Character
description: WASHINGTON  As the Obama campaign heads into its convention next week, Democrats see openings both to fill in unpopular details of Mitt Romneys agenda left unsaid by Republicans in Tampa this week and to raise new questions about Mr. Romneys character after widespread criticism of misstatements by him and his running mate, Paul D. Ryan.

title: Jill Abramson on the Medias Role
description: Rick Berke and Jill Abramson reflect on the weeks events at the Republican National Convention and the role of the media and The New York Times.

title: Robson Popular Beyond Her Rank
description: In the weird world of tennis, what is so extraordinary about Laura Robson is just how normal she is.

title: After Pussy Riot Verdict, Christian Culture Warriors Run Riot in Moscow
description: Updated | Friday, 2:06 p.m. Apparently emboldened by the stiff prison sentences members of the Russian punk band Pussy Riot received this month for performing a profane anthem inside a Moscow cathedral, a handful of conservative, Russian Orthodox activists staged a series of audacious attacks on liberal Muscovites this week, all of them amply documented online.

title: Assembly Democrats Support Speaker Over Settlement
description: ALBANY  Assembly Democrats rallied around Speaker Sheldon Silver on Thursday, as he faced an inquiry into his handling of sexual harassment allegations made against a prominent lawmaker and continued attacks from a lawyer who represented some of the women.

title: Ron Reagan and Ron Paul
description: Tampa, Fla.Tonight the G.O.P. celebrates Ronald Reagan with a tribute to his presidency (and as a footnote will introduce a guy called Mitt Romney to voters.) Ron Paul supporters, who arent terribly happy with the party, are also invoking the Gipper.

title: Art Heyman, Star at Duke, Dies at 71
description: Art Heyman, a 6-foot-5 scoring force drafted No. 1 over all by the Knicks after leading Duke University to its first Final Four in 1963, winning national player of the year and starring in a central, combative role in the fierce rivalry between Duke and the University of North Carolina, died Monday in Florida. He was 71.

title: They Get Canned
description: FRIDAYS PUZZLE  Weve all been seriously frustrated by crossword puzzles, and yet we keep on doing them. What does that say about us, I wonder?

title: Carolyn Ryan on Romney's Speaking Style
description: Rick Berke talks with Carolyn Ryan about Mitt Romney's speaking style and his speech at the Republican National Convention.

title: Instagram on the Campaign Trail
description: Ashley Parker discusses the role of Instagram and social media on the campaign trail and at the Republican National Convention.

title: Jeb Bush's R.N.C. Speech
description: Jeb Bush, the former governor of Florida and the brother of former President George W. Bush, speaks at the 2012 Republican National Convention.

title: Witness Describes Domination of Amish Leader
description: CLEVELAND  A sobbing daughter-in-law of Samuel Mullet Sr., the Amish leader on trial here with 15 followers for terrorizing the Amish of eastern Ohio with beard-cutting attacks, said on Thursday that Mr. Mullet had repeatedly called her into his bedroom for sex in 2008, at one point sending his wife to fetch her.

title: Jets Score First Touchdown of Preseason in Loss
description: PHILADELPHIA  Something amazing happened to the Jets 6 minutes 5 seconds into the second quarter on Thursday night: one of their players, Terrance Ganaway, breached the Eagles end zone while holding the football.

title: A Return to Doubles in Capping a Career
description: Spectators waited in lines for up to an hour Thursday trying to cram into the stands at Court 4, one of the smaller sites on the outskirts of the National Tennis Center, for a rare up-close glimpse of Kim Clijsters swatting balls over a net.

title: Emotional Ties to Obama May Be Central to the Election
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Through three nights of gauzy videos, sentimental testimonials and, finally, his own address to the nation Thursday, Mitt Romney worked hard to show he has a heart.

title: Romney Vows to Deliver Country From Economic Travails
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Mitt Romney accepted the Republican presidential nomination on Thursday by making a direct appeal to Americans who were captivated by President Obamas hopeful promises of change, pledging that he could deliver what the president did not and move the country from its worst economic downturn since the Great Depression.

title: Judge Rules Against Zoning Law on Sex-Related Businesses
description: A Manhattan judge on Thursday ruled that a 2001 city law was unconstitutional in seeking to reduce the number of stores and clubs that offer a mix of sexual content and other material in neighborhoods where X-rated establishments are banned.

title: Big Plans for the Future (Including a Roof, One Day)
description: The first four days of the United States Open unfolded without public protests from the players, without damage from a hurricane, with few upsets and only one brief rain delay. The biggest news was a pair of retirements  from Andy Roddick and Kim Clijsters  and for a tournament in transition, that was a good thing, a knock-on-wood thing.

title: Thriving Under New Management
description: Since Jaguar and Land Rover were bought by Tata Motors from Ford in 2008, the car companys sales and profits have risen.

title: Jeremy W. Peters on Fox News
description: Jeremy W. Peters talks about Fox News, Campaign Carl Cameron and media coverage at the Republican National Convention.

title: Richard Stevenson on Romneys Campaign
description: Rick Berke and The Timess Political Editor, Richard W. Stevenson, on Mitt Romneys push to November, Hurricane Isaac and covering the Republican National Convention on multiple platforms.

title: Holiday on Monday Labor Day
description: NEW YORK

title: Psychiatrist Questioned in Colorado Shootings
description: CENTENNIAL, Colo.  James E.
